title: Data Science and Analytics Director
desc:
We need your talents and passion. It’s more than just a job, it’s an opportunity. A great work environment and robust benefits program, with a Pension Plan AND 401k, enables employees to deliver a great customer experience.  
This position is responsible for oversight and strategic direction of advanced analytics, including predictive modeling, that drive business performance. Oversees research of new and innovative analytic tools and techniques. Monitors industry trends in analytics and investigates new concepts, ideas, and data sources.




Requirements: We are looking for a combination of someone who has led people, is strong technically, been exposed to different technologies (Machine Learning, Big Data, Hadoop, etc.) and has true data science (advanced predictive analytics and modeling).
Target skills…
Demonstrated communication skills, presence, polish, and awareness are what a Director would need.
Real deep in data science, techniques and technical expertise should be apparent.
We will be looking for text and sentiment analysis or random effects for advanced econometrics rather than general statements about analytics.
MS degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Engineering Actuarial Science or related field or equivalent designation, such as Fellowship of the Casualty Actuarial Society.
Deep data science and leadership experience, with the ability to lead strategy, architecture, development and integration of advanced analytics, driving business impact across the organization.

Capstone Search Group is a national search firm dedicated to the insurance industry. We are business partners to insurance organizations on staffing related projects. We work nationally with expertise that spans top executives, middle management and technical level positions. We are committed to providing recruiting services of the highest degree of confidentiality, professionalism and integrity.

title: Data Science Manager
desc:
Make your mark in Broadcasting and Digital Media. Sinclair Broadcast Group and Sinclair Digital Solutions are dedicated to making Sinclair a communications powerhouse! We are the largest and most diversified television broadcasting company in the country. Sinclair owns and operates, programs or provides services to more television stations than anyone and has affiliations with all major networks. Sinclair Digital group is focused on bringing the most engaging content to web, mobile and over-the-top broadcasting to audiences all over the country!  Our success is the result of extraordinary employees and an exemplary management team who believe in a vision and are dedicated ensuring a great future for our employees.  Whether you are an industry veteran or a just starting out, you can find it at Sinclair!  We are advancing the world of Broadcasting and we want YOU to join our winning team!  

Sinclair Broadcast Group is currently looking for a Data Science Manager to join our fast-growing team. The ideal candidate will be intricately involved in the design, development and implementation of data-driven solutions using machine learning technologies and advanced statistical methods to address business problems. This position will be expected to perform data analyses, generate and test working hypothesis, prepare and analyze historical data, identify patterns as well as apply machine learning techniques to formulate a solution. We are seeking candidates from the Seattle, Washington or Baltimore, Maryland markets to fill this open position.

Responsibilities include:

Participating in business engagements focused on customer and consumer analytics
Understanding key business issues driving machine learning implementations
Developing specifications and requirements to extract data from current and third-party systems, as well as for interfacing client systems with analytic models
Assisting in research of new machine learning techniques, ideas, and applications; industry research given client situation; summarizes findings
Identifying short list of candidate software, hardware and vendor solutions that could meet requirements
Designing and implementing predictive model development, related algorithms and interfaces to analytics results
Guiding data science projects through from inception and planning to development, implementation and evaluation
Preparing communications and project deliverables 

Qualifications:  

Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent in statistics, applied mathematics, computer science, actuarial science or related field of study. Advanced degree (MA/PhD) in quantitative discipline: Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Operations Research, Computer Science or Engineering preferred.
Experience in machine learning packages and statistical programming languages such as WEKA, Matlab C, R, Python. Extensive knowledge of tools for data mining and statistics (SAS, SPSS)
Experience with Google Analytics and DoubleClick for Publishers preferred
Strong competency in various machine learning techniques (supervised learning, unsupervised learning, reinforcement learning). Strong knowledge of other quantitative disciplines (operations research, decision theory, etc.) preferred. Knowledge of machine to machine learning techniques
Proficient in manipulating and analyzing complex, high-volume, high-dimensionality data from varying sources. Ideally some of this data would come from embedded sensors, for use in applications such as predictive maintenance.
Ability to communicate complex quantitative analysis to peers in a concise and actionable manner
Ability to work independently and manage multiple task assignments while also having the ability to work in a team environment.
Strong oral and written communication skills, including presentation skills (MS Visio, MS PowerPoint)
Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills with the ability to exercise mature judgment
Willingness to travel

Sinclair Broadcast Group, Inc. is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and Drug Free Workplace!

title: Analyst III, Data Science
desc:
Are you passionate about improving the quality of healthcare? 
Are you interested in exploring a rapidly expanding universe of clinical data? 
Are you ready to leverage your talents to make healthcare better for everyone? 
Are you fascinated by the growing field of data science?
Then join the new Data Science & Advanced Analytics team at Health Services Advisory Group (HSAG) that is transforming the delivery of healthcare in the United States!
HSAG has been a pioneer in the field of healthcare quality improvement for over three decades, serving approximately:
25 percent of the nation’s Medicare population
46 percent of the nation’s Medicaid population
20 percent of the nation’s dialysis population
HSAG is nationally recognized as an industry leader in the areas of data analysis, measure development, and patient satisfaction surveys. We are in search of talented individuals that are interested in a career in analytics as an Analyst 3 in HSAG’s Data Science & Advanced Analytics division. Together we can spread positive change to make healthcare better.  
UNIQUE BENEFITS
An Analyst 3 in DSAA also benefits from HSAG’s desire to grow its staff into the future leaders of healthcare quality improvement in the nation. New HSAG analysts are provided formal training in statistics, clinical epidemiology, SAS, healthcare data, and an assortment of healthcare-related topics. 
HSAG offers:
A comfortable work-life balance, including half-day Fridays and flexible work schedules.
Three weeks of paid time off and 13 company-paid holidays where staff leave two hours early prior to each holiday just to get a “jump start” on holiday festivities.
HSAG offers a competitive benefit package which includes, medical, dental, vision, tuition reimbursement, 401(k) and an employee stock ownership plan. 
DESCRIPTION
The Analyst 3 is a lead contributor to cutting edge analytic work that spans the broad spectrum of healthcare data projects at HSAG. Driven by intellectual curiosity and a passion for healthcare quality, the Analyst 3 leads the development and execution of innovative analytic plans that are intended to provide healthcare decision and policy makers with the necessary information to transform healthcare. The Analyst 3 will also lead a wide array of analytic studies and participate in all phases of the research design process. The Analyst 3 will have at his or her fingertips a wide array of data types to facilitate data exploration, including:
survey
case review
medical and prescription drug claims
eligibility
clinical
electronic health record
operational
Details regarding potential project assignments will be discussed with potential candidates during the interview process.  Beyond project assignment duties, the Analyst 3 will serve as a mentor to other analysts within the division and will work closely with the division’s leadership to fulfill HSAG’s analytic vision.
ESSENTIAL COMPETENCIES, DUTIES, AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Serve as a leader within HSAG Data Science & Advanced Analytics division.
Demonstrate expertise in utilizing the primary types of healthcare data and methods for approaching data assessments.
Evaluate a wide array of data types.
Conduct and interpret analyses, develop appropriate statistical models, manipulate complex databases, and track and evaluate patterns of care and outcomes.
Develop analytic methodologies and analysis plans.
Attend and participates in team training meetings, including presenting at these meetings.
Present and communicate project results to nonanalytic staff members and customers. 
Represent HSAG in a professional manner at all times.

title: Data Science Intern
desc:
Major Responsibilities: Advance Auto Parts isn’t just your local auto parts store. We are the leading competitor in the auto parts industry. We are always looking for ways to better our strategies and broaden our horizons; which is why we are excited to take on a whole new team of interns. For this 10 week paid internship we are looking for interns to specialize in the following areas: Communications, Finance, Human Resources, Marketing, Merchandising, Retail Operations, Strategy, and Supply Chain. The week of welcome kicks off by pairing you with a mentor who will guide your experience as you work on a project tackling some of our top business initiatives.This isn’t a job shadow opportunity, this internship is the chance to get involved, contribute and truly experience our workplace. This will be a fun, teamwork atmosphere with the opportunity to build strong peer to peer relationships. The internship will end with the opportunity to present solutions to relevant business problems to some of our top executive staff members. No other company embodies diversity and community engagement like Advance Auto Parts does. But don’t take our work for it, apply and find out for yourself.  Schedule – 40 hours a week, Monday – Friday // May 21 – July 27SummaryAs a Data Science Intern, you will have an opportunity to disrupt a $100B auto parts industry to bring better and faster solutions to customers. You will have the opportunity to help analyze billions of transactions to find patterns that will help improve our company and build data products to extract valuable business insights.  You will be part of an elite data science function to help the organization live its mission of Advancing a World in Motion.General Job ResponsibilitiesCollect, analyze, and interpret information from multiple data sources identifying actionable insights Build predictive models and machine-learning algorithms for second-level analytics.Develop reports and/or presentations leveraging data visualization tools that clearly and concisely communicate analytical findings Analyze customer, transaction, and campaign data to identify trends and patterns in marketing campaign performance and/or customer behavior.Conduct digital channel analysis to understand traffic and revenue drivers, both in-store and on-line.Leverage analytical tools (SQL, SAS, Tableau) and data mining techniques to perform advanced data manipulation and extract insights from large databases.Support ad hoc analytic need as requested.Qualifications Junior or Senior Preferred Majors: Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering or other relevant disciplines Some experience with a data science programming language (ex: R, SAS, SPSS, and/or Python) Some experience using data visualization tools (ex: Tableau, d3.js)

Qualifications:


We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

title: Director - Data Science
desc:
Plan, facilitate, build, and manage advanced analytics from inception to successful completion. Involves the responsibility of supervising employees with various skills working
as a team. 
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

1. Provide the vision, roadmap, and thought leadership for Grange’s centralized data science team.

2. Manage a team of statisticians to translate corporate strategy into analytic projects that inform and drive business performance.

3. Collaborate with the Data Warehouse, Personal and Commercial Lines, Life, Claims, Sales and Marketing, Customer Experience, Research, Insights and Reporting, and other internal
client teams to support corporate initiatives with analytics. 
4. Design variables for new marts at the customer, household, and agency levels in close partnership with Data Warehouse, Research, and business unit teams.

5. Work with the Data Warehouse, IT, business units, and third-party companies to assess and incorporate demographic, firmographic, geographic, telematic, internet-of-things
(IOT), drone, wearables, sensor, social media, and other data sources for analytic benefit.

6. Create, document, test, deploy, audit, and manage statistical techniques and predictive models.

7. Build profile, segmentation, and impact-analysis automated tools for the Insights team. Perform market, portfolio, and customer/prospect segmentation to optimize strategies
and spend. 
8. Ensure all analytic activities comply with regulatory and company policies. Work with legal, compliance, and risk teams to develop and apply effective risk management controls.

9. Synthesize findings, analysis, and recommendations into senior level presentations that convey insights and recommendations through compelling, persuasive, and efficient
story-telling, while maintaining a balance between key insights and mastery of details.

10. Provide technical and business leadership, mentoring, and training on all applications.

11. Maintain employee files and attendance records.

12. Report project status (including schedule, cost and quality), risks and issues in a timely and accurate manner to all the stakeholders of projects.

13. Responsible for personnel actions of hiring, terminations and initiating promotions.

14. Establish objectives for each employee, monitor employee performance, conduct employee performance evaluations, and recommend salary adjustments.

15. Set priorities based upon company and department guidelines; motivate staff to achieve company, department and personal goals including professional development.

16. Interact and communicate effectively with all business contacts, including group presentations and meeting facilitation.

17. Update project management software to reflect assigned task status and effort.

18. Update the problem management and tracking system to reflect issue status.

19. Update Performance Objectives/Evaluation documents.

20. Assist in the development and control of the departmental budget.

21. Perform other duties as assigned.

There may be functions (essential or marginal) of this position not listed in this description.
Requirements1. Ph.D. in an applied quantitatively- or computationally-oriented field such as statistics, economics, applied mathematics, computer science, or operations research.

2. 8+ years of related work experience in similar or directly related functions, preferably in insurance or financial services.

3. Prior management experience strongly preferred.

4. Expert-level understanding of predictive models, structures, theories, principles and practices, including machine learning, statistics, and text mining techniques.

5. Thorough understanding of structured analysis, multivariate methods, behavioral segmentation, and financial analysis principles. Strong modeling skills including cluster
analysis, latent class, logistic regression, decision trees, and other non-linear algorithms, linear regression techniques (GLM), and forecasting/time series. Practical experience in the construction of designed experiments.

6. Must possess excellent interpersonal and communications skills, excellent problem solving skills, and the self-motivation to improve skills and abilities as generally acquired
through 8+ years of experience. 
7. Direct experience with large data sets, SAS or R, and relational database models such as Oracle, DB2, SQL Server, Teradata, and Netezza. Python is a plus.

8. Experience working with unstructured data in distributed ecosystems like Hadoop.

9. Ability to work independently under minimal supervision with considerable latitude for un-reviewed actions or decisions.

10. Competent to work at the highest technical level of all phases of application and programming activities.

11. Must demonstrate leadership, professionalism and a basic understanding of the insurance business.

title: Data Science Intern
desc:
Overview
Progrexion is a leading provider of credit report repair services in the United States. Progrexion’s technology and services help consumers access and understand information contained in their credit reports, verify whether that information is fair, accurate and substantiated, and correct inaccuracies with individual creditors, other data furnishers and the national credit bureaus. Progrexion technology and services are used by Lexington Law Firm and by CreditRepair.com, a Progrexion subsidiary.  Progrexion has been named by Utah Business Magazine as one of Utah’s fastest growing companies, a Top Places to Work in Idaho, and a Best Company to Watch in Arizona. For more information about Progrexion, visit www.progrexion.com.The Data Science Intern will rotate through different job functions to gain exposure to both the industry as well as gain valuable experience working with marketing systems to perform analysis and implement marketing processes.This is a paid internship for approximately 10-12 weeks with potential for a full-time entry-level position. Interns should be available to work 20-30 hours per week. 

Responsibilities

Create reports, analyses, graphs, tables, to present data in a meaningful way.
Identifying insights and reporting
Demonstrated ability in accessing data from a variety of sources/programs, digging to find trends, make recommendations on optimizing to improve numbers
Provide strategic analytical support to teams within the Marketing department to better understand data around user behavior and identify key trends
Use data analytics tools to inform our process and product decisions as well as create impactful and easily readable internal reports.

Qualifications

Individuals considered for this position should be actively pursuing, or be a recent graduate of a Bachelor’s Degree in Statistics, Economics, Marketing, Business Administration, Information Systems or a related field of study.
Work, internship, or other leadership experience in a professional environment
Interest in learning and developing marketing, analytical, and creative skills
Understanding of statistics and data interpretation skills
Strong analytical skills; ability to evaluate data, identify trends and effectively summarize information
Strong knowledge of Google Analytics and Adobe
Proficient in use of Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, and Excel; Pivot Tables are a must
Ability to break down and solve complex problems in a high-energy, fast paced environment
 The Expertise You’ll Develop in the Role:Ability to break down and solve complex problems
Develop high impact solutions
Translate massive data sets into actionable business results
Drive scalable solutions
Expand feature sets globally

title: Data Science Consultant
desc:
HCSC is committed to diversity in the workplace and to providing equal opportunity and affirmative action to employees and applicants.We are an Equal Opportunity Employment / Affirmative Action employer dedicated to workforce diversity and a drug-free and smoke-free workplace. Drug screening and background investigation are required, as allowed by law. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.
If you are an individual with a disability or a disabled veteran and need an accommodation or assistance in either using the Careers website or completing the application process, you can email us to [Click Here to Email Your Resumé] to request reasonable accommodations.
Please note that only requests for accommodations in the application process will be returned. All applications, including resumes, must be submitted through HCSC's Career website on-line application process. If you have general questions regarding the status of an existing application, navigate to 'my account' and click on 'View your job submissions'.Job Purpose:
This position is responsible for using advanced mathematical and statistical concepts and theories to analyze and collect data and construct solutions to business problems; performing complex statistical analysis on experimental or business data to validate and quantify trends or patterns identified by business analysts; constructing predictive models, algorithms and probability engines to support data analysis or product functions; verifies model and algorithm effectiveness based on real-world results; and designing experiments and methodologies to generate and collect data for business use. Responsible for aiding tactical decision making by using predictive and prescriptive modeling; and extracting actionable insights by identifying patterns in structured and unstructured data.

Required Job Qualifications:
*Bachelor degree and 5 years of experience in advanced mathematical and statistical concepts OR Master degree with 4 years of experience in advanced mathematical and statistical concepts.
*2 years of experience in programmatic data analysis tools like SAS, R, MATLAB, SPSS etc.
*Proficiency in at least one high level programing languages like Java, Scala, Python, Ruby, C etc.
*Proficiency in data wrangling tools like SQL, Hive etc.
*Experience in data visualization tools like Tableau, QlikView, MicroStrategy etc.
*Experience in big data ecosystems (Hadoop, No-SQL etc.)
*Conceptual and creative problem-solving skills; experience working with considerable ambiguity
*Experience learning new and complex concepts quickly.
*Knowledge with Healthcare Payer industry data.
*Clear and concise interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills.
*PC proficiency with Microsoft applications including Access, Excel, Word and Power Point.

Preferred Job Qualifications:
*Master degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Operations Research, Computer Science.
*PhD.

LI-POST
*CA
*CB*

**Position is located in Chicago, IL
**Relocation assistance not available
**Sponsorship not available

title: Data Science Manager
desc:
Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, or related Data Science field.  Masters degree preferred or the equivalent combination of education and experience.
5-8 years of experience in data science and/or advanced analytics strategic analysis, including:
3-5 years managing direct reports
3-5 years of experience using tools for statistical analysis and programming (e.g., SAS, R, Python,) and querying (e.g., SQL/HIVE/SPARK). 
3–5 years of experience utilizing statistical techniques that are commonly employed in advanced analytics, such as logistic regression, multiple linear regression, cluster analysis, principal component analysis, discriminant analysis, and decision trees (e.g., CHAID and CART). 
2-3 years of experience in experimental design & analysis and project management.
Knowledge and Skills:Good familiarity with advanced analytics theory and practice, including the concepts of segmentation and response modeling. 
Ability to successfully communicate with Executives, Mid-Level Manager, Marketing Strategists and Business leaders to identify business problems and opportunities, design and implement the best analytics solution and communicate the results of analytics projects.
Desktop computing skills and experience using one or more: word-processing, spreadsheet and presentation software programs
Strong knowledge of MS Office required.

title: Data Science Team Lead
desc: Indigo is a company dedicated to harnessing nature to help farmers sustainably feed the planet. With a vision of creating a world where farming is an economically desirable and accessible profession, Indigo works alongside its growers to apply natural approaches, grow healthy food for all, and conserve resources for future generations. Utilizing beneficial plant microbes to improve crop health and productivity, Indigo’s portfolio is focused on cotton, wheat, rice, corn, and soybeans. The company is headquartered in Boston, MA, with commercial and customer service based in Memphis, TN.  Indigo is looking to disrupt farming through data. Our goal is to collect data from the farm in order to generate actionable insights with machine learning.  The Data Science Engineering Team Lead will have a critical role in accomplishing our goals. They will architect and build scalable web systems that expose complex data models in easy to consume apis across tens of millions of acres of farming data. They will also be an important member of a highly efficient and cohesive engineering team that is focused on the customer’s needs and requirements. Outcomes: Partner w/ UI & API team to ensure seamless integration of deliverables into our software platform. Collaborate with Data Sciences to prioritize and flesh out backlog addressing highest priority Data Sciences production deliverables. Put crop models into production for actual on farm insight and making them available to the UI via api. Work with internal research teams and help build out internal DNA sequencing pipeline. Come up with guidelines/rules for both R and Python such that "productizing" project is as streamlined as possible. Competencies: History of mentoring team members Experience implementing complex algorithms at scale Ability to stand up services and ensure 99.9 uptime with great performance Able to integrate all product releases into product life cycle and software development process from day 1 Can work closely with Systems Architect to identify solutions that fit architecture Comfortable working with data science tooling (e.g. R and Python) Experience recruiting and leading an A-quality engineering team Knowledge of APIs/REST best practices Can work closely with Data Sciences and teams across all business verticals to understand problem space Demonstrated experience building high-quality, monitored software based on customer control metrics Qualifications: 5+ years of building scalable web  services using a modern web frameworks in a micro services architecture Required: Strong skills in R, Python, machine learning algos; including: Numpy, Scikit, Matplotlib Nice to have: Deep learning (Tensorflow, Theano, etc), Bayesian modeling (STAN, Jags), Spark Intimate knowledge of designing and integrating with REST or GraphQL APIs Demonstrable experience and knowledge of the differences between web and mobile application development and the tradeoffs of each Experience setting up monitoring solutions to track users and catch issues in Production Actively practicing lean / agile software methodologies or similar Experience working cross-functionally with Software Product Management, Architecture, User Experience and users to realize application development vision

title: Manager of Data Science
desc:
Position Overview: 
The role of the Manager Data Science is to work as a senior member of the Data Science team with the primary responsibility of setting a strategic direction for data identification, collection and quantification activities. The ideal candidate would be passionate about the future of data analytics and would have a desire to help shape it.

Job Responsibilities:

Set a strategic direction for data identification, collection and quantification activities.
Use expert knowledge of data science, algorithms and predictive analytics to lead data analysis for multiple projects with diverse scope and complex business and technical challenges.
Keep at the fore-front of data science practices, tools, and techniques and implement Data Science best practices.
Develop statistical models to improve our business efficiency and present best offer to our clients.
Present reports and findings to senior level technical and non-technical audiences
Frequent meeting/communication with clients to interpret their needs, plan/organize, and discuss progress and results.
Lead, guide and mentor members of the Data Science Team.



Skills

Excellent skills in common open source data science tools & languages, such as python, SQL, R    
Advanced data mining and predictive modeling skills (e.g., regression, segmentation, machine learning, SEM, MCMC, Bayesian, boosting, cross-validation) 
Hands-on experience in Big Data tools and technologies, including: in-database analytical solutions, Hadoop (hdfs/Hive/Pig), Spark (mllib), Greenplum, other distributed systems
Impeccable attention to detail and very strong ability to convert complex data into insights and action plans
Excellent verbal and written communication
Strong Leadership skills


Qualifications
 
10+ years of experience in Data Analytics
Master degree or higher in computer science, statistics, or other quantitative field (PhD preferred, not required)
Experience in the automotive or consulting industries a plus.

title: Business Engineer, Data Science
desc: CCC information Services, Inc. is seeking a Business Engineer to work on the Data Science team to help formulate business use cases, turn data insights into business recommendations, and model the value of an insight. The Data Science team at CCC is currently working on some of the most important, strategic initiatives of the company. The Business Engineer role will be a part of the Data Science team and will contribute to a spectrum of projects with different business stakeholders. We are seeking a candidate who will bolster existing capabilities and suggest new, exciting changes and improvements. Responsibilities & Duties  You will join a skunkworks team to incubate, research and help develop predictive models based on CCC's unique data sets and input from industry experts. At the inception stage, you will observe and understand our customer's processes, then propose innovative ideas to improve and/or disrupt their processes. The research and development stage will involve testing hypotheses, undergoing exploratory analysis, and formulating statistical models (predictive, prescriptive, etc.) that can add business value. At the market introduction stage, you will also help design scalable algorithms that implement the models. You will also interface with product managers and software architects for deployment of the data product.Qualifications * Ph.D. or Master's degree in operations research, applied math, statistics, theoretical computer science, physics, or related field; experience in an analytical role as a data scientist, analyst, quantitative, actuary, etc. * Understanding and hands-on skills in advanced modeling: machine learning algorithms, probability, statistics * Expertise with the Python data science stack (pandas, numpy, scipy, scikit-learn, matplotlib, regex), expertise with R, and SQL/backend systems * 1-2 years of experience working with stakeholders within business analytics or advanced analytics capacity * Strong desire to understand existing business process, not afraid of disrupting old business process and propose new ideas, good at formulating a business question into one or a series of analytics questions * Superior problem-solving mindset * Business consulting experience a plusWhy Choose CCCWe promote a healthy work-life balance and offer generous benefit plans and resources designed with employee satisfaction in mind.What we value is simple - customers, employee commitment, collaboration and clear communication.We hire people who will embrace the company's goals and productively contribute in ways that help us serve the customer, innovate, and stay strong.We make it a priority to keep employees healthy, happy and enriched. * Healthy - Wellness programs and Perkspot/employee discount program * Happy - Recognition programs, a confidential employee assistance program, and flexible work arrangements such as staggered start times * Enriched - Tuition reimbursement, training and learning programs, and leadership development opportunitiesOur corporate headquarters is located in downtown Chicago within the historic Merchandise Mart-a certified LEED (Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design) building.CCC Information Services was ranked #15 in the Top 100 Digital Companies in Chicago in 2016 by Built In Chicago, an online community for digital technology entrepreneurs in Chicago.CCC is a great place to work. Join us!

title: Data Science Manager
desc:
This position is open as of 10/8/2017.Data Science Manager - Lead a team of Data Scientists!Based in the heart of SF, we are peer-to-peer consumer marketplace startup that has disrupted the transportation industry. Since 2009, we have been funded over $80mill and we operate in 4,700 cities across the United States, Canada and the UK with over 2.5 million users – and the sky is the limit!Top Reasons to Work with UsWe are looking for amazing data scientists who have a passion for consumer products and want to join an exceptional team that is changing the way people think about travel. We ship code daily, A/B test extensively, and have a primary role in creating the product from inception to implementation. There's much to do, and you'll be responsible for making some real cool stuff happen.Be a member of a small team of talented data scientists and engineers and play a major role in shaping an exciting platform that's changing how people travel.What You Will Be Doing•Lead development efforts of data features (eg. search rank, dynamic pricing, recommendation engines, ...)•Partner closely with data scientists and product managers to develop algorithms and drive key product or modeling decisions•Research the best metrics and experiment design to measure models performance•Present your research and insights to all levels of the company, clearly and conciselyWhat You Need for this Position•MS in Computer Science, Statistics, Math, Engineering, or related disciplines•3+ years of professional experience in data science, machine learning , deep learning or related field•Deep understanding of the latest and greatest Machine Learning techniques•Expert in developing and scaling out machine learning algorithms•Expert level SQL skills and statistical analysis tools like R & Python•Experience with ETL (Extract-Transform-Load) systems •Deep product sense & Self-starter•Experience working in a face paced startup environment is a MUST•You are excited about the idea of working with a small team to get the job done, even if you sometimes need to do things that are outside of your direct job descriptionWhat's In It for You•Competitive salary and meaningful equity•Employer paid medical, dental, and vision insurance•Apple equipment•Four weeks paid time off, 11 paid holidays, generous parental leave•Weekly catered lunch•Stocked kitchen and beverages•Company-sponsored happy hours and team events•Travel credit every monthSo if you are a Data Science Manager, please apply today!Required SkillsMachine Learning, Python, R, ETL, Data ScienceIf you are a good fit for the Data Science Manager - Lead a team of Data Scientists! position, and have a background that includes:Machine Learning, Python, R, ETL, Data Science and you are interested in working the following job types:Information Technology, Engineering, Professional ServicesWithin the following industries:Computer SoftwareOur privacy policy: Your resume and information will be kept completely confidential.Looking forward to receiving your resume through our website and going over the job in more detail with you!CyberCoders, Inc is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.Your Right to Work – In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.

title: Analyst I-II, Data Science
desc:
Are you passionate about improving the quality of healthcare?

Represent HSAG in a professional manner at all times.

title: Director, Data Science 132150
desc:

Join us and together we will drive the future of health care.  This is an exceptional opportunity to do innovative work that means more to you and those we serve at one of America's leading health benefits companies and a Fortune Top 50 Company.  Lead a team of data-scientists engaged in development and implementation of machine learning algorithms and techniques to solve business problems and optimize member experiences. Primary duties may include are but not limited to:  Champion the design & execution of machine learning projects to address specific business problems determined by consultation with business partners. Proactively collaborates with business partners to determine identified population segments and develop actionable plans to enable the identification of patterns related to quality, use, cost and other variables   Hires, trains, coaches, counsels, and evaluates performance of direct reports.  .

   Requires MA/MS in Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Machine Learning, Econometrics, Physics, Biostatistics or related Quantitative disciplines.   7 years’ experience in predictive analytics and advanced expertise with software such as Python, R, SAS, SAS Enterprise Miner or equivalent, or any combination of education and experience which would provide an equivalent background. 3 years’ experience leading advanced modeling teams.   Experience working with cross-functional project teams and managing communications including in-person or virtual meetings is required.   Experience with presenting project output to a wide range of audience is required.  Experience in Payer Fraud, Waste & Abuse detection is strongly preferring.  Must demonstrate the ability to influence audience through effective communication skills.  PhD and experience in the healthcare sector preferred. title: Machine Data Science Co-op
desc:
Job Information

As a Machine Data Science Co-op, you'll learn and participate in the various business activities developed by the leader in the compact equipment industry. You've spent a great deal of time in the classroom learning about how to you'll gain valuable work experience and now you'll have an opportunity to assist in developing tools and processes to collect, organize, analyze and present/visualize machine data analytics. As the IoT allows industries of all types to collect extreme amounts of data to better the customer experience, minimize product downtime and enhance / create new products, the process to analyze and make sense of the data provides an extremely valuable opportunity.

Role & Responsibility

 As a Machine Data Science Co-op, you will gain valuable work experience doing:
Focus on the processes and tools involved for data analysis [Collect > Enrich > Refine > Analyze > Present]
Become familiar with the processes and technologies involved in collecting, gathering and organizing machine data
Gain knowledge of where to find any contextual business data that adds value to our IoT data
Use tools and processes to focus on driving data quality and integrity
Learn and apply different approaches to analyze the data through quantitative analysis (correlation; multiple regression; regression trees; artificial neural networks; random forest; etc.]
Share stories told by the analysis with functional stakeholders for validation and action planning (storytelling)
Working on projects identified by the cross-functional "Machine Data Analytics Power User Group" - Become a resource to perform analytics work for the cross functional group
Solve problems, answer important business questions and identify trends using analytical tools and processes for a cross functional group
Apply computer programming skills to organize, manage and analyze large sets of data
Gain an understanding of our core products and how they are programmed to communicate
Become an internal expert on all data points being collected through our IoT initiative
Assist in identify anomalies within the data and working cross functionally to understand and communicate those anomalies

Job Requirement

Junior or Senior standing seeking a degree in Computer Science, MIS, Mathematics, or any technology related program
3.0 or higher GPA
Be able to commit to Bobcat for the entire term of the co-op (8 months)
Be proficient in Microsoft Office products (Excel, Word, PowerPoint).
Basic experience in data analysis and statistical analysis skills are desired.
Basic experience with application suites, databases, or application programming
Comfortable presenting analysis and research to senior managers.
Be able to adapt to working in a corporate setting.
Be able to independently work through a project from start to finish with limited supervision, as well as have the skills to work collaboratively on a team.
Have the vision to identify problems, make recommendations and provide creative and realistic solutions.
Be able to self-manage time and set priorities amidst multiple project requests and deadlines; be organized in order to complete projects in line with expectations and deadlines.
Possess strong communication skills, including the ability to listen and quickly understand new projects, proactively communicate concerns and effectively present to a group.
Possess a can-do attitude in order to enthusiastically deliver results to a department that depends on you.

Functional Competency

Decision-making Scope (Range)

Communication

Others

Reimbursement of required college co-op tuition credits, up to $1,000.00 per lifetime.
Build Your Future with Bobcat and Doosan! We want people with...BIG goals, BOLD dreams and an INNOVATIVE spirit!
The world-renowned brands that make up Doosan Bobcat produce industry-leading compact and heavy construction equipment, attachments, air compressors, lighting systems, generators and articulated dump trucks. Doosan Bobcat is a part of the Doosan Group, which employs 43,000 people in 38 countries worldwide. With people at the core of who we are, we believe the growth of our people will lead to the continued growth and success of our world-class company. Our team of dedicated employees is the backbone that allows us to provide construction equipment solutions that help our customers build the world of tomorrow. Wherever you find us, you'll hear the sounds of progress, see the results of our people and feel the rhythm of transformation in everything we do.

desc:

Advanced analytics of the customer experience and customer interactions is our expertise.Check out our website below to learn more about what we do and how we help our clients.http://www.teletech.com/consulting/insightsWhat you’ll be doing:This person will be a part of our Global Data Science Center focused on helping our clients find and seize opportunities in their markets. Support the development of consulting products such as proprietary customer experience scores and marketing optimization solutions

title: Manager, Data Science - Pricing & Inventory Systems
desc:
Over twenty years ago, CarMax disrupted the automotive industry and to this day remains the undisputed market leader in a $500B+ industry. With best-in-class financial performance, customer satisfaction, and associate engagement, CarMax is well positioned for continued growth. With this growth, we strive to maintain our analytics-based competitive advantage through our algorithm driven pricing and inventory systems. To do so, we’re currently looking for experienced data engineers who are looking to apply their passion for data and technology to drive business-critical decisions.The primary responsibility for the pricing and inventory systems team is to accurately value the unique characteristics of each individual car that we buy or sell, and also allocate those vehicles across our 150+ stores. Last year alone, CarMax sold more than 1 million vehicles, appraised over 2 million vehicles, and had $100m in weekly auto auction spend - all while dealing with constantly changing consumer demand, wholesale auction supply, and other market conditions that are often regionally differentiated.In order to realize the full value of our models, our systems experts must accurately and instantaneously deliver thousands of recommendations to our field associates daily. This requires the combination of a deep understanding of the models, the technical skill to deploy new models as robust and stable systems, and the results focus and analytical ability to quickly diagnose and fix problems as they arise.What will you do in this role?Whether in a technical expert or supervisory role, a successful Manager candidate will:1. Lead the collaboration with statistical modeling experts to rapidly deploy newly developed models2. Own the maintenance/enhancing of model performance, data integrity, and system reliability by:- Assessing and improving methodologies and processes used to develop and manage models- Analyzing and/or supervising analysis on vast amounts of complex pricing-related data- Partnering across the organization to create processes for identifying and fixing system issues3. Drive CarMax’s development of data science expertise by:- Researching innovations and best practices related to data science techniques and processing large data sets- Encouraging, challenging, and influencing others within the Strategy group, IT, and other departments in the development of our data technology roadmap4. Communicate how our systems work throughout the organization, both at a general level and a detailed level



What type of person are we looking for?To be successful for this role, we are looking for someone that can consistently deliver at a high level on the responsibilities listed above.  A few of the competencies that will position you for success are: 1. Strong technical skills and a desire to continue to grow those skills- Proven track record for using analytics and production systems to make business decisions- Ability to explore newer open source big data technologies like Hadoop, cloud, etc.2. Ability to influence at all levels of organization- Experience managing team-based projects and delivering timely results- Record of building and maintaining strong working relationships- Ability to explain standard or novel modeling methods3. Desire to continue developing into an organizational leaderWhat are the qualifications for this role?1. Education- Base: Undergraduate degree in a quantitative discipline- Preferred: Graduate degree in data science, computer science, or related field2. Data Science Experience- Base: 4 years of experience in data science and/or systems development- Preferred: Experience using SQL and Python to analyze big data sets- Preferred: Experience managing/leading a team or cross-functional projectsWhat are some of the benefits of working in this role?1. Ability to make a large impact on a Fortune 500 company• Play key role in driving company’s strategy• Despite being undisputed market leader, CarMax only has a 4% market share of the late-model used car market, allowing room for exponential growth2. Large focus on professional development• Your development is as important as your work in our group• Our leaders are heavily invested in helping managers hone their technical, communication, leadership, and other skills3. Great work environment• CarMax was voted a Fortune 100 best company to work for 12 years in a row• Good work/life balance; we work hard, but enjoy very reasonable hours• Work with a close knit team in a fun and casual environment. The broader Strategy Group at CarMax consists of 100+ analysts with stellar work and academic backgrounds contributing to our collaborative atmosphere• In addition to comprehensive benefits, we have perks like flexible vacation and an on-campus fitness center

title: Director of Data Science & Pricing
desc:
AFN is looking for talented, driven, and successful people to join our fast-growing, award-winning, and fun-loving third-party logistics team. With AFN, you have the chance to take the wheel, and steer your career exactly where you want it to go. Challenge yourself. Come grow with us. Reap the rewards you deserve. Do you have what it takes? Now is the time to find out. At AFN we hire the best of the best - visionary thinkers; people continuously looking to reinvent the way they do business and seek out new, creative solutions. Our high-performance team is driven, empowered, innovative and packed with self-starters. We provide our employees with the necessary tools and freedom to build their own career paths and discover success. AFN is committed to your personal success and offers the resources, programs and support needed to make it happen. We care about your professional growth and will help you achieve your goals. We offer a competitive base salary, aggressive incentive program and a comprehensive benefits package. As the Manager of Business Intelligence, you'll be responsible for transforming Business Intelligence (BI) at AFN and enable the organization to be data-driven. In this role, the Manager of BI will define the strategy for business intelligence at AFN. Partnering with the business, the Manager of BI will also be defining the roadmap to educate, mentor and drive adoption of BI across the different departments within the company. This is a highly visible role with broad accountability and as such, will interface with all key stakeholders both in Technology and the business. The key role of BI is widely recognized and valued at all layers of the organization. The team has a strong history of understanding our business, the industry, and supporting our leaders with accurate and timely information. This role requires a strong blend of business, technology, and personnel management. The successful candidate will have demonstrated experience in working across functional areas, team leadership, emerging technologies, and executive engagement. (S)he or he will also handle special projects, as assigned by the CEO, CFO or COO.Main Responsibilities: ● Develop and execute to a multi-year roadmap and build out predictive analytics capabilities for the organization. ● Engage and foster a collaborative team environment through effective coaching and leadership. ● Continuously communicate the highest priority strategic initiatives to keep the team focused on the right things. ● Own, lead and facilitate all presentations on key performance metrics to the executive leadership team ● Partnering with IT, lead the development, implementation and maintenance of a scalable data management solution that is aligned to the strategic objectives and the reporting needs of the organization. ● Drive data partnership strategy that delivers beneficial yield to predictive modeling. ● Build and publish transportation market analysis for the benefit of AFN and its customer and carrier partner base. ● Work with stakeholders to define business and systems requirements for new information technologies, particularly in the areas of BI, analytics, and data warehousing.Who We Are: Founded in 2003, AFN is an award-winning, third-party logistics provider focused on supply chain solutions and transportation services throughout North America. Serving motor carriers, manufacturers and retailers, we are known for our commitment to client services, our proactive approach to fighting cargo theft and our expertise in retail compliance. We specialize in creating customized logistics solutions for our clients, including full truckload, LTL, intermodal, high-value shipping, expedited services and outsourced transportation. Employer is EOE/M/F/D/V. No third party candidates please.Requirements:Experience: ● Minimum seven (7) to ten (10) years of experience in the quantitative analysis field required. Experience in logistics industry preferred but not required.Education and Certifications: ● Bachelor's degree in a technical field (Engineering, Applied Sciences, Finance) preferred but not required. Master's degree in technical field preferred but not required.Skills and Capabilities: ● Must possess exceptional written, verbal and interpersonal communication skills, including the ability to interact with and establish trust and credibility with all levels of the organization. Must possess strong relationship-building skills with the ability to influence internal stakeholders absent a reporting relationship. ● Must possess excellent organization skills with the ability to prioritize and complete multiple projects in a fast-paced environment with changing needs. ● Must possess the ability and experience utilizing sound judgment, problem solving, decision making and negotiation skills. ● Broad business perspective; commitment to integrated teamwork in decision-making, combined with disciplined prioritization. ● Must possess superior analytical, evaluative and problem-solving capabilities. ● Must possess expert proficiency in applicable software ● Exceptional presentation skills required. ● High levels of ethics, personal discipline and professionalism required .

Master's degree in technical field preferred but not required.Skills and Capabilities:● Must possess exceptional written, verbal and interpersonal communication skills, including theability to interact with and establish trust and credibility with all levels of the organization. Mustpossess strong relationship-building skills with the ability to influence internal stakeholders absenta reporting relationship.● Must possess excellent organization skills with the ability to prioritize and complete multipleprojects in a fast-paced environment with changing needs.● Must possess the ability and experience utilizing sound judgment, problem solving, decisionmaking and negotiation skills.● Broad business perspective; commitment to integrated teamwork in decision-making, combinedwith disciplined prioritization.● Must possess superior analytical, evaluative and problem-solving capabilities.● Must possess expert proficiency in applicable software● Exceptional presentation skills required.● High levels of ethics, personal discipline and professionalism required .

desc: Head of Data Science - Bangkok or SingaporeWorking for this multi-billion global e-commerce company, we seek a talented Data Science Head to lead the data science team globally for this client. You will be managing 25-30 talented Data Scientists with 200 indirect reports. title: Senior Business Systems Analyst - Data Science & Analytics
desc:
CF Industries is a global leader in transforming natural gas into nitrogen. The chemical processes we use ensure we have the nitrogen we need to support life on earth - from fertilizer that feeds the crops that feed the world to products that remove harmful emissions from industrial activities. Through our nine world-class manufacturing complexes and best-in-class distribution system, we serve agricultural and industrial customers. We invite you to be a part of our nearly 3,000 employees making a difference every day. Department: AG0500 Information TechnologyFunction: Information TechnologyJob Summary:As a Senior Business Analyst- Data Science and Analytics you will liaise with key business areas including Market Research, Sales and Commercial, Supply Chain, Raw Material Procurement, Distribution and Logistics and business transformation teams engaged in developing market leading analytics solution. This is a strategic role that would require conceptualizing the business need, validating the same with key stakeholders, demonstrated rigor of analytics, hypothesis driven testing using internal and external data, modeling and driving user experience through use of visual analytics. The overall goal would be performance improvement across the enterprise with improved profit margins and reduced costs.Job Description:Apply knowledge of advanced statistical and analytical techniques and as well as performing data analysis of outcomes to identify trends and /or opportunities for improvement.
Facilitate problem solving through data, data modeling and performance improvement teams and workgroups.
Exceptional interpersonal skills to help prioritize, rank and weight existing projects with new demand from the business users.
Excellent communication skills to understand and articulate diverse clients’ needs and objectives; manage expectations; and deliver as promised and on time.
Provide technical expertise in identifying, evaluating and developing systems and procedures that are cost effective and meet user requirements 
Design and implement proof of concept solutions, and create advanced BI visualizations
Demonstrate experience with Tableau desktop and Tableau Server, additional skills in application of R, Python, SAS will be a plus
Understanding and exposure to data transformation and ETL including SQL, query databases, ad-hoc Business Objects Reports
Successful Incumbents Will Have:Role typically requires between 4 and 8 years of experience in Business Analytics.
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or another related field Related experience with applications development experience preferred.
Ability to work effectively with all levels of management in a deadline-oriented environment
Excellent oral and written communication skills with organization and time management skills
At least 2 years of experience developing visualization solutions using Tableau and  setting up Tableau Server and publishing workbooks
At least 4 years total of Business Intelligence experience
Experience with Tableau user management and server content management
Excellent SQL skills 
Experience creating ad-hoc Business Objects WebI reports (1-2 years)
Data Science skills including strong familiarity with statistical packages like SAS and R and applied knowledge of advanced statistical and analytical techniques and demonstrated success in maintaining an abstraction schedule as well as performing data analysis of outcomes to identify trends and or opportunities for improvement.CF Industries is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.  Employees in the US can learn more about their rights by viewing the federal "EEO is the Law" poster (PDF) and the Pay Transparency Policy Statement can be found on this link: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/PayTransparencyNondiscrimination.html.If you need any assistance seeking a job opportunity at CF Industries, or if you need reasonable accommodation with the application process, please call 847-405-2400 or contact us at [Click Here to Email Your Resumé].JOIN OUR TALENT NETWORK

title: Manager of Data Science - Statistical / SAS
desc:
RESPONSIBILITIES:Do you have a deep understanding of advanced statistical techniques? Do you enjoy leading a small team and work in a small team? If yes, join a growing e-Commerce firm located in the new state-of-art headquarters in vibrant downtown Manhattan, New York (NY).Summary:A Kforce client is currently seeking a Manager of Data Science for our Database Marketing division. This is a hands-on leadership role. The Database Marketing Manager will be a Data Scientist/Statistician who contributes to the company's business strategy using innovative analytic approaches and predictive models. This role is an integral part of the analytics team that influences decisions made within multiple internal groups at this firm.The Database Marketing Manager will develop, implement, and maintain statistical models using modeling techniques including regression and ensemble models and decision trees. This position will apply innovative analytic approaches to optimize marketing efforts and further support business decisions in a fast-paced retail environment. This person will also conduct statistical analysis using SAS, and will leverage SQL-based relational database programming to extract data for summary and analysis.Principal Duties and Responsibilities: Develop advanced statistical applications on SAS and other platforms to support the marketing efforts and business needs of internal clients, using techniques such as regression analysis, decision trees, vector machines, and incremental modeling 
 Develop SAS programs, using advanced SQL queries and other functions to find solutions and trends for complex marketing projects like lifetime value analyses and customer segmentation
 Manage and mentor a data analyst in the team
 Work with Circulation Directors to design statistical tests that will provide actionable results and report results of tests in a timely manner with suggested plans of action


REQUIREMENTS: MA/MS or BS degree in Statistics, Data Science, or related analytical field of study; Advanced degree preferred
 Masters in Statistics - No exceptions
 Minimum of 4-6 years of experience in database marketing/data mining utilizing large marketing databases preferably in a data-intense retail environment
 Minimum 3+ years of professional experience
 Capability to execute the complete modeling process from data extraction/manipulation through model development and presentation
 Deep understanding of advanced statistical techniques including regression, ensemble methods, principle components analysis, cluster analysis, propensity models, and other modeling techniques
 Knowledge of at least 1 programming language (no scripting or python)
 Proven command of SAS, SQL, MS, and Excel/PowerPoint
 Experience with other BI tools a plus
 Strong oral and written communication skills
 SAS programming skills
 Data modeling, data mining, mixed market modeling, predictive modeling, etc. skills
 Ability to summarize/present analyses to both technical and non-technical audiences
 Capable of working in a dynamic, fast-paced environment, handling multiple projects
Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

title: Data Science Developer - Analytics Center of Excellence - (1619720)
desc:
QuintilesIMS is a leading integrated information and technology-enabled worldwide healthcare service provider. Formed by the merger of Quintiles and IMS Health, we use our experience, resources and reputation to help our clients drive healthcare forward. A career at QuintilesIMS will give you the opportunity to play an important part in helping our clients improve patient healthcare and make real medical breakthroughs.Description
The Analytics Center of Excellence
Drawing on the strengths of Quintiles and IMS Health, QuintilesIMS is creating the next generation of clinical development. Our new solutions combine world-class clinical research and data-driven insights to offer clients more precise and predictable paths to product approval. 
 
Our new Analytics Center of Excellence (Analytics COE) harnesses our global healthcare insights, working closely with our clinical and therapeutic experts to power evidence-driven design, speed site activation and recruit the right patients, faster. This is a new unit within our business, integrated within Clinical Operations. We’re using big data and advanced analytics to derive insights that transform clinical development and bring new medicines to patients faster through successful trial delivery. 
 
This multi-functional team is an innovation for our business, requiring entrepreneurial and independent thinking to build our capability. Unique and with a global view, this Center of Excellence is a chance to revolutionize the clinical research industry.
 Data Science Developer – the role
As an expert software developer, this is a unique opportunity to leverage your skills to empower advanced analytics and to build unparalleled in-depth knowledge within our business. Working with modern distributed analytics systems, complex data, and challenging requests, you will help shape the way our team approaches prototyping and development of data-driven analytics products. This crucial role involves identifying opportunities for better data modeling, abstraction, testing, internal tooling, and other software development practices that will help our team maximize our efficiency in data science projects. You will have the opportunity to provide technical leadership and mentorship to the team, and to set the standards for code quality and architecture for the projects you work on. You will also serve as a key liaison for our team with production developers.
 Your typical activities might include:Collaborating with data scientists to turn working prototypes into well-abstracted, reusable modules for iterative development of data science projects.

Providing technical leadership and assisting the team on execution of technical tasks centered on delivery of analytics models.

Identifying opportunities for improvements to internal processes regarding model development, including internal data pipelines and modeling frameworks that will facilitate advanced analytics.

Being involved in every stage of the data product development life cycle; from coordinating initial requirements with business owners, through development with subject matter experts and data scientists, to production deployments with developers.

Overseeing multiple projects from concept to completion. 

Comprehensive testing of your own code.

Production deployments of advanced analytics.


Qualification:
Our ideal candidate will have a Bachelors or Masters degree in STEM field such as Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, with 5+ years of object oriented programming experience in a high level language and 3+ years of relevant collaborative software development experience. Alternatively, a relevant combination of education, training and work experience. In addition;
Experience deploying microservices in production.

Extensive experience with dynamic scripting languages such as Python and R.

Experience working with large volumes of complex data, preferably in distributed frameworks such as Spark, SparkR and PySpark.

Strong familiarity with data science concepts and modeling techniques.

Experience implementing design patterns and implementing testing frameworks

Strong SQL or Hive skills. 

Experience deploying deep learning algorithms in production is a plus.

Local language skills to an advanced level (spoken and written), with complete fluency in English.

 
You can drive your career at QuintilesIMS and choose the path that best defines your development and success. With exposure across diverse geographies, capabilities, and vast therapeutic and information and technology areas, you can seek opportunities to change and grow without boundaries.
 
We invite you to join us on our exciting journey. Apply now.
 
Help us make a difference in patient health. QuintilesIMS is a strong advocate of diversity and inclusion in the workplace.  We believe that a work environment that embraces diversity will give us a competitive advantage in the global marketplace and enhance our success.  We believe that an inclusive and respectful workplace culture fosters a sense of belonging among our employees, builds a stronger team, and allows individual employees the opportunity to maximize their personal potential.

title: Manager, Operations Research and Data Science
desc:
The primary mission of the Manager, Operations Research is to lead the Operations Research initiatives through design, development and implementation. The individual will need to understand and be able to articulate every step in the Hertz Revenue Management Function. These steps include bounding logic, forecast algorithms, inventory optimization, price optimization, and export controls. The individual will work closely with the Revenue Management Systems support team to provide training and explanations to address concerns raised by the user base, support team, and training team. This individual will interact daily with the Operations Research development team to target areas of improvement in the RMS system and to recommend solutions to unresolved concerns. This person is responsible for QA vendor products. The Manager would work with a staff of analysts that are highly proficient in modeling and statistics. The Manager will leverage current tools as well as make recommendations on systems that should be used in Revenue management as it relates to modeling and pricing. The manager may supervise direct staff of 1-3 analysts.Key Results Areas:Re-Platforming of new Revenue Management Systems forecast algorithms.
Develop predictive modeling.
Monitor and maintain Revenue Management systems forecasting.
Oversee the integration of demand forecasting.
Lead advanced analytical studies in improvement, execution and operational efficiencies.
Develops pricing strategy.
This person will also have full authority over planning, design, development, implementation and support of one or more of the legacy models to stay ahead of the market in pricing strategies. He/She may direct staff on a project basis. Educational Background:MS or PhD in an analytical field such as Operations Research, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, or FinanceProfessional Experience:3-5 years work experience in highly analytical role 
Microsoft office skills including advanced Excel and Access Skills; Database skills such as complex SQL queries, statistical software skills such as R, Python, SPlus, SPSS, or SAS; CPLEX 
Excellent problem solving and analytical skills with ability to translate results into understandable and actionable information; strong written and verbal communication skills 
Modeling experience in statistics, math programming, and probability modeling; 
Experience managing requirement gathering, business/IT coordination within a complex, demand/supply planning environment
Proven ability to interact with various levels of organization
Process innovation and development; management via KPIs, business process redesign
EEO/AA: Females/Minorities/Disabled/Vets*LI-KR2

title: Sr. Mgr Data Science and Marketing Technology
desc:
SUMMARYThe Sr Manager of Data Science and Marketing Technology will be responsible for making sure that digital technology developed within the marketing department provides consistent, clear and usable data and that this data is used to understand broader market conditions and to drive the business.  The Sr. Manager will lead a small team of specialists to conduct analytics and data science projects.  The Sr. Manager will work closely with the Market Research, Web, Direct Marketing and Customer Experience teams in addition to also working cross-functionally around the broader organization.  This is a high-profile role with exposure to the executive leadership.  This role will develop greater insights around customer behavior and market conditions for all facets of the GAF business while producing analytical data for reporting, visualization and for use in applications. ESSENTIAL DUTIESManage Internal and External Team to do the following:            Generalized ActivitiesAcquire 1st, 2nd, and 3rd Party data to facilitate analytics and data science

Develop algorithms to support customer segmentation for new programs.
Create tools to simplify the management of campaign/customer programs for project owners
Create algorithms and reports that inform go to market programs and direct marketing campaigns
General Corporate Data Science and Analytics Support Work with the BI team and other departments to optimize and enhance GAF data structures to ensure that market data is available to the organization.
Provide specific analysis around special situations for the organization (e.g., broad market stories for major customer presentations, review of third party database providers).
Perform other duties as assigned.

Business Acumen
Facilitating Change
Decision Making

Communication
Education, knowledge of analytics industry and programming options
Consideration of process improvements
Able to multi-task and has the ability to work cross functionally, within and outside of department.
Technical knowledge/skills (entry, intermediate, advanced)Intermediate experience working with Big Data and noSQL.
Advanced knowledge of the reporting capabilities of Android, IOS and other application platforms.
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Dynamics CRM
Advanced experience with Oracle or Microsoft relational database programs
Intermediate understanding of CMS, Web and related technologies
Advanced experience with Oracle Marketing Cloud (Eloqua), SQL, R, Python and databases such as Hadoop and HBase/HIVE/Solr.

General knowledge/skills (entry, intermediate, advanced)Advanced presentation skills, able to ensure training will be effectively used
Advanced ability to present complex information in simple terms

Intermediate leadership skills
Intermediate teaching skills

Microsoft server and analytic tools.

title: Data Science Engineer - Eden Prairie, MN or Telecommute
desc:
We're changing the way health care works for the better.  That means consulting with our members, partnering with our physicians, and delivering drugs in the most efficient and effective way. Join us and start doing your life's best work. (sm)

Primary Responsibilities:
Extract data from internal systems and work closely with the modeling teams to prepare data for analysis 
Assist with further processing of the data to aid data scientists during the development process 
Translate business requirements into analytic  implementation code for use within internal systems and models 
Develop reports and  analysis to inform management on model performance, and/or tools to facilitate understanding of model results 
Model/Analytics Implementation.  Deploy and maintain model performance monitoring processes. Follow standard SDLC processes and agile Scrum program management principles.  Become one of the Data science/Predictive Analytics team experts on internal servers and databases 
Be a positive team player, comfortable working in a team environment setting for project deliverables and delivering High quality results as well meeting project deadlines 
Develop and/or maintain a library of commonly used macros/modules and programs for data extraction, transformations, analytic model scoring execution, monitoring and performances etc. 
Support existing Analytics processing in a tier-production environment prioritizing SLA returns for claims processing of Statistical Models

Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Data Science, (bio) statistics, applied statistics, applied mathematics, economics, or similar quantitative fields of study 
5+ years of development and production deployment experience with SAS (Unix), SAS EG & SAS Tools 
5+ years of development and production deployment experience with SQL, PL/SQL for Oracle or SQL Server 
2+ years of development experience with R, Python, Spark, Hadoop, HBASE, HIVE or H20
2+ years of software development and engineering experience on SAS Unix/Grid environments, Hadoop Eco system

Claim Data Analytics Integration with SAS/R/Python or other relevant ETL development experience 
Microsoft Office Products experience
Preferred Qualifications: 
Master’s Degree in Engineering, Data Science, (bio) statistics, applied statistics, applied mathematics, economics, or similar quantitative fields of study
2+ years predictive modeling/Machine learning implementation experience in R, Python using Hadoop, Oracle 11g/12c and MS SQL Server 2016/2017 
Development experience in Data sourcing from Netezza, Teradata or Hadoop clusters 
Agile Project Management experiences on Analytic  development and deployment 
XML domain knowledge 
Knowledge of ICD-10 coding of Medical claims 
Agile methodology analytics development experience
Careers with Optum. Here's the idea. We built an entire organization around one giant objective; make the health system work better for everyone. So when it comes to how we use the world's large accumulation of health-related information, or guide health and lifestyle choices or manage pharmacy benefits for millions, our first goal is to leap beyond the status quo and uncover new ways to serve. Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, brings together some of the greatest minds and most advanced ideas on where health care has to go in order to reach its fullest potential. For you, that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges that matter. Optum, incredible ideas in one incredible company and a singular opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)

Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.
