title: QC - Data Reviewer
desc: Job Description: Responsible for the review of analytical test data and documentation generated within the QC Laboratory; ensuring that established protocols, text methods, SOP's, and GMP practices are in compliance with external regulatory requirements and internal processes* Reviews in-process, final product, raw materials, stability, and cleaning validation/verification test results for accuracy and completeness* Follows and supports internal procedures and external regulations regarding proper documentation (GDP)* Ensures data (including electronic as required), notebooks, and log books are completed and reviewed* Reviews instrument calibration and preventative maintenance documents to ensure data conforms to established SOP and/or protocol requirements* Review product specification, raw material, and stability forms for accuracy in data reporting* Report any issues/deviations to supervisor for investigation* Coach analysts as necessary for improved documentation and process compliance; work with analysts for appropriate corrections and omissions to be corrected Work Environment: Open Lab Environment, Changing environment with procedures, Still paper based for now, very manual.This position will 99.9% of the time be at the review desk (not at the bench).Very busy on 1st shift - more stressful and requires responsibility and accountabilityCulture: Flexible, don't be fearful to ask questions, Accountable, Responsible, Respectful, Honesty, Integrity, Compliant!Shift: Monday - Friday 7:00 - 3:30 (or 8 hours after start time up to 8:00) Qualifications: AS or BS in Chemistry, Biology or other science field 4 + years' experience working in a cGMP Quality Control Laboratory within Pharma industry1+ year experience in a Data Review role or capacityUSP/EP experience is a plusSOP Revision experience is a plus Performance Expectations: Will train with the other data reviewer for a few weeks after start.First 2 weeks will be heavy on introduction to the lab and SOP's.Best Vs. Avg - Ability to work with others and approachable/not putting people on their heels, Proactive in reviewing data to keep work flow moving.Evaluation: Work efficiently and effectively with low error rate found in QA, feedback from other analystsDis-qualifiers: Defiant personality or stuck in ways. Non-Compliant. Someone who wants to move back to the bench. Additional Information: Worldwide company devoted exclusively to the animal health industry. For more than two decades, they have been an industry leader in the scientific research, development, manufacture and sale of quality, proven veterinary pharmaceutical products.Pharmaceutical products are in the heart worm, tick and flea, dermatology, antibiotics, endocrinology and oral hygiene markets. About Aerotek:Our people are everything. As a Best of Staffing® Client and Talent leader, Aerotek® Inc. has distinguished itself as a leader in recruiting and staffing services, by having a deep understanding of the intersection of talent and business. As a strategic partner to more than 17,000 clients and 300,000 contract employees every year, Aerotek's people-focused approach yields competitive advantages for its clients and rewarding careers for its contract employees. Headquartered in Hanover, Md., Aerotek operates a network of over 230 non-franchised offices with more than 6,000 internal employees dedicated to serving our customers. Aerotek is an operating company of Allegis Group, a global talent solutions provider. To learn more, visit aerotek.com.The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.If you would like to request a reasonable accommodation, such as the modification or adjustment of the job application process or interviewing process due to a disability, please call 888-237-6835 or email accommodation@aerotek .com for other accommodation options. title: SR. GLOBAL DATA MANAGER
desc: Janssen Research & Development, LLC, a member of Johnson & Johnson's Family of Companies, is recruiting for a Global Data Manager. At the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, what matters most is helping people live full and healthy lives. We focus on treating, curing and preventing some of the most devastating and complex diseases of our time. And we pursue the most promising science, wherever it might be found. Janssen Research & Development, LLC discovers and develops innovative medical solutions to address important unmet medical needs in oncology, immunology, neuroscience, infectious diseases and vaccines, and cardiovascular and metabolic diseases. Please visit www.JanssenRnD.com for more information. The GDM will be responsible to take a leadership role with the CRO, the trial customer(s) and other internal and external partners to establish, align and confirm data management expectations for assigned trial(s). With the trial customer, CRO and other functional partners the GDM establishes conventions and quality expectations for clinical data and sets timelines and follow-up regularly to ensure delivery of all Data Management milestones. The Sr. GDM will ensure compliance with Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), policies and regulatory requirements from trial start-up through data-base lock and trial close-out. Represent functional area(s) in divisional/company-wide process initiatives. Principal responsibilities will includePerforms trial level oversight controls as described in the oversight plan, Quality Control (QC) process and work instructions with minimal Data Delivery Lead (DDL) direction. Reviews clinical data management documents ensuring appropriate quality, scientific content, organization, clarity, accuracy, format and consistency. Ensures compliance with regulatory guidelines and the documentation matrix. Ensures real-time inspection readiness of all Data Delivery (DD) deliverables for the trial; Participate in Regulatory Agency and J&J internal audits as necessary. Plans and tracks content, format, quality, and timing of data management deliverables, including, but not limited to, CRF, data review plan, QC plan, oversight plan, database release plan, final datasets, submission plan and archival. Ensures deliverables are on time. Takes a leadership role with the assigned clinical working group(s) to ensure that DD and TA trial needs and deliverables are met. Identifies and communicates lessons learned, best practices and frequently asked questions at the trial level. Identifies and participates in process, system, and tool improvement initiatives within DD. Presents and trains at investigator and monitor meetings. QualificationsQualificationsA minimum of a BS/BA degree or professional experience equivalent. Minimum of 3 years Clinical Data Management experience. Experience with any of the following Therapeutic Areas preferred: Oncology, Neuroscience, Immunology, Cardiovascular, Metabolics, Infectious Diseases, Vaccines. Electronic Data Capture (Medidata RAVE, Inform) platforms preferred Experience in clinical drug development within the pharmaceutical industry or related industry. SAS experience is desired Vendor oversight experience is desired. Team leadership experience is desired. Project management experience is desired. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. title: Study Data Manager III
desc:
Kelly Scientific Resources is the world's most recognized brand in Scientific Staffing with more than 100 locations in the North America, Europe and the Pacific Rim. Our scientists contribute to the research and development of products that are used daily in the home, such as medical devices or pharmaceutical products. We employ more than 700 clinical research professionals and 4,500 scientists on an average workday on a temporary, project and full-time basis in a broad spectrum of industries and disciplines.  We currently have an exciting opportunity in the San Francisco area as a Study Data Manager III.The informatics group within Clinical Data Capture group is looking for an individual with strong experience building studies in Rave and performing amendments/migrations.This is a short term opportunity that can allow a Clinical Programmer to experience the working environment in an IT organization within the Biotech industry.This individual will work with the IT group on the Data Capture Hub, a project to extract data from Rave using ODM and store it in a central location.   The individual will work as an SME to come up with scenarios that can happen in Rave on a day-to-day basis and especially during study amendments/migrations.  The scenarios will need to be documented and performed in a test environment.Skills: 1. Experience as a Clinical Programmer.2.  3+ years hands-on experience with Medidata Rave Architect and Amendment modules is mandatory.2.  Good communication skills and willing to work in a Global environment.3.  Independent worker.Keywords:Education: B.A./B.S. or equivalent with a minimum of 3 years’ experience in Clinical Programming and Medidata Rave Skills and Experience:Required Skills:BIOSTATISTICSCDMCLINICAL DATA MANAGEMENTDATA MANAGEMENTDRUG DEVELOPMENTAdditional Skills:MS OFFICEORGANIZATIONAL SKILLSSOLUTIONSSTATISTICAL PROGRAMMINGCLINICAL RESEARCHDATABASEDATABASE DEVELOPMENTLEADSPROTOCOL DESIGNTESTINGWEB DATABASE3 month contract rolePlease apply now for immediate consideration!

title: Scientist, Analytical Development, Separation Sciences
desc:
At ProClinical, we are recruiting for a permanent position as a Scientist – Analytical Development and Separation Sciences, at a clinical-stage vaccine company. The qualified individual will have experience with separation sciences methods used for analysis of complex protein samples, including recombinant protein biotherapeutics and vaccine products. Prior experience with the development and application of spectroscopic, chromatography, capillary electrophoresis, SDS-PAGE is required.  Familiarity with other analytical techniques for protein analysis and characterization, including mass spectrometry, are a plus.  The position requires initiation and involvement in development and qualification/validation of assays, assistance in assay investigations and troubleshooting.  The ideal candidate will have experience making detailed observations, analyzing data, interpreting results, preparing reports and standard operating procedures, and exercising appropriate technical judgment in the design, execution, and interpretation of experiments.  The candidate will work independently and collaborate with other team members and other groups.ResponsibilitiesDevelop and qualify chromatographic and electrophoretic methods for product release, in-process sample testing and characterization of recombinant protein vaccine products.
Apply new cutting-edge technologies for in-process testing.
Act as a subject matter expert on cross-functional teams and guide development work at external contractor organizations.
Perform method qualification/validation, and method transfer to other departments (e.g. QC).
Thoroughly analyze results and methods, solve analytical problems, and troubleshoot assays.
Maintain effective communication with process development, formulation, QC, discovery, and clinical groups.
Write, review, and edit SOPs.
Prepare technical reports and scientific journal publications and presentations.
Provide selected sections for CMC regulatory filing.
Present scientific findings at internal meetings and external conferences.
Skills And RequirementsPh.D. in biological science, biochemistry, or analytical chemistry.
Thorough understanding of electrophoretic and chromatographic techniques in protein analysis and familiarity with gel electrophoresis, HPLC, and CE methods required.
Experience in pharmaceutical, biologics, and/or vaccine development preferred.
Demonstrated ability to critically analyze data using statistical tools and to compile technical reports.

To Apply:
Please click on the Apply button. Please include a short note outlining why you are interested in the role and why you think you are suitable.
In case you have difficulty in applying or if you have any questions, please call Herman Bradford at ( 1) 6463671088 or upload your resume on our website - www.proclinical.com.
A full job description is available on request.
ProClinical is a specialist employment agency and recruitment business, providing job opportunities within major pharmaceutical, biopharmaceutical, biotechnology and medical device companies.

title: Data Review Scientist
desc:
About the Company:
At Charles River, we are passionate about our role in improving the quality of people’s lives. Our mission, our excellent science and our strong sense of purpose guide us in all that we do, and we approach each day with the knowledge that our work helps to improve the health and well-being of many across the globe.
Our collective efforts as One Charles River are the key to our success, and we know that every person is important. Every day, each of us plays a critical role in making a difference in the quality of people's lives.
From our animal technicians and security guards to our business managers and executive team, we’re working together to support better, safer and more effective research. 
BASIC SUMMARY:
Responsible for the analytical process work for the DNA sequence laboratory.  Assemble all sequence data and generate identification reports. Ensure that all regulatory requirements and GMP compliance are adhered to.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Provide daily support for the sequence data assembly process.
Analyze, generate and evaluate identification reports with accuracy and precision meeting the standards of all accrediting and regulatory agencies.
Provide support for trouble shooting problems in the sequencing laboratory.
Maintain and enhance sample tracking databases in accordance with SOPs.
Perform and improve upon procedures and protocol.
Apply attention to detail in identification, record keeping and result verification.
Provide support for laboratory as needed.
Provide support for regulatory agencies as required.
May participate in special projects.
Ensure adherence to pertinent regulatory requirements and to departmental policies, practices and procedures [SOPs, safety procedures and biosafety protocols].
Perform all other related duties as assigned.



Education: Bachelor’s Degree (B.A. /B.S.) in Biological Science or related discipline required.

Experience: Three years of experience in Biology or related field. Laboratory, sequencing and data assembly experience is preferred. Experience in using sequencing software and/or NCBI a plus.
An equivalent combination of education and experience may be accepted as a satisfactory substitute for the specific education and experience listed above.

Certification/Licensure: None.

Other: Must have working knowledge of the Quality System 

Equal Employment Opportunity

Charles River Laboratories, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/Disabled/Vet

title: Administrative Analyst, College of Science
desc:
Administrative Analyst, College of Science
(Administrative Analyst/Specialist – Exempt II)
MB2017-PD2345
Apply Today! Open until filled. Application Screening Begins on Monday, Oct. 9, 2017
 
PURPOSE:
Under the general supervision of Dean of the College of Science, the Administrative Analyst provides administrative and technical support and oversight of the day-to-day administrative operations and activities of the College. The Analyst provides administrative support to the Dean by coordinating staff and general administrative functions including budget development, analysis, planning and coordination in a large, highly complex environment. Responsibilities also include operational and strategic planning; research and analysis; preparation of reports and presentations; the design, development and implementation of procedures and targeted initiatives; and, coordination of administrative functions providing lead work direction and training to various units within the College and office personnel.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include, but are not limited to, the following:
FISCAL MANAGEMENT
Provides support to the Dean, Associate Dean and Department Chairs related to fiscal management and analysis, budget development, and administration, of all state and selected external funds. Duties include, but are not limited to:
establishing fiscal processes, procedures, and timelines in the College;
providing budget oversight , monitoring, reconciliation, including all payroll matters;
providing analysis in an effective written or presentation form;
compiling fiscal forecasts for annual and future budgetary needs;
coordinating annual fiscal projects specific to the College and/or University; and preparing a wide-variety of fiscal and accounting documents.
PERSONNEL PROCESSES
In consultation with the Dean, performs and assists with a wide-variety of personnel administrative duties to ensure that policies and procedures are followed in a timely manner. Duties include, but are not limited to:
serving as the prime contact for all personnel related issues in the college;
overseeing the hiring of part time lecturers and teaching and graduate assistant hires in the college ensuring that entitlements are met, data entry is correct, and contracts are generated accurately and efficiently;
providing oversight to all full-time recruitments in the College to ensure that recruitment documents are complete, accurate, and processed in a timely manner;
providing detailed, comparison salary information to the Dean for salary placement and startup packages. Recommends funding options for all hires if needed;
preparing and processing staff recruitment and hiring forms to ensure position assignments, salary placement, etc. is accurate;
monitoring faculty workloads;
overseeing the instructional student assistant hiring to ensure that appointments necessary and within budget;
preparing, reviewing, tracking faculty and staff additional employment contracts;
preparing, reviewing, tracking external contracts/service agreements; and
organizing the college lecturer evaluation to process and timelines.
GENERAL ADMINISTRATION
Provides analysis, design, implementation, and evaluation of various administrative systems to support organizational unit operations. Performing specialized or general duties including, but are not limited to: advising management on policy and procedures related to fiscal and budgetary analysis and management, personnel administration, and related operational functions to meet programmatic goals; acting as an internal and external resource on policy and procedural matters; participation in the planning and documentation of College meetings and activities; leading or coordinating projects involving the management of external parties; and participating in university work groups to keep informed and provide input to upcoming modifications to university procedures.
CURRICULUM SUPPORT
Provide support to the Dean and Associate Dean in college curriculum matters, to include the following:
Attend all College Curriculum meetings. Assist the Associate Dean or Curriculum Committee members as needed, with agenda preparation, minutes, and transmit Curriculum Decisions to the Academic Senate;
Analyze course schedules for accuracy, time block compliance, course history, and curriculum costs.
DATA ANALYSIS AND REPORTING
Serve as the prime contact for the data needs of the College. Interprets requests from the Dean, Associate Dean, Department Chair, and/or Faculty and provides in-depth analysis to assist with program analysis, enrollment and retention, grant report writing, and research needs.

Other Functions:
Provide lead work direction to others to include training, guidance and oversight to college staff and students as needed.
Perform other job-related duties and special projects as assigned.
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES: 
Thorough knowledge of policies, procedures, laws and regulations pertaining to the applicable program and/or administrative specialty. Demonstrated expertise in and advanced knowledge of the principles, problems, and methods of public and business administration and operational and fiscal management. Working knowledge of and ability to apply standard theories, principles, practices, and techniques applicable to the program and/or administrative specialty to develop conclusions and make recommendations
Skills: Expertise in administrative survey techniques, operations and systems analysis, statistical and research methods. Demonstrated consultative skills in working with internal and external constituent groups. Skill in the research, development and evaluation of policies and programs, including skill in the collection, evaluation, and interpretation of data to develop sound conclusions and make appropriate recommendations. Expertise in investigating and analyzing problems with a broad administrative impact and implications.
Ability to:  understand problems from a broad, interactive perspective and discern applicable underlying principles to conceive of and develop strategic solutions; work with representatives from public and private entities and handle potentially sensitive situations; effectively present ideas and concepts in written or presentation format and use consultative and facilitation skills to gain consensus; interpret and evaluate results to develop sound conclusions and recommend new or revised policies; anticipate problems and address them proactively; train others on new skills and procedures and provide lead work direction; take initiative and independently plan, organize, coordinate, and perform work in various situations where numerous and diverse demands are involved; make independent decisions and exercise sound judgment; compile, write, and present reports; establish and maintain effective working relationships within and outside the work group and serve as liaison for the organizational unit.


MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
Entry to this classification requires general knowledge and skills in the applicable administrative and/or program field with a foundational knowledge of public administration principles, practices, and methods. This foundation would normally be obtained through a bachelor's degree and/or equivalent training and administrative work experience involving study, analysis, and/or evaluation leading to the development or improvement of administrative policies, procedures, practices, or programs.
SPECIALIZED SKILLS REQUIRED: 
Skill in: Excel (including pivot tables/charts, linking worksheets, and creating formulas), preparing PowerPoint presentations to include statistical information, providing exceptional customer service, and planning and executing events. 
Demonstrated experience in budget development, analysis, and management; preparing funding proposals; analyzing complex data and developing logical solutions to complex problems; providing curriculum support; developing reports and electronic presentation. Ability to collect and evaluate data, and develop valid conclusions and sound recommendations.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS: 
A Master's degree in Administration, Finance, Accounting or a related field. Experience in and familiarity with the California State University system or similar institution. Technical fluency with Hyperion, Oracle/PeopleSoft, CSU Common Management System or equivalent information system; Microsoft Office Professional Suite, and Google mail and calendaring programs.

SPECIAL CONDITIONS OF EMPLOYMENT & POSITION DESIGNATIONS:
A background check (including a criminal records check) must be completed satisfactorily before any candidate can be offered a position with CSUMB. Failure to satisfactorily complete the background check may affect the application status of applicants or continued employment of current employees who apply for this position.
The person holding this position is considered a “mandated reporter" under the California Child Abuse and Neglect Reporting Act and is required to comply with the requirements set forth in CSU Executive Order 1083 as a condition of employment.
This position will have a duty to report to the Campus Title IX Officer information pertaining to victims of sex discrimination, sexual harassment, sexual misconduct, dating/domestic violence, and stalking as required by CSU Executive Order 1095.
This position has been designated as a sensitive position with:
access to, or control over, cash, checks, credit cards, and/or credit card account information;
responsibility or access/possession of building master or sub-master keys for building access; and
access to and responsibility for detailed personally identifiable Level 1 confidential information about students, faculty, staff or alumni that is protected, personal or sensitive as defined in the CSU Information Security Data Classification Standards)

This position is required to comply with confidentiality requirements outlined in the Department of Education's Family Educational Rights and Privacy and California's Educational Code Chapter 13 regarding sensitive student issues.
Occasional evenings and/or weekend work is required.
WORK ENVIRONMENT:
Office environment with standard equipment and tasks. Position requires working at a computer and desk for extended periods of time. May require travel between campus offices and off-campus locations.
SALARY: 

Anticipated hiring salary in the high $4,000's/month to low $5,000's/month. For salary range info see: CSU Salary Schedule. CSUMB offers an attractive employee benefits package, CSU Benefits R09. The University Corporation at CSU Monterey Bay also provides access to affordable campus housing, Employee Housing.

TENTATIVE RECRUITMENT TIMELINE: 
Week of Sept. 25 - Interviews via Skype 
Week of Oct. 2 - Successful Candidates invited to On-Campus Interview 

APPLICATION PROCEDURE:
For full consideration, submit the required documents by 5:00 p.m. on the priority screen date listed above. For assistance or if you require an accommodation, please call (831) 582-3389. For computer/online access you may visit the Tanimura and Antle Family Memorial Library (map). 
CSU Monterey Bay is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer. We consider qualified applicants for employment without regard to: Age, Disability, Race or Ethnicity, Gender, Gender Identity or Expression, Nationality, Religion, Sexual Orientation, Genetic Information, Veteran or Military Status.
All employees must be eligible for employment in the U.S.

 Apply Here

title: Data Modeler/Analyst
desc:
***ONLY GC AND US CITIZEN CANDIDATES APPLY TO THIS POSITION***



***CLIENT REQUIRES CANDIDATES TO BE AVAILABLE FOR AN IN-PERSON INTERVIEW***



Job Description: 

JOB SUMMARY This position is for Data Modeler. Develop, maintain, and support the company’s logical data environment. Participate in projects relative to the requirements and design of the logical data environment. Provide guidance to developers, database administration, and data administration concerning design and transition to the physical data environment. Propose ways to improve the environment and help set data administration direction. Advocate the development and use of an enterprise data model and metadata management. Participate in large, cross-enterprise projects requiring strong analysis, design, and leadership skills.
REQUIREMENTS Bachelor’s degree in Computer Information Systems, Management Information systems, or Computer Science or related job experience. Erwin data Modeler or equivalent tool 2 years’ relational database administration in Oracle/SQL Server/DB2 etc. 5 years as data modeler involved in mid- to large-scale system development projects Exposure to all System Development Life Cycle (SDLC) phases, with experience directly contributing to design, development, validation, implementation and operational support activities Data analysis/profiling and reverse engineering of data. Strong knowledge of relational and multi-dimensional database architectures. 



***ONLY GC AND US CITIZEN CANDIDATES APPLY TO THIS POSITION***


***CLIENT REQUIRES CANDIDATES TO BE AVAILABLE FOR AN IN-PERSON INTERVIEW***




Responsibilities: ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Conduct sessions and interviews to gather data requirements. Understand and apply logical entity-relational design concepts. Perform enterprise and project data modeling, including model consolidation and integration. Document, develop, and maintain data models in Erwin or equivalent modeling tools. Participate in business process modeling, working with the developers, with respect to data mapping and validation of the data’s life cycle. Safeguard the integrity of the logical design in true third-normal form as a reflection of the business not a system. Manage and establish standards for naming and abbreviation conventions, data definitions, ownership, documentation, procedures, and techniques. Market and educate on the data administration role to facilitate its advocacy and reinstitution. Consult with DBAs on the translation of logical models into physical models. Demonstrate clear, concise, accurate, and timely communication to management, peers, and customers; in written and oral form. Adopt, support, and participate in the implementation of the Enterprise Data Management Strategy. Possess a good understanding of the company and the transportation industry. Deal with vendor-related issues concerning the support, implementation, upgrade and impact analysis, evaluation, and selection of third-party products.

title: Big Data Platform Engineer

7+ years of relevant IT experience

Experience with replication, backup and restore and disaster recovery

AWS certifications are a big plus
Advanced knowledge of Unix/Linux

title: Data Scientist
company: Immediate need for a talented Data Scientist with experience in the Biotechnology Industry. This is a 12 Months Contract opportunity with long-term potential located in Creve Coeur (St. Louis), MO. Please review the job description below: Job ID: 17-18610...
desc:
Immediate need for a talented Data Scientist with experience in the Biotechnology Industry. This is a 12 Months Contract opportunity with long-term potential located in Creve Coeur (St. Louis), MO.  Please review the job description below: 

 
Job ID: 17-18610 


Key Responsibilities: 
 This position is for a Data Scientist to work on operations research and predictive analytics within our client’s Global Supply Chain Analytics team. The responsibilities of this position are the analysis of agricultural data to maximize production quantity and quality, while managing cost, risk and logistics through the development of mathematical optimization, simulation solutions, and scenario modelling. As a Data Scientist, you will also develop strategies to identify new opportunities, expand existing analytical methods, provide insights, and build practical solutions to complex business problems. 

 
Key Requirements and Technology Experience: 
·  M.S (required) or Ph.D. (preferred) in Operations Research, Operations Management, Engineering, Management Science, Mathematics, or another related quantitative discipline. ·  3-5 year's relevant experience delivering stochastic/analytical solutions to complex business problems. ·  Theoretical and practical experience in deterministic optimization and algorithm development related to operations management is a requirement, including experience with commercial optimization software (ex. OPL, GAMS, IBM DOC). ·  Experience with software development and architecture related to operations research, machine learning, geospatial analysis, and artificial intelligence. ·  Expertise in programming and database languages (ex. Python, R, Scala, SQL). ·  Demonstrated experience in optimizing demand, supply, and network flow challenges related to planning, scheduling, space utilization, and customer service levels. ·  Demonstrated problem solving experience analyzing complex data using statistical and advanced analytical methods to deliver predictive and prescriptive insights. ·  Exceptional organizational, interpersonal, and written communication skills. ·  Ability to work in a matrix environment and influence people at varying levels of responsibility. ·  Candidates must demonstrate business aptitude, the ability to rapidly learn new problem domains and become conversant in the domain with business users. 







Must haves:
 ●  Operations Research 70% and Machine Learning 
 ●  Python, R, Scala, SQL 
 ●  Familiar with the Cloud Computing. 
 ●  Must be able to show that they completed a project from beginning to end. 
 ●  Master's degree is required. PhD is preferred. 

 
Desired skills/experience: 
·  Experience in supply chain management, agriculture, and/or laboratory science. ·  Background in big data technologies including Apache Hadoop, Spark and IaaS such as AWS and Google Cloud is highly desirable.
  

 Our client is a leading Biotechnology Industry and we are currently interviewing to fill this and other similar contract positions. Qualified candidates should apply online for immediate consideration.

Job Details:
Job Title : Hadoop / Big Data Developer

Location : Beaverton, Oregon
Duration : Long Term Contract Position
 
Job Description:
Customer is embracing Big Data technologies to enable data-driven decisions. We’re looking to expand our Hadoop Engineering team to keep pace.  As a Sr. Hadoop developer you will work with a variety of talented Nike teammates and be a driving force for building solutions.  You will be working on development projects related to commerce and web analytics.
 
Responsibilities:
Design and implement distributed data processing pipelines using Spark, Hive, Pig, Python, Scala, and other tools and languages prevalent in the Hadoop ecosystem. Ability to design and implement end to end solution.
Ability to design and implement end to end solution in AWS
Build utilities, user defined functions, and frameworks to better enable data flow patterns.
Research, evaluate and utilize new technologies/tools/frameworks centered around Hadoop and other elements in the Big Data space.
Define and build data acquisitions and consumption strategies
Work with teams to resolving operational & performance issues
Work with architecture/engineering leads and other teams to ensure quality solutions are implements, and engineering best practices are defined and adhered to.
 
Qualification:
MS/BS degree in a computer science field or related discipline
6+ years’ experience in large-scale software development
1+ year experience in Hadoop
Strong Java programming, shell scripting, Python, and SQL
Strong development skills around AWS, Hadoop, EMR, MapReduce, SPARK, Pig
Strong understanding of Hadoop internals
Good understanding of file formats including JSON, Parquet, Avro, and others
Experience with databases like Oracle
Experience with performance/scalability tuning, algorithms and computational complexity
Experience (at least familiarity) with data warehousing, dimensional modeling and ETL development
Ability to understand and ERDs and relational database schemas
Proven ability to work cross functional teams to deliver appropriate resolution
 
Nice to have:
Experience with AWS components and services
Experience with open source NOSQL technologies such as HBase, Dynamo DB, Cassandra
Experience with messaging & complex event processing systems such as Kafka and Storm
Scala
Machine learning frameworks
Statistical analysis with Python, R or similar
 

Thanks and Regards,
 
Nilesh Awadhiya
Sr. Associate Recruiter
ACS Global Tech Solutions Pvt. Ltd.,
2400 Meadowbrook Parkway, Duluth, GA 30096
T: +1-972-497-2327 / 347-515-6082

title: Senior Data Insights Analyst
desc:
We believe that every smile should be healthy and happy
and we love what we do. We believe our members come first and their voice
should always be heard.   That means having quality, affordable dental
insurance that is simple to buy and easy to use so we design our products and
service to create a first class shopping, buying and service experience for
everyone. 

 

We are supportive and provide a collaborative and
creative work environment where an individual’s voice is essential to our
success. You will work in an environment that demonstrates respect, supports
bold moves and seeks new ideas to help drive change. You will have the freedom
to make decisions and take ownership of all you do, where challenges can be
met, through the use of new technology and creative solutions. 

 

To this end, we’re investing in the creation of a
market-leading direct-to-consumer (D2C) business by developing retail-focused
capabilities. To achieve this we need you! We’re looking to hire a Senior
Data Insights Analyst to join our new Insights & Analytics team. Your
contributions will be critical as we build, from the ground up, our analytics
capabilities including data mining, dashboards, driving acquisition &
retention campaigns and eventually, data science initiatives such as predictive
modeling. You’ll be working within a new and growing business unit responsible
for our enterprise’s product management, new product development and marketing
efforts for the individual buyer market. If you enjoy turning data into better
decisions, we’d love to speak with you. 

  

   Description:


Design,
build and continually evolve a suite of reports and dashboards that
surface key metrics and allow decision makers to monitor and drill into
areas of interest across our line of products 
Collaborate
across business functions such as marketing, operations, actuarial, and
product management; recommend and execute in-depth analyses to answer
questions and address issues you’ve identified together 
Own the
end-to-end data mining and analytics process for critical projects by
gathering requirements, collecting & transforming data, analyzing,
determining business implications and disseminating findings 
Areas of
focus are broad and include enrollment & lapse reporting, marketing
campaign effectiveness (including attribution), customer lifetime value,
benefits utilization, customer service, satisfaction & loyalty and
demographic & psychographic profiling 
Partner
with database developers to continually grow and improve our marketing
data warehouses. Ensure data integrity and recommend improvements and
additional data sources that will help us efficiently and effectively
leverage our data. 
Be a
champion of data – help us build a culture of fact-driven decision
making. 






Requirements: 

Three to
five years of experience in a data analytics role accessing large
datasets to gain insights and influence decision making. 
Two
years using SQL in a database environment for reporting and data mining.

Demonstrated
experience with Tableau or similar BI tool. 
Proficiency
with MS Office, especially Excel using advanced formulas. 
Tenacious
approach to problem solving. 
Strong
communication, prioritization and project management skills. 
Bachelor’s
degree in business, economics, computer science, statistics,
mathematics, engineering or other quantitative field. 
As we
grow our capabilities, we’re looking for someone with a hunger for
continual learning and desire to grow their skillset. 

 

Bonus points: 

 

Predictive
analytics experience 
Health /
dental insurance experience

title: Senior Data Scientist - Expansion Planning & Analysis
desc:
The Sr. Analyst, Expansion Planning & Analysis, is part of a team that provides analytical support behind CarMax’s investment in geographic expansion and related growth initiatives, within the Treasury department. This position provides a driven strategic financial thinker the opportunity to help build a Fortune 500 company in the midst of national expansion.This individual will have strong analytic skills, grasping the big picture while creating analyses and quantitative models with sharp attention to detail and strong intellectual curiosity. This individual will possess a strong ability to effectively partner with a variety of departments, at all levels of the organization, to facilitate sound decision-making in CarMax’s investment activity.  ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES      Responsibilities for this role include, but are not limited to:• Take a lead role in the all aspects of predictive analytic tools used by the broader EP&A team; i.e. the development, evaluation, implementation, maintenance, and enhancement of predictive models and processeso Build and maintain tools and data sets used for New Store Investment analyseso Closely integrate with the broader team to effectively consult and problem solve on sales forecasting applicationso Maximize process efficiency and automation for broader team• Analyze store performance versus expectationso Uncover key drivers of unexplained sales variationo Apply findings to create or refine predictive modelso Identify and communicate operational opportunitieso Validate current forecast models and business assumptions• Partner with internal teams to help develop sound investment profiles for decisions and initiatives with geo-spatial, consumer demand, or physical expansion componentso Gather inputs & appropriately challenge assumptionso Create financial models to provide visibility on expected and actual financial impact (ROI, earnings)o Help translate between operational metrics and financial outcomeso Effectively communicate findings, verbally and through written presentations, to peers and management • Demonstrate strong results focus, project management, and teamwork to complete ad-hoc analyses across a variety of business areas



QUALIFICATIONS:To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.• Demonstrated top caliber analysis, strategic thinking, and financial modeling skillso Ability to apply business and technical knowledge to evaluate and solve complex problems, produce results, and make recommendationso Analytical curiosity and ability to flex between big picture strategic thinking and sharp attention to detailo Ability to develop, adjust and execute plans to obtain desired, timely resultso Ability to deliver great results while simultaneously managing several projects• Strong reasoning abilityo Ability to assimilate numerous qualitative and quantitative inputs in the face of ambiguity and drill down to a good decisiono Ability to identify and analyze problems, generate and evaluate alternative solutions, and develop recommendations• Excellent interpersonal, communication, and courageous leadership skillso Ability to build and maintain strong relationships throughout the organization, and collaborate with other departmentso Ability to communicate in a clear, concise, and open manner through verbal, written, and non-verbal methods, to audiences of various sizes and levels EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE:• Undergraduate degree in relevant quantitative field (e.g. Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Finance, Economics), with an excellent academic record• Graduate degree desirable, but not required• 3+ years of experience in an analytical role• Experience with advanced quantitative analytical techniques, such as statistical modeling, test design and measurement, data science, financial DCF modeling, etc.• Strong computer skills: Excel, PowerPoint, programming languages

title: 2018 Janssen R&D Pharmaceutical Development and Manufacturing Sciences (PDMS) Co-op - PA, NJ
desc: Janssen Research & Development Pharmaceutical Research & Development, L.L.C., a member of the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies, is recruiting for a Pharmaceutical Development and Manufacturing Sciences (PDMS) Co-op to be based in NJ or PA. The duration of this co-op is January - June or July - December 2018. Janssen Research & Development (Johnson & Johnson) Pharmaceutical Research & Development, L.L.C., develops treatments that improve the health and lifestyles of people worldwide. Research and development areas encompass novel targets in neurologic disorders, gastroenterology, oncology, infectious disease, diabetes, hematology, metabolic disorders, immunologic disorders, and reproductive medicine. The Co-op will support the PDMS group, a part of Johnson & Johnson Pharmaceutical Research & Development. The PDMS organization is responsible for the development of technology used in the large-scale manufacture of pharmaceutical products including active pharmaceutical ingredients, formulations, analytical methods, and devices to enable patient dosing of these pharmaceuticals. PDMS is also responsible for the manufacture of toxicology supplies and clinical supplies intended for phase 1 and phase 2 studies. Opportunities for co-ops exist at our PA and NJ facilities in the following groupsActive Pharmaceutical Ingredient - Large Molecules Drug Product Development Analytical Development Strategic Operations Supply Management Learn about all aspects of bio-pharmaceutical manufacturing including fermentation/cell culture, purification, drug product formulation, clinical supply manufacture, and manufactured product technical and analytical support. A Co-op assigned to one of the development areas will participate in the planning, execution, and analysis of a wide variety of experiments, with guidance from an experienced scientist/engineer. The individual will assist in the creation of a manufacturing cell line, development and implementation of biological manufacturing processes, scale-up procedures, and test methods relevant to the processing, formulation, and evaluation of monoclonal antibodies and other biologics. A Co-op assigned to the Strategic Operations group may assist with the implementation of IT systems such as electronic laboratory notebooks or data acquisition systems or may assist in the development of process modeling tools. Finally, a Co-op in the Supply Management area will assist in managing distribution of clinical supplies and development of supply plans. All assignments offer the opportunity to work with cross-functional teams to implement projects involving capacity improvements, cost savings, process improvements. QualificationsEnrolled in an accredited college throughout the duration of the co-op. Completion of a minimum of two years towards a BS or pursuing a MS or PhD in Chemical or Biochemical Engineering; Chemistry/Analytical Chemistry; Biology; Biochemistry; Molecular Biology; Biotechnology; Microbiology; Supply Chain Management or related science or engineering disciplines is required. Previous co-op or internship experience is preferred. Student must be available from January - June or July - December 2018 and have the ability to work full-time (40 hours/week) during that time. Extensive PC based skills, including Microsoft Excel, Word, Project and PowerPoint, SAP are preferred (SAP for Supply Chain Management only). Minimum 3.2 GPA is preferred. Local travel may be required. Students must be able to provide their own transportation to/from their work location. Students must be legally authorized to work in the United States and not require future sponsorship for employment visa status (e.g. H1-B status) now or in the future. Primary Location United States-Pennsylvania-Spring House Other Locations North America-United States-California-Fremont, North America-United States-New Jersey-Raritan, North America-United States-New Jersey-Titusville, North America-United States-Pennsylvania-Malvern Organization Janssen Research & Development, LLC. desc: Job Summary:Works independently with business partners within the business function to align technology solutions with business strategies. Identifies opportunities for improvement/enhancement, and negotiate agreements and commitments between business partners and IT from requirements gathering to the final implementation. Understands the difference between a requirement and a desire or want.■ Assists in the business process redesign and documentation as needed for new technology; ensures technology solutions are in compliance with and uphold organizational standards. Translates high level business requirements into functional specifications for the IT organization. Additionally, they should raise and report known or suspected violations to the appropriate Company authority in a timely fashion.■ Performs other related duties as required.

title: Spacecraft Structural Analyst - Mid Level
desc:
SPACECRAFT STRUCTURAL ANALYST – MID LEVEL 

 
PURPOSE OF POSITION: 
 Serves as a spacecraft structural analysis engineer and is responsible for requirements development, design support, detailed system level and piece part structural analysis, and integration and testing support of state-of-the art structures, instruments, and electronic enclosures for spacecraft programs.  

 EXPERIENCE AND CHARACTERISTICS: 
 -  Knowledge of and hands-on experience in the fields of spacecraft primary and secondary structures, instruments, and electronic enclosures. 
 -  Knowledge of all phases of spacecraft structural system development including requirements development, detailed structural analysis, thermal distortion and STOP analysis, and system integration and testing.   
 -  Ability to perform concept development, system design and analysis, definition and specification of spacecraft system and subsystem requirements, and preparation of spacecraft certification documentation. 
 -  Ability to prepare, direct, and conduct development and qualification tests on spacecraft systems and subsystems, and analyze the test data to determine if the system/subsystem performance meets its requirements. 
 -  Ability to write comprehensive test plans, test procedures, and test reports.
 LOCATION: 
 Naval Research Laboratory, Washington, DC 

 NRL is an equal opportunity employer
Salary is commensurate with experience.




QUALIFICATIONS:
-  Bachelors, Masters, or PhD in Mechanical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, or related discipline with focus/experience in mechanical design of spacecraft structures, mechanical components, and electronic enclosures and a minimum GPA of 3.0. 
-  Solid background in statics, dynamics, solid mechanics, material science, Finite Element Structural Analysis. 
-  Experience in the design, analysis, and fabrication of aerospace composite structures is highly desirable. 
-  Minimum of 7 years’ experience in spacecraft Structural Analysis. 
-  Ability to communicate technical information clearly and effectively, orally and in writing. 
-  Ability to work in a team environment. 
-  Must be a US citizen, and must be able to obtain and maintain the required level of security clearance. 
-  Ability to work in a team environment

title: Business Analyst, Project Managers, IT and Computer Science Professionals
desc:
Do you ever feel like you have a bigger responsibility?

For instance, protecting the public health by ensuring the safety, efficacy, and security of human and veterinary drugs, biological products, and medical devices; and by ensuring the safety of our nation's food supply, cosmetics, and products that emit radiation?

Then the FDA is looking for you!   

A P Ventures, LLC is a full-service IT consulting company headquartered in Columbia, MD. We are one of the fastest growing IT companies in the Washington DC–metro area, and are a prime vendor with various Federal, State, and Local agencies. 

On behalf of our client, A P Ventures is looking for a Business Informatics Specialist located in Silver Spring, MD

This is an exciting opportunity to join a highly motivated team of IT Project Managers & Business Analysts who are helping to modernize regulation and center operations to better protect and promote the public health.  

The selected professional will:
Support the implementation, expansion and evaluation of the informatics quality platform by utilizing methods from the fields of computer science, decision science and operations research.
Apply modern tools for decision analysis, and visualization of big data and data management solutions to analyze research and develop the application to the client’s regulatory review processes.


One year of specialized experience equivalent to the next lower grade in the federal service which has demonstrated experience in IT project management, strong technical and interpersonal skills and experience in analyzing, reengineering and documenting complex business processes.
DESIRED EXPERIENCE AND KNOWLEDGE
Master’s or Doctoral degrees in computer science, applied informatics / bioinformatics or operations research at an accredited U.S. college or university
Demonstrated experience in IT project management, strong technical and interpersonal skills
Experience in analyzing, reengineering and documenting complex business processes
If you are interested, please send your resume to [Click Here to Email Your Resumé]

title: Program / Data Analyst
desc:
Position: Program Analyst
 
Job Purpose: The Program Analyst is responsible for creating a standard process and authoritative data source to manage software license requirements and procurements.
Job Duties Include: The following reflects management’s definition of essential functions for this job but does not restrict the tasks that may be assigned:
 Solicit, capture, and document customer software requirements

Maintain a database, including data for software assets in relation to requisition, procurement, deployment, maintenance and retirement
Review software license agreements, contracts and purchase orders and extract key information
Ensure compliance of software license agreements and assist with software maintenance contract renewals
Prepare technical reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information and trends to support data driven decision-making by the client’s leadership
Conduct analyses to assess, review, and validate requirements for the acquisition of commercial software products
Present and advise clients on leading industry trends and technologies based on industry research
Provide solutions and assist in the design, implementation, and operation of process improvement initiatives
Answer product questions, provide use case scenarios, and act as a liaison to vendor for in‑depth product and license engineering questions
Ensure compliance with contract terms and conditions, conduct market research, provide advice in resolving disputes, and make recommendations on contract modifications

Required:

Extensive knowledge and experience using the Microsoft Office suite:
Excel - data filtering, pivot tables, and print merge features
PowerPoint – creating presentations to concisely articulate a message
Word – style, page layout, and table features to create polished technical documents

Knowledge of the Defense Intelligence Agency (DIA) acquisition process
ITIL Certification
Knowledge of enterprise volume licensing and requirements management
Familiarity with RSA Archer eGRC, ServiceNow, or a similar platform

Education and Experience: Undergraduate (4-year) degree, with a major in Science or Management.  Study or experience within a technical field, such as engineering or computer science is a plus. Candidate must have 6+ years related work experience. Experience with government and DoD environments is required.
The above is intended to describe the general content of and requirements for the performance of this job.  It is not to be construed as an exhaustive statement of duties, responsibilities or requirements.  Nothing in this job description restricts management’s right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.

title: Data Management Analyst
company: The Quest Group is seeking a full time Data Analyst for one of Atlanta’s fastest growing specialty e-retailers. The position sits in their trendy Midtown office. The selected candidate will support client data integration across the company’s global enter...
desc:
The Quest Group is seeking a full time  Data Analyst for one of Atlanta’s fastest growing specialty e-retailers. The position sits in their trendy Midtown office. The selected candidate will support client data integration across the company’s global enterprise and should be able to manage the retrieval, transformation, delivery, and exchange of data between both internal and external business systems across all business units and client base. Provide daily operational production support. This role requires a strong understanding of discipline and should be able to apply knowledge and experience to complex problems and develop recommendations. We are looking for leaders that makes decisions within broad parameters.This person also acts as an informal resource for others with less experience. Someone who works with team members to provide operational support, documentation, and knowledge sharing of best practices.
 
JOB DUTIES: 
Develops strong working relationships with Client Services, Underwriting, Accounting and IT.
Owns operational client data integration
Manages file retrieval and delivery for all client data exchanges using file transfer software—including account administration, host configurations, and job scheduling.
Manages data integration using ETL technology
Understands and conforms to corporate IT data and security standards
Provides feedback from ongoing administration experience to continuously improve the client experience
Responds to eligibility, remittance and deduction questions from various business partners throughout the company
Communicates regarding the impacts and implications of client data integration break points
Performs client platform monitoring and root cause analysis of production incidents.
Leverages tools like Excel or IT-related applications so that operational processing and business targets may be achieved
Manages client file reports for distribution to leaders, team members and business partners
Responds to client inquiries as an additional input to daily workflow for timely resolution
Understands data flows across multiple systems—including storefront, underwriting, billing and financial systems


QUALIFICATIONS: 
Bachelor's or Technical degree in an analytical field (e.g. Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics) – 5 plus years of experience required.
Demonstrated problem solving ability with experience in client/customer data management
Hands-on data mining / analytics experience with a service or technology company
Experience in a related operational business process required
Strong Excel and statistical skills required
Experience with at least 1 scripting language is a plus
Experience with Voluntary Benefits Administration is a plus
Experience with Payroll Deduction is a plus
 
COMPENTENCIES: 
Strong analytical skills
Ability to work with a sense of urgency and independence, displaying innovative skills to solve complex problems
Experience with Data Management
Willingness to learn new software applications and workflows related to data management
Demonstrated effective teamwork ability to perform cross-functional operational support
Generates effective solutions based on available information and makes timely decisions
Ability to effectively communicate and collaborate with IT teams and business users
Understanding of file transfer and ETL technologies
Demonstrates a strong commitment to delivering results while maintaining a secure environment
Strong writing skills to proactively maintain/create documentation

title: Big Data Developer
desc:
Big Data Developer / Software EngineerPittsburgh, PA
As the Big Data Developer, you will be responsible for coding and continuous testing of complex modules and applications In this role you will also be tasked with understanding and interpreting requirements to contribute to the technical architecture and the associated design documents.


Your Big Data Developer background should include:
Bachelor's computer information technology, computer science, management required; Master's Degree preferred
8+ years of developing software using object-oriented or functional language experience
5+ years of SQL
3+ years working with open source Big Data technology stacks (Apache Nifi, Spark, Kafka, HBase, Hadoop/HDFS, Hive, Drill, Pig, etc.) or commercial open source Big Data technology stacks (Hortonworks, Clouder, etc.)

Big Data Developer / Software Engineer

title: Data Architect
desc:
Analysts to hire Data Architect in Bloomington, MN.

Interested candidates should send resume to [Click Here to Email Your Resumé] and then call David for next step at 507-250-4420

Overview: This Data Architect position is for a Personalization and Campaign Management project. This role will drive the data architecture for this project to integrate multiple sources and targets supporting a variety of operational as well as analytical and reporting deliverables. The role will take direction from the project management team but will also work in partnership with the Enterprise Information Management team to ensure the project architecture is in line with broader Health Care client  enterprise data architecture.








Required Qualifications:

Ability to analyze and specify complex database design and architecture.
Ability to understand and navigate system architecture and its relationship to database needs
Understanding of Extract transformation load (ETL), Enterprise Application Integration (EAI), Enterprise Information Integration (EII), and Enterprise Service Bus (ESB).
Integration and application design patterns and the ability to define enterprise-wide components.
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience level.
10+ years of experience in database design and development (OLTP, DSS (Kimball methodology), ODS, Cubes).
Excellent technical project planning skills with demonstrated experience in technical designs and documentation.
Experience in application software development methodologies, techniques, processes and tools.
Exceptional leadership, mentoring, listening and communication skills.

Strong ability to influence without having direct authority.
Ability to translate business strategy into technical terms and technology strategy into business terms.

Preferred Qualifications:

Knowledge and of Health Plan data, specifically claims and membership
Knowledge of Care Delivery data including diagnosis codes
Knowledge of Campaign management systems
Knowledge of and experience with Oracle, Cache, and Microsoft SQL Server database technologies.
Knowledge of and experience with Embarcadero Data Modeler tool (or equivalent).
Knowledge of IBM InfoSphere (DataStage ETL) suite a plus.
Knowledge of and experience with implementation / support of complex systems.
Knowledge of emerging technologies and implications for their usage.

title: Data Analyst
desc:
The Idaho Primary Care Association (IPCA) is a private, non-profit organization whose mission is to promote and support vibrant, effective Community Health Centers in providing accessible, affordable and high quality healthcare to all Idahoans. 
IPCA is seeking qualified applicants for a Data Analyst. The Data Analyst will support participating community health center efforts for cost reduction and quality improvement work.
To succeed in this role, you should be analytical and resourceful, at data detective. You should also be an excellent communicator, a story engineer, able to tell the narrative behind raw data to non-technical audiences. If you also have experience in the healthcare industry, we would like to meet you. 

Idaho Primary Care Association, the membership organization for Idaho’s community health centers, offers a pleasant work environment on Boise’s greenbelt, a generous benefits package and the opportunity to make a positive impact on the lives of Idahoans






Responsibilities
Develop infrastructure and reporting capabilities to support quality improvement and cost controls using health care data
Assist with identification, derivation, and visualization of key performance indicators.
Ensure data integrity.
Assist in contract analysis and network performance acting as a liaison between payers and health center, distributing data to health center on performance indicators.
Create reports rich in information that are actionable and explain the data to non-technical business staff and external partners
Produce effective professional presentations of reports and analyses
Develop resources and identify opportunities for and provide appropriate trainings and technical assistance (T/TA)
Evaluate the quality and effectiveness of T/TA
Perform other related duties as requested.Required Experience
Two years health data analysis
Competence in Microsoft Office (Excel, Access) required
SQL – Intermediate
Data modeling, data analysis and business intelligence reporting and the ability to tell a story with data
Predictive analytics - data mine and analyze current and historical facts to make future predictions
Methods to extract data from systems and data mining valuable information from large data sets
Detail-oriented with the ability to multi-task and manage multiple projects simultaneously while identifying areas for process improvement
Excellent written/verbal communication, problem solving skills and negotiation skills
Understanding of health care delivery systems and safety-net providers
Bachelor’s Degree in Math, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Business or related field Preferred Qualifications
Competence in Tableau, SAS, Maptitude, and other analytic and data visualization software
Insurance and healthcare cost trends
Healthcare payment methodologies such as DRGs, APCs, and capitation
Statistical analysis
Experience working in a Community Health Center
One year of experience in public health, health education or related fieldTo Apply:
If interested and qualified for this position, please submit a resume, cover letter and application. Please visit www.idahopca.org for application download.

title: Project Director I - Upward Bound Math/Science (Location: Perry County)
desc:
Project Director I – Upward Bound Math & Science
 Location –  (Perry County) 
 (Position is contingent on receipt of grant funding) 
 
 About Berea College  
 Berea College achieved national distinction as the first coeducational and interracial college in the South. With an emphasis on service to the people of Appalachia and beyond, Berea enrolls 1,600 students from 40 states and 60 countries. The College has a longstanding commitment to interracial education; here, people of different races seek to learn from and about each other, while also living together. Berea is among the most racially diverse private liberal arts colleges in the United States. The college admits only students whose families are unable to afford the high cost of tuition and awards each of them a four-year tuition scholarship. Berea’s students excel in the College’s supportive but demanding academic environment, and many are the first in their families to graduate from college.  
 
 Berea College is always looking for talented, self-motivated individuals to join our team. If you think you are ready to be a part of an exciting team, then we encourage you to continue with this applicant friendly, online job application!  
 
 Berea College is an Equal Opportunity Employer that recruits and hires qualified candidates without regard to race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, disability, or veteran status.  
 
JOB DESCRIPTION  

 Partners for Education at Berea College provides deep community support for youth and their families and works to ensure success for young people from cradle to career. The Project Director is a key, full-time position that reports to a Director of Programs and will oversee all program operations. The Project Director will work closely with all stakeholders integral to the program to maintain communication and engagement of activities and services. This position is responsible for ongoing evaluation and may also work with the Independent Evaluator and data contractor to design and fully implement activities and services aimed at ensuring student academic success. The Project Director is responsible for ensuring that Enterprise Risk Management is implemented with fidelity in the program and compliant with all Berea College, Partners for Education and funder requirements. The Project Director will provide training and support to program team members to ensure a culture of enterprise risk management and results based accountability. The Project Director leads and operates with the Partners for Education goal in mind that all Appalachian Kentucky youth succeed in school.     

 
RESPONSIBILITIES  

 ●  Supervise program team to ensure implementation solutions and objectives as proposed in the application are being effectively and efficiently delivered in compliance with grantor guidelines. 
 ●  Work closely with program stakeholders and partners to ensure academic and community support services are delivered and in alignment with program guidelines. 
 ●  Work to ensure data is collected in a timely and efficient manner, including the submission of all funder required reporting.  
 ●  Work with independent evaluator as necessary to ensure information flows between staff and evaluators. 
 ●  Collaborate with the Director of Programs to implement protocols and processes for ERM in the program. Monitor the program to ensure that all program activities are compliant with all Berea College, Partners for Education, and funder requirements. 
 ●  Manage the program budget and ensure that all expenditures are allowable, allocable and reasonable. 
 ●  Work with the Finance Department to develop budget projections, discuss planned costs, review financial options and address budgetary implications, including annual operational budget allocations.  
 ●  Collaborate with the Finance Department to monitor federal match from partners and ensure match meets federal or other guidelines for compliance when applicable.  
 ●  Inform respective Director of Programs on feedback received from quantitative and qualitative data gathered on program activities and from community partners and plan for continuous improvement. 
 ●  Work cross functionally with other departments to align and enhance program services and activities. 




 
BENEFITS (Including but not limited to) 

 Health Insurance  
 Dental Insurance  
 Tuition Reimbursement  
 On-Site Child Care (CDL)  
 Employee Life Insurance  
 Retiree Health Insurance  
 
 To apply, and for more on the job description, please go to: https://myberea.csod.com/ats/careersite/search.aspx?site=1&c=myberea 


    
 






Education required to ensure success in this position:
 ●  Master’s Degree in educational administration, education social work or related field 
 
Experience required to ensure success in this position:  
 ●  Minimum of three years of experience in personnel/program/fiscal management, including budget responsibility. 
●  Demonstrated knowledge and leadership in the areas of student services. 
 ●  Demonstrated experience with event and activity program coordination.  

 Special skills, knowledge and abilities:  
●  Ability to communicate effectively with a variety of stakeholders.


●  Proven ability to coordinate a multi-faceted program.   


●  Strong verbal presentation skills.


●  Demonstrated ability to develop and grow a high-impact team  


●  Proficient computer skills; experience with data processing and financial spreadsheets.

title: Sr. Data Analyst
desc:
Sr. Data Analyst
Applied Resource Group is seeking a contract-to-hire Senior Data Analyst for one of our Professional Consulting clients in the Greater Atlanta Area. This position requires 5+ years of prior experience as a data analyst or architect. The candidate must exhibit polished oral and written communication skills when engaging colleagues, clients and potential clients. Strong analytical skills are a must, as interpreting, mining and summarizing data to infer meaningful conclusions is a huge part of the job function. The candidate must be self-motivated and able to function effectively with minimal direct supervision. There may be up to 75% travel required and daily work activities are managed within a virtual environment supported by the ability to telecommute.


Responsibilities
Expertise with Tableau for dashboard development and have advanced skills to query and manipulate data using both SQL and Excel.
Candidates must demonstrate proficiency in making useful inferences and driving improvement actions from large data sets that are messy and not easily understood.
Intermediate proficiency of six sigma tools and analysis methodologies (along with all the accompanying statistical tools) is a must.

Daily Duties Include:
Data Analysis
Data Mining
Custom Report Development
Conduct Time/Motion Analysis
Technical document development
Standardized work instruction development
C-Level Presentation contribution
Software testing and user requirement development
Up to 75% travel
Ability to telecommute on a daily basis
Participation in business development activities as necessary

Skills:
Strong Analytical Ability, Tableau, Advanced SQL (Oracle, SQL Server, MySQL), Advanced MS Excel, MS Access, Oracle, Statistical analysis tools (MiniTab, SAS, SPSS, etc.…), Six Sigma Certification (preferred), Strong oral and written presentation skills, Experience telecommuting

Education:
Master’s Degree (preferred)
Bachelor’s Degree (required) in Industrial and Systems Engineering, Operations Research, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or Statistics
