title: Senior Treasury Quantitative Analyst
desc:
Senior Treasury Quantitative Analyst
Buffalo, NY 

BASIC FUNCTION:
Provides support for the Treasury Middle Office function through the analysis and reporting of pricing and risk metrics to senior management to support strategic and tactical management decisions of the Bank’s balance sheet, particularly as it relates to investments, derivatives, mortgages, and liabilities.  
 
POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES:
Calculate monthly prices for the investment, mortgage, derivative and liability portfolios. Perform monthly attribution analysis to identify drivers of price change.
Complete the monthly calculation and reporting process for portfolio risk metrics, including duration, convexity, and prepayment speeds.
Develop process enhancements to streamline the monthly calculation process and improve the report generation process. 
Work with Treasury team members to identify additional reports that would be helpful to the division’s decision making process.
Understand the process by which the Yield Book software calculates its results. Develop comfort with changing model assumptions to produce results that are consistent with the needs of end users in Treasury and other divisions of the bank.  
Calculate quarterly other than temporary impairment (OTTI) for structured financial instruments under a variety of economic scenarios and present the results to senior management. In addition, these calculations are performed during the biannual stress testing process.
Document and maintain proper procedures to serve as reference of the monthly processes completed to ensure proper controls exist surrounding the quality and integrity of the middle office reports produced for senior management.   
Use spreadsheet software, Structured Query Language (SQL) and Business Intelligence software to develop custom reports.
Understand and adhere to the Company’s risk and regulatory standards, policies and controls in accordance with the Company’s Risk Appetite.  Identify risk-related issues needing escalation to management. 
Develop business intelligence solutions to aid in the visualization of portfolio performance. 
Promote an environment that supports diversity and reflects the M&T Bank brand.
Maintain M&T internal control standards, including timely implementation of internal and external audit points together with any issues raised by external regulators as applicable.
Complete other related duties as assigned.

NATURE AND SCOPE:
The Treasury Middle Office’s primary responsibility is to calculate prices and manage risk for the bank’s investment, mortgage, derivative, and liability portfolios. The analysis created is used by the Bank’s management to add support for strategic business decisions. It is important for the position to communicate with clear narratives, compelling data visualization and technical precision, both in-person and in writing, to enable recipients to understand the analyses.  
This role is highly technical in nature and requires demonstrated attention to detail, execution and follow-up on multiple initiatives with the Treasury Division and across the Bank.  The ability to identify, analyze, rationalize and communicate complex problems and recommend corresponding solutions is a key factor of success in this role.

MANAGERIAL/SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITY:
May supervise the work of interns.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED:
Bachelor’s degree in statistics, economics, finance or related field in the quantitative social, physical or engineering sciences, with proven coursework proficiency in statistics, econometrics, economics, computer science, finance or risk management and a minimum of 3 years’ proven quantitative experience, or in lieu of a degree, a combined minimum of 7 years’ higher education and work experience, with proven coursework proficiency in statistics, econometrics, computer science, finance or risk management and  including a minimum of 3 years’ proven quantitative experience.
Experience with pertinent statistical software packages, such as SAS, Strata, R, or Python, including 2 years’ of on-the-job use.
Experience with data management environment, such as SQL Server Management Studio, including 2 years’ of on-the-job use.  
Proven ability to manage and analyze large data sets and explain results of analysis through concise written and verbal communication as well as charts/graphs.

IDEAL QUALIFICATIONS PREFERRED:
Masters’ of Science or Doctorate degree in statistics, economics, finance, or related field in the quantitative social, physical, or engineering sciences. 
Financial Risk Manager (FRM) or Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA) designation. 
Experience in balance sheet management and mathematical modeling of financial instruments offered by banks.  
Experience using QRM Risk Framework and pertinent prepayment models.  
Proven track record for being able to work autonomously, work within a team environment, exhibiting demonstrated leadership and a strong desire to learn and contribute to a group.

About M&T At M&T, we strive to be the best place our employees ever work, the best bank our customers ever do business with and the best investment our shareholders ever make. So when looking to advance your career, look to M&T. As a top 20 US bank holding company and one of the best performing regional banks in the country, we offer a wide range of performance based career development opportunities for talented professionals. And through our longstanding tradition of careful, conservative and consistent management and a strong commitment to the communities we serve, we continue to grow with a focus on the future.

title: Statistical Programmer
desc:
A global medical device company in Irvine, CA is seeking a Statistical Programmer for a W-2 Contract position. Statistical Programmer Duties:  - Act as the lead programmer overseeing technical planning for programming projects involving multiple studies and electronic submissions to regulatory agencies - Lead implementation of CDISC Standards for new studies - Work independently on projects where analysis of data requires critical thinking and creative problem solving - Assist in the validation of derived datasets, programming specifications and tables, listings and graphs. - Conduct ad-hoc analyses - Develop SAS code according to specifications to create accurate, complete and efficient statistical analysis datasets (ADS) using raw data from multiple sources - Develop programs to generate output tables, listings and graphs (TLG) according to the statistical analysis plan (SAP) in a timely fashion. - Review data to verify integrity and consistency for completeness, accuracy, and suitability - Maintain documentation for analysis dataset specifications and validation. - Review statistical analysis plans (SAP), CRFs, clinical study reports (CSR) and other documents essential to the conduct of statistical programming work for clinical trials. - Work collaboratively with Biostatisticians, other Statistical Programmers, Clinical Affairs and Safety to meet project deliverables and timelines for statistical data analysis and reporting - Contribute to development of procedures and department processes Statistical Programmer Requirements:  - A bachelor's degree, preferably in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science or related field required. - A Master's degree in Statistics is preferred and may be considered to offset some of the minimum experience requirement. - A minimum of six (6) years of solid SAS statistical programming experience with clinical data required, including macros and statistical procedures. - Experience with CDISC (SDTM, ADaM, define.xml) is preferred. - Programming experience in the pharmaceutical/medical device industry setting      We are an equal opportunity employer.


 A bachelor's degree, preferably in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science or related field required.  A Master's degree in Statistics is preferred and may be considered to offset some of the minimum experience requirement.  A minimum of six (6) years of solid SAS statistical programming experience with clinical data required, including macros and statistical procedures.  Experience with CDISC (SDTM, ADaM, define.xml) is preferred. Programming experience in the pharmaceutical/medical device industry setting

title: Expert Analyst
company: Accident Fund Insurance Company of America
desc:
Tessellate - Risk Adjustment Strategy

SUMMARY:

The Reporting Expert Analyst is responsible for identifying, collecting, analyzing, and maintaining data to evaluate issues that support prospective business decisions. This role is also responsible for identifying, collecting, analyzing, and maintaining data to evaluate, report, and coordinate for consumption for senior leadership and clients/external parties.
RESPONSIBILITIES/TASKS: 
Acting as an independent professional to design, develop, maintain, and publish reporting/presentations
Make solid recommendations based on the analysis and provide explanations for reporting results for both internal operations and clients
Coordinate data consumption from all the appropriate stakeholders
Develops systematic reporting processes and procedures to ensure timely delivery of daily, weekly, monthly, annual, and ad hoc reporting to leadership
Supporting Risk Adjustment with the adoption of new trends and tools in reporting. Researches, analyzes, identifies, and evaluates data from assigned problems to evaluate existing and potential trends and issues.
Possesses and maintains a comprehensive understanding and knowledge of Risk Adjustment business, products, programs (including provider data, networks, etc.), corporate organizational structure (including functional responsibilities), and basic research principles/methodologies.
Assists in the management and monitoring of multiple projects simultaneously by establishing project plans and objectives to ensure goal attainment within defined parameters.
Communicates results of analysis to management via reports/presentations and assists management in implementing programs that provide solutions.
Recommends and implements solutions to identified problems/root cause of issues.
Provides expertise and guidance to unit and corporate staff as required.
Represents and participates in group or committee discussions.
This position description identifies the responsibilities and tasks typically associated with the performance of the position. Other relevant essential functions may be required.
EMPLOYMENT QUALIFICATIONS:
EDUCATION:
Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Economics, Health Care, Information Systems, Statistics or a related field. Master's degree preferred. Relevant combination of education and experience may be considered in lieu of degree. Continuous learning, as defined by the Company's learning philosophy, is required. Certification or progress toward certification is highly preferred and encouraged.
EXPERIENCE: 
Five (5) years of experience in a related field required to provide the necessary knowledge, skills, and abilities for the role. Two (2) or more years of experience in leading Risk Adjustment Programs
SKILLS/KNOWLEDGE/ABILITIES (SKA) REQUIRED: 
Drive to achieve independence, ability to prioritize work, and a detail oriented approach
Demonstrate ability to recognize problems, recommend solutions, prioritize, and collaboratively implement changes in a deadline-driven environment
Proven working experience as a data analyst or business analyst
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc)
Strong communication skills are required to understand, interpret, and communicate ideas and findings.
Strong knowledge and use of existing software packages (PowerPoint, Excel, Word, etc).
Knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects etc), databases (SQL etc), programming (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks)
Strong problem-solving abilities with project management skills
Ability to effectively interface with employees at all levels.
Understand and apply statistical inference.
Other related skills and/or abilities may be required to perform this job.

Work is performed in an office setting with no unusual hazards.

title: Sr. Demand Analyst
desc:
Sr. Demand Analyst 
At NextGen, we don’t just hire people, we hire up, that is, the best and the brightest, matching talent with great companies across the United States.  Ours is a process of Discovery, learning everything we can about our candidates and our clients, in order to achieve the best possible match.  We know that behind every placement, there are real people looking for an opportunity and the right fit to achieve their career goals and professional dreams.  We work from a platform we call NextDimensions, a program that is built on knowledge and trust to create positive and productive partnerships. 
At NextGen we are actively looking for high caliber talent to fulfill the following opportunity.  

Job Title:  14238 Sr Demand Analyst
Job Location:  Wilmington, DE 19805 Position will start in Wilmington, DE, then relocate to Philadelphia, PA (University City) after 11/1/17.
Job Duration:  ASAP - 06/30/2018
Hours:  8am to 5pm Mon-Fri
 

Job Description:


Local candidates only

 Job Description 
Conducts regular Demand Planning data quality audits and maintenance activities, including demand history validation and outlier correction, to ensure optimal data performance 
Responsible for running Differentiated Forecast Strategy analysis, detailing results of the analysis, and implementing within the planning system and process 
Conducts monthly statistical forecast runs as input to a Multi-view consensus demand plan 
Provides analysis and insights on statistical forecast performance 
Develops metric dashboards and reports, as appropriate, to communicate forecast performance 
Maintains knowledge of advanced forecasting techniques and methods 
Responsible for developing Differentiated Forecast Strategy segmentation model, determining optimum statistics models and parameters (using SCM7.0 FLO model or other tool) and implementing within the planning system and process. 
Manages Forecast Level Optimizer capability (FLO model in SCM7.0), where available, to establish proper statistical models and parameters within SCM7.0 statistics module. 
Interactively tunes statistical models to drive continuous forecast performance improvement. 
Builds custom macros and modifies system settings in the planning tool (SCM7.0) as necessary to improve effectiveness and system performance. 
Develops profiles to model product life cycle (new/emerging products, old/ discontinued products) to improve forecast performance.
Provides guidance to other Demand Analysts and Demand Planners to ensure continuous statistical forecasting performance improvement. 
Provides advanced analysis of and insights on demand trends and leading indicator modeling. 
Maintains current knowledge of advanced forecasting techniques and methods. 
Participates in demand management networks 






Sr. Demand Analyst 
Required Skills:
Local candidates only
 

Qualifications:
Position will start in Wilmington, DE, then relocate to Philadelphia, PA (University City) after 11/1/17. 
Undergraduate Degree in Business, Supply Chain, Applied Mathematics, Computational Science or Statistics degree 
5 years of equivalent experience 
Six Sigma (Green Belt certification) 
Ideal candidate will have SAP (APO/SCM7.0) experience, but willing to train the right candidate 
Passing score on APICS Module I (Basics of Supply Chain Management) within 2 years (self-test) 
Statistics for business analysis
Advanced capability in statistical modeling and expert user of SCM Planning System including Forecast Level Optimizer (FLO) Module. 
Capable of building Differentiated Forecast Strategy 4-Quad segmentation model based on business criteria and FLO output.
Deep understanding of trend analysis, forecast algorithms, leading indicator modeling and system based scenario planning. 
Capable of interactively tuning stat models (adjusting parameters), building custom macros and modifying system settings. 
Supports Portfolio Managers and Planners to apply Profiling and Product Lifecycle Planning. 
Strong analytical, technical, and computer skills 
Strong oral and written communications skills 
Demonstrated about to be self-motivated, strong discipline and organization skills 
Strong desire to develop and technically support our Demand Planning processes 
Strong track record of delivering results that meet or exceed expectations 
Excellent planning, prioritization and leadership skills. 
Demonstrated ability working on teams and developing strong team 

 
NextGen Information Services provides our consultants with flexible employment options to include, Hourly, Salary, Subcontracting or 1099 engagements.  Our Hourly and Salary employment opportunities include a variety of optional healthcare benefits!

Healthcare, Dental, and Vision Insurance

Lengthy interview prep plan and outplacement services 
 
Our goal at NextGen is to bring our clients the talent they need and demand for business success, and to bring our consultants the opportunity and support for a successful professional life. Most importantly, we work hard not in just making connections, but in making connections that last.  At NextGen, we believe we are catalysts to change, changing business, changing lives and we pride ourselves on this principle. 
The business world is constantly evolving and at NextGen we know that you are too.  Are you or someone you know looking to explore new career opportunities?  Explore NextGen……
 
View additional current openings here 
 
Have a friend or colleague looking to make a career change, refer them and earn a referral bonus.  Referrals will be paid after the consultant has been on project 120 days.

title: Senior Mathematical Analyst
desc:
Senior Mathematical Analyst
Lakewood, NJ

The
Math team at Gaming Laboratories International performs complex statistical
methods to test software designs that impact the products and services in the
Gaming & Lottery industries.  Working
closely with the Engineering team, the Senior Mathematical Analyst I is
responsible for performing complex statistical analysis of challenging
problems  to reinforce, evaluate, and
improve product quality.  The Senior Mathematical Analyst I applies
advanced knowledge of probability, statistics and computer programming to
conducts standard game analysis, strategy game analysis, and random number
generator analysis. This position is responsible for conducting technical
reviews of other’s work. The Mathematical Analyst is expected to be proficient
in all appropriate tools and methods relevant to the work, including computer
programming, spreadsheet analysis, and statistics. The Math Analyst devotes a
large majority of time directly towards testing and review.
 
Duties & Responsibilities include, but not limited to:

Writes
programs and performs other analyses to calculate needed mathematical features
of games


Performs
and reviews mathematical analysis and testing of high complexity projects


Reads
and modifies programs and analyses developed by others to meet testing needs 


Reviews,
understands and documents RNG source code written in various languages 


Writes
programs or scripts to manipulate, parse or reorganize large data files into
standard formats for testing 


Conducts
and interprets statistical testing on game simulation results and on RNG data 


Carefully
reviews analysis work conducted by others for accuracy 


Reads
and interprets jurisdictional requirements, consulting appropriately for
interpretation 


Effectively
communicates and collaborates with other members of the Math Department and
other GLI employees 


Performs
other duties as assigned 

 

We offer excellent paid benefits
that include: 

100%
Paid Health & Dental Insurance for Single


100%
Paid Life Insurance


20
Days Paid Time Off (Per Year)


Paid
Holidays


Yearly
Discretionary Bonus and Salary Increase


401k
Savings Plan (with 50% Matching Contribution)


Discretionary
Profit Sharing Plan

 
 
About GLI: Gaming
Laboratories International is a world leader in testing gaming devices and
online systems standards in the gaming, wagering and lottery industries. We have
established an incomparable team of highly trained, hand-picked experts to
deliver world-class services to the global gaming industry.
 
GLI
is a gaming company.  Any of our
employees may be required to obtain a gaming license within one or all of the
gaming jurisdictions. If you are requested by GLI to obtain a gaming license,
your continued employment may be contingent on your ability to obtain that
gaming license.
This
job description should not be interpreted as all-inclusive; it is intended to
identify major responsibilities and requirements of the job.  The incumbent may be requested to perform
other job-related task and responsibilities than those stated above.
 
GLI is an Equal Opportunity Employer



 
Experience, Education, Skills and Credentials:

Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a closely related discipline


Master’s degree in a related field preferred


Minimum 5 years related work experience


Valid driver’s license 


To commensurate with title, the Senior Mathematical Analyst should have: 

Advanced knowledge of Probability, Statistics, and Combinatorics 


Moderate to Advanced knowledge of modern C++ or related object-oriented design 


Understanding of core programming concepts and techniques 



Knowledge of Microsoft Excel required


Must have the ability to communicate, both orally and written, with other members of the team and external contacts 


Ability to handle and organize multiple projects and deadlines 


High degree of attention to quality, details, and correctness 

 
 
Physical Requirements and Working Conditions: 

Must have the ability to work at a computer for extensive periods of time


Must have the ability to speak on the telephone with clients/prospective clients for extended periods of time


Must have the ability to read (paper or computer screen) for extended periods of time

Participates in Portfolio Strategy and AssetQuality Meetings to provide insight on statistics and address Committee's requests for additional information.• Communicates issues to the business line and Risk and makes recommendations as appropriate.• Develops productive working relationships with others in Risk Management, Finance, Business Line, , and externalgroups.• Provides accurate reports and identifies issues that could impact decisions.• Supports policy / practice in the areas of measuring/quantifying risk exposureQualifications:MUST HAVE:• 7-10 years with Risk management in large enterprise environment (preference will be given to candidates with Banking and financial or similar env.)• 7-10 years Stress Testing Experience• Advanced Modeler/Coder experience• 7- 10 years with SAS User experience• 7-10 years with Data Analysis and Data manipulation• 3 years with Knowledge with CCAR model development• 3 years with Retail Lending• Solid writing and documentation skills.• Excellent PC skills including advanced EXCEL• Bachelor's degree required; in mathematics, statistics, economics or econometrics preferred• Strong analytical, technical and writing skills• Ability to develop and execute complex analyses in support of business goals and objectives• Demonstrated management/leadership skills• Excellent written and verbal communication, problem solving and decision making skills with ability to effectively communicate with seniormanagement• Ability to assimilate complex business information in order to structure relationships in processes and dataNICE TO HAVE• Banking and Financial (candidates will be given preference over others)• SAS Certification

title: Data Visualization Consultant - Humana Government Business
desc:
Role: Data Visualization Consultant – Humana Government BusinessAssignment:  Business AnalyticsLocation: Louisville, KY Assignment Capsule We are seeking a creative and experienced Data Visualization expert to build our team’s visual and interactive portfolio from the ground up.  The primary goal of this role is to deliver each stage of visualization project; from pitch to design to user interaction. This role will work with data from within our team and around Humana Military. Key Accountabilities: Leading business users through the process of understanding what they want relative to the capabilities of Tableau. Design and create data visualizations (reports and dashboards) as required to support clinical, financial, and operational needs.  Champion dashboard quality, consistency, usability and reliability by documenting and applying best practices to their design and development Establish standards and best practices for requesting, prioritizing and developing dashboards Collaborate with technical staff and end-users to understand and troubleshoot platform issues and develop appropriate solutions  Defining important meaning that is needed by each audience member in each context Finding the right data (subject area, historical reach, breadth, level of detail, etc.)


Role Essentials:  Bachelor’s Degree in IT, Computer Science, Applied Math/Statistics, or related field  Design or development experience with either Tableau or QlikView/Qlik Sense, including dashboards, reports, and/or front end visualizations Experience querying and / or designing relational databases (ETL, SQL, data modeling, data governance) Multiple experiences with full life cycle development in a BI or Analytics environment  Proven ability to improve processes, be proactive, and take innovative Ability to present statistical reports and data visualizations for diverse audiences  Passionate about data, data visualization, and data science  Strong analytical, quantitative, problem solving, and organizational skills; attention to detail; and ability to coordinate multiple tasks, set priorities, and meet deadlines Ability to work closely with key team members and subject experts (e.g. Business, Data Engineers, Data Scientists, Consultants, etc.)
Role Desirables:  Master’s Degree in IT, Computer Science, Applied Math/Statistics, or related field Expertise in analyzing and interpreting data using statistical tools, algorithms, models and software (e.g. R, rStudio, Shiny, MATLAB, Python, etc.)  Expertise in the area of probability and statistics (e.g. hypothesis testing and summary statistics)  Ability to extract data from unstructured sources or instigate new procedures (e.g. customer surveys, experiments, polls, etc.) 
Reporting Relationships You will report to a Manager, Humana Government Business Development Leadership. This area is under the leadership of the VP of Business Development.Additional Information At Humana, we’re also committed to making the resources available to you that will enable you to become happier, healthier, and more productive in all areas of your life.  We know your well-being is important to you, and it’s important to us too.  If you share our passion for helping people, we likely have the right place for you at Humana.

title: Sr. Research Analyst
desc:
Summary: 
The Sr. Research Analyst is an applied scientist with a problem-solving mindset, responsible for analyzing healthcare data, identifying patterns, and developing data-driven quantitative analysis and computational tools that will be used by clinical and operational
staff. The position 
is responsible for planning and executing informatics projects, supervising junior staff, and the reporting and interpretation of quantitative results.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities 
• Generate statistical analysis using structured and unstructured data to solve clinical and operational challenges
• Possess senior level functional knowledge of statistical modeling 
• Work with business stakeholders to identify needs and recommend analytic solutions
• Leads research and data requirements development and document management
• Execute research projects using statistical analysis 
• Write reports describing and interpreting quantitative findings
• Extract and build analytic data tables using database and statistical programming tools
• Design, execute, and maintain predictive algorithms
Qualifications:
1. EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE
• Masters or PhD in health services research, statistics, math, or related field with 3-5 years of experience
• Ability to use programming tools such as R, Python, Stata, SAS
• Demonstrable ability to write coherent statistical/analytic reports
• Experience extracting and managing data via relational databases
• Prefer experience working with healthcare administrative datasets, and/or electronic medical record (EMR) systems and data to build and evaluate computational models.
2. KNOWLEDGE
• Computational methods including inferential statistics and machine learning
• Data management and analysis 
• Interpretation and communication of quantitative findings 
• Problem solving orientation
3. SKILLS
• Able to perform analysis and provide support to other team members 
• Able to utilize structured and unstructured data in analytic projects 
• Able to execute advanced data management and programming using statistical software
• Synthesize complex or diverse information 
• Identify and resolve problems in a timely manner
• Strive to continuously build knowledge and skills
• Microsoft Office skills are required 
4. ABILITIES 
• Some travel may be required
• Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations were only limited standardization exists

• Ability to interpret a variety of instruction furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form,

• Ability to interact with and maintain a respectful, positive, and friendly relationship with supervisors, co-workers, and internal and external customers

• Ability to maintain a professional attitude and demeanor at all times
• Ability to effectively present information to groups of managers, clients, customers, and the general public
.•CB•IND1234


1. EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE
• Masters in statistics, math, computer science or related field with 3-5 years of experience

• Ability to use programming tools such as R, Python, Matlab, Julia, etc
• Demonstrable ability to write coherent statistical/analytic reports
• Experience extracting and managing data via relational databases 
• Prefer experience working with biological data, healthcare administrative datasets, and/or electronic medical record (EMR) systems and data to build and evaluate computational models.

2. KNOWLEDGE
• Computational methods including inferential statistics and machine learning
• Programming
• Interpretation and communication of computational information
• Problem solving orientation

title: Senior Data Insights Analyst - HealthSparq
desc:
Senior Data Insights Analyst – HealthSparq
Portland, Oregon or Seattle, Washington

Our Senior Data Insight Analysts are responsible for developing and providing analytics across HealthSparq properties. These roles provide regular reporting and analytics on the performance and value of HealthSparq apps, web and mobile platforms and perform ad hoc analyses that inform site optimization and user experience design. These roles are also responsible for working with our product management and client service teams to perform analyses of impact of HealthSparq platforms which entails analysis method design, consulting, execution of the statistical analysis, mathematical modelling and reporting.


Whole-brain thinking: Possessing the ability to think creatively and demonstrate analytical skills, analyzing complex situations both alone and as part of a team, learning quickly and synthesizing solutions, options and action plans.
Experience with tools for data mining, statistics, analysis, and scripting (e.g., Python, R, SAS, Scala, MATLAB, Ruby).
Demonstrated experience creating complex SQL queries for standard as well as ad hoc data mining purposes, analyze large amounts of data, interpret qualitative data (research, feedback) and incorporate into analyses.
Experience with data reporting tools- Tableau, Micro-strategy, SPSS, SQL Server Reporting Service)
Demonstrated understanding of research and ability to develop methodologies in data mining and other innovative statistical/mathematical approaches.
Ability to collaborate with team members and business partners to define, develop, and deliver web and digital analytics that meet the needs of the business to manage routine operations, identify tactical decisions, and inform strategic direction.
Ability to present complex data, analysis or findings to teams in a way that is clear and understandable and supports the overall business decisions and program efforts.
Demonstrated experience analyzing consumer web, app and mobile behavior.
Experience with web analytics software- Web-trends, Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics
Ability to work independently, managing deliverable timelines and clients.
Ability to develop and produce accurate, error free final deliverables and to participate in and support a peer review culture.
Additional Minimum Requirements for Analyst II:
Experience with statistical modelling of results to drive enhanced decision-making.
Advanced skills in data extraction and manipulation.
Additional Minimum Requirements for Senior Analyst:
Experience leading work teams both internal to the department and comprised of multi-disciplinary staff.
Expert in data extraction design and manipulation, coaching junior level analysts in best practices.
Normally to be proficient in the competencies listed above:

Digital Insights Analyst I would have a B/A degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Technology, or Economics or related field and 2+ years of related work experience in equivalent combination of education and experience.

Digital Insights Analyst II would have a B/A degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Technology, or Economics or related field and 4+ years of related work experience or equivalent combination of education and experience. Master's preferred.

Digital Insights Analyst Senior would have a Master's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Technology, or Economics or related field and 7+ years of related work experience or equivalent combination of education and experience.
HealthSparq employees are part of the larger Cambia family of companies, which seeks to drive innovative health solutions. We offer a competitive salary and a generous benefits package. We are an equal opportunity employer dedicated to workforce diversity and a drug and tobacco-free workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status or any other status protected by law. A drug screen and background check is required.

HealthSparq is all about helping people make smarter health care choices. How do we do it? By offering the most relevant, personalized and timely data possible and offering it to consumers when they need it. With over 70 health plan clients that reach over 72 million people, HealthSparq is uniquely positioned to help people make better sense of their health care.

Cambia Health Solutions is a nonprofit total health solutions company with community roots dating back to 1917. We advocate for transforming the health care system by making health care more affordable and accessible, increasing consumers' engagement in their health care decisions, and offering a diverse range of products and services that promote the health and wellbeing of our members. Cambia's portfolio of companies spans health care information technology and software development; retail health care; health insurance plans that carry the Blue Cross and Blue Shield brands; pharmacy benefit management; life, disability, dental, vision and other lines of protection; alternative solutions to health care access and free-standing health and wellness solutions.PI99500011

title: BI/BPM Sr. Manager
desc:
The BPM/Business Intelligence Senior Manager is an integral part of the MAXIMUS BI and analytics team that contributes to the successful delivery of business intelligence, process analytics and reporting across the entire organization. Our work spans the spectrum from designing, documenting, and executing business processes to product deployments to performing root cause and other operational analyses. In this role, you will transform the user experience in a collaborative environment interacting with process owners, operational managers as well as application and BI developers.Essential Job DutiesManage day-to-day activities of BI analysts; communicate priorities, peer-review analyst deliverables (as needed); ensure work is on-time and within budget, communicate status and escalates risks/issues timely. Mentor and train on MAXIMUS processes, source systems, and cascade standards and best practices to the team.
Manage and ensure process documentation including business requirements, use case documentation, test plans, and report specifications are maintained; conduct peer reviews to ensure standards and best practices are followed, process documentation is accurate, correctly detailed, and maintained and organized in the appropriate repository.
Oversee the design, execution and evaluation of rigorous test plans to ensure source data are accurately represented in presentation objects (dashboards/reports) and data are 'fit for use'.
Facilitate discussion among process stakeholders (both technical and non-technical) to elicit, analyze, communicate (both written and verbally) and validate requirements, process design, and business intelligence/reporting needs.
Mentor, train, and provide guidance, background information, and assistance to operational managers, analysts and other staff on standards and best practices in the following areas: business and operational analysis, and interpretation and effective use of process models, presentation objects and other analysis artifacts.
Oversee the planning and execution of analyses - often interrogating data and other information to perform root cause analysis, impact assessments, or to identify key measures and indicators of process performance making recommendations to improve or correct performance
Ensure requirements are met and intended benefits are realized through the effective use of data via a range of visualizations (e.g., dashboards, reports), and alerts while instituting standards and best practices.
Perform other duties as assigned.
Education and Experience RequirementsBachelor's degree from an accredited college or university; field of study in Operations Research, Mathematics, Statistics, Industrial Engineering, Public Policy, Management Information Sciences, or other related field preferred.
Master's degree in related field strongly preferred.
10+ years' experience successful use of analytic thinking, applying methods to determine root cause/solve problems. A demonstrated ability to interrogate data and communicate analysis findings to a technical and non-technical audience is essential.
10+ years' successful application of process-driven analysis skills and requirements elicitation.
5+ years' experience in a management position with direct oversight of a team.
Strong analytical & quantitative skills, ability to "investigate" data (competency in statistics).
Strong critical thinking skills and attention to detail.
Strong communication skills (both written & verbal) with the ability to interact with all levels of the organization.
A committed and diverse workforce is our most important resource. MAXIMUS is and Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer. MAXIMUS provides equal employment opportunities to all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status or disabled status. 


Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university; field of study in Operations Research, Mathematics, Statistics, Industrial Engineering, Public Policy, Management Information Sciences, or other related field preferred.Master's degree in related field strongly preferred.10+ years' experience successful use of analytic thinking, applying methods to determine root cause/solve problems. A demonstrated ability to interrogate data and communicate analysis findings to a technical and non-technical audience is essential. 10+ years' successful application of process-driven analysis skills and requirements elicitation.5+ years' experience in a management position with direct oversight of a team.Strong analytical & quantitative skills, ability to "investigate" data (competency in statistics).Strong critical thinking skills and attention to detail.Strong communication skills (both written & verbal) with the ability to interact with all levels of the organization.

title: Statistical Analyst
desc:
The purpose of this position is to perform statistical analyses and develop predictive response models to project potential customer behaviors in a direct marketing environment.
 
This position possesses a broad understanding of complex statistical analysis and all related applications.  Serves as a subject matter expert and applies advanced industry knowledge.  Investigates new tools and technologies that will aid in data analysis.  Handles special projects as assigned by management.  Mentors and provides feedback and guidance to other team members. 
 ●  Develops analytical and data mining solutions to improve customer acquisition, product upgrades/cross-sells and retention campaigns.  
 ●  Performs statistical analyses of both acquisition and policyholder sales marketing activities.   
 ●  Develops and maintains statistical models used to predict potential customers, predict the potential of insurers to lapse coverage, and segment the current insured and uninsured member population for marketing campaigns.  
 ●  Searches for new market segments and opportunities through statistical data mining methods, mapping of current and potential customers, and new data sources, as well as, creates and analyzes customer profiles for end users.  
 ●  Interacts with marketers and other end users to ensure the proper use and interpretation of statistical information and to discover new ways of retaining and communicating with customers.   
 ●  Coordinates, tracks, analyzes, and reports project results utilizing technical research software and information from supporting systems.  
 ●  Supports daily marketing activities such as test designs, sample sizes, confidence intervals, and ad hoc requests. 

 








Qualifications: 

●  Master’s degree or equivalent experience in mathematics, statistics, MSIS or other quantitative field required.  
●  5+ years of experience in multivariate data analysis, modeling, and statistics applications in marketing or insurance fields.  
●  Experience with multivariate regression, logistic regression, and cluster analysis preferred.  
●  Proficiency with basic statistics applications and data analysis.  
●  Proficiency in the use of base SAS and SAS/STAT, database mining and SQL.  
●  Proficiency with the application of multivariate data analysis, modeling techniques, and basic statistics required.  
●  Multivariate regression, logistical regression, and discriminate analysis preferred.  
●  TSO/ISPF, MVS/JCL, DB2, SQL, and statistical software/data mining techniques preferred.  
●  Familiarity with mapping packages preferred.  
●  Strong written and verbal skills with the ability to communicate technical information to a non-technical audience.  
●  Ability to work independently with minimal direction and assist other team members, as needed.  
●  Core competencies include:  
o  Communicating with Impact  
o  Critical Thinking and Problem Solving  
o  Planning and Organizing

title: Biostatistician
desc:
Kelly Scientific Resources is currently recruiting for a contract Biostatistician to work at a cutting edge Cancer Therapeutics Company in Seattle, WA. This is a one year, full time, contract position.  This candidate with be working with a group of biostatisticians to analyze clinical research data.Responsibilities:Responsible for statistical aspects of clinical and pre-clinical research projects including study design, sample size estimation, patient randomization, case report form development, writing statistical analysis plans, statistical analysis and interpretation of data, and reporting of results.
Work with SAS programmers as part of a biostatistics team.
Knowledge of applied parametric and nonparametric statistics, strong SAS programming skills, and the ability to translate client needs into statistical practice and the ability to educate clients in the use of statistics are essential.
Requirements:Candidate with 2+ years’ experience conducting statistical analysis of clinical research data.
Experience using SAS, Oracle Clinical, and/or ClinTrial.
Typically has a Masters or a Ph.D. degree in statistics, biostatistics, or related field with at least 6 years of pharmaceutical or related experience.

Why Kelly®?

title: Risk Model & Prod Analyst
desc: JOB SUMMARY A Risk Model and Production Analyst works under limited supervision and develops, codes, tests, debugs, maintains, and modifies programs that control the operation of the Financial Modeling and Analytics (FMA) Group. Performs simple to complex programming tasks necessary to produce reports and maintain information files. Responsible for the design and testing of statistical program logic and integration of routines into completed programs. Tests the operation of completed programs and prepares logical interface between related programs. Runs completed programs as part of the required production function. Produces advanced statistics, analytic and reporting of financial and non-financial data in formats for analysis by Management.  ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS Applies a high level technical expertise to the evaluation of the capabilities of new and existing systems related to business processes and need. Works with FMA Manager to write descriptions of production requirements, program functionalities, and steps required to develop or modify processes. Works to define scope, to develop, and implement data changes and to support ongoing enhancements. Performs exploratory data analysis, data transformation, data imputation, univariate and multivariate data analysis, and other data preparation operations. Assists with the integration of quantitative models into production processes and procedures. Assembles and manipulates large amounts of data to facilitate integration of capital stress testing requirements. Ensures data integrity/reconciliations to the core data sources and models. Is responsible for the testing/implementation of model governance procedures and model procedure controls. Develops and maintains new programs, ad hoc analysis, and management reports to support Financial Modeling and Analytics mission. Monitors and/or troubleshoots production model execution processes and systems. Assists in the management of large and/or complex data sets using statistical tools and database technologies. Identifies and critically evaluates internal portfolio data elements and external market data for use in FMA. Documents the processes used in the reporting/extract processes. Interfaces with model development staff, other departments, and external model and data vendors to define and satisfy business needs. Leads the development and implementation of automation in recurring modeling, integration, and report production in order to support multiple business areas' needs. Performs on-demand statistical programming and complex analytic tasks. Develops recommendations and presentations to management. Interacts with other departments to obtain information and data. Presents and simplifies complex information into easily comprehended presentations and reports. Develops an understanding of business requirements to design and implement statistical procedures and analytics that support the business. Prepares documentation, communication materials and methodological documentation for FMA. Provides production support for of existing FMA production systems. Consistently generates accurate, efficient, repeatable programming code that is traceable to technical specifications.Ensures appropriate documentation is created and maintained. Partners with various business areas including but not limited to; Asset Liability and Liquidity Management, Data Management Information and Delivery and ERM to provide data that meet the informational needs that will achieve business objectives. Keeps current with industry knowledge, training and development practices, trends, sources and programs. Attends industry conferences, reviews publications, establishes personal networks and participates in professional societies. Ensures compliance with all corporate policies and processes. Performs special projects, and additional duties and responsibilities as required. Where applicable and when performing the responsibilities of the job, employees are accountable to maintain Sarbanes-Oxley compliance and adhere to internal control policies and procedures.  EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE Bachelor's degree in Finance, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics or other advanced quantitative field. Master's degree preferred. Minimum of three years of relevant work experience in finance related field, including at least two years of experience in a financial institution conducting complex quantitative modeling and validation.  KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES Advanced experience with SAS; SQL, and R programming to manipulate and query data, execute statistical models, generate analytic and data outputs, in a corporate network environment. Use of R and SAS to implement functions, complex data processing operations, advanced statistical and analytic operations, productionization of complex programs, and program optimization. Predictive modeling; quantitative analysis (credit risk and financial modeling) using regression, time series, survival analysis, and other machine learning algorithms. Experience with statistical program development environments including RStudio, RevolutionR Enterprise, and SAS Enterprise Guide. Thorough knowledge of finance and capital markets. Thorough knowledge of statistical or analytical modeling language such as R and SAS. In-depth understanding of multivariate statistics and time series analysis. Proficiency using large and complex data sets. Ability to translate models into recommendations to help satisfy risk objectives. Ability to present and simplify complex information into easily comprehended presentation and reports. Ability to handle multiple projects/efforts, is flexible and helps to maintain a positive work environment. Computer literate with expert proficiency in internet navigation, word processing, spreadsheet and database applications. Knowledge of quantitative risk management methodologies including VaR and stress testing. Strong written and verbal communication skills. Good project management skills and a demonstrated ability to manage complex projects.  ABOUT NEW YORK COMMUNITY BANCORP, INC. New York Community Bancorp, Inc. (NYSE: NYCB) is one of the 25 largest bank holding companies in the nation, with assets of $48.3 billion and a market cap of $6.4 billion at June 30, 2017. With deposits of $28.9 billion and 255 branches in Metro New York, New Jersey, Florida, Arizona, and Ohio, NYCB also rank among the largest depositories in the United States. NYCB operates through two banks with eight local divisions - New York Community Bank a savings bank with 225 branches throughout our five-state franchise; and New York Commercial Bank which has 30 branches. With a longstanding reputation for strength, stability and service, NYCB is proud to be committed to the communities it serves. To learn more about the NYCB Family of Banks visit us at www.mynycb.com  BRANCH OUT and help recruit top talent for NYCB through the employee referral program. All NYCB employees are encouraged to submit referrals. Locate top talent right in the community where you live, work and play. Amazing individuals are all around. Be sure to let them know how they can become a part of the NYCB family.  NYCB is an equal opportunity employer that prohibits discrimination in hiring or terms and conditions of employment on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, national origin, disability, citizenship, covered veteran status, genetic predisposition, marital status, military status, gender identification or any other legally recognized protected basis under local, state or federal law, regulations or ordinances. In addition, NYCB complies with all applicable laws which govern nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which NYCB does business.

title: Manager, Marketing Analytics
desc:
Position Summary:The Marketing Analytics Manager is responsible for applying marketplace analytics to answer critical short and long-term business questions, drive a competitive advantage, and uncover opportunities to increase ROI for one of Tyson Foods key segments. By synthesizing complex analytics derived from syndicated market data and presenting actionable insights, this individual will influence brand leadership and facilitate sound, fact-based business decisions.They will work on one of the best brands in the industry covering approximately $2B in revenue and $60MM in Advertising and Promotion. The Marketing Analytics team is closely connected with key decision makers and is a critical resource in influencing business direction and strategy. The position reports to the Sr. Manager Marketing Analytics but interacts primarily and independently with marketing leadership as well as other cross- functional team members such as sales, finance, and supply chain.Essential Duties & Responsibilities:Transform data into insights, convey complex analysis into simple conclusions and empower others to drive action and improve business results. Work with cross-functional teams (consumer insights, revenue management, media) and mine multiple data sources together to tell a comprehensive story.
Develop high-level, predictive consumption volume forecasts for the portfolio based on an understanding of business drivers and strategy
Will present consumption drivers (Due-To’s), shipment and inventory forecasts to guide the cross-functional team involved in the monthly Sales & Operations Planning process led by demand planning and financial reviews led by Finance
Communicate forecast risks and opportunities to increase transparency and drive forecast accuracy improvements
Uncover and communicate key business opportunities relative to market share, category trends, competition, media optimization, innovation, distribution, product/packaging changes, price/price gaps, and promotion
Provide guidance in new item forecast development and support the measurement of innovation in the category
Maintain comprehensive view of category growth projections to predict short and long-term share projections
Lead marketing mix learning agenda to measure ROI of campaign. Responsibilities include recommending the scope and scale of the research, collaborating with key partners (ad agency, marketing, consumer insights and media team), and managing analysis of findings.
Work with business partner to synthesize the learnings into actionable insights and provide on-going Media ROI optimization recommendations. Work closely with a suite of supplier agencies to drive analytics research projects. Direct activities of key research and consulting resources, both internal and external.
Assist with improvements in the overall information infrastructure - quality and consistency of data; system requirements for reporting, analysis, and applications.
Qualifications:Bachelor's Degree in Economics, Statistics, Psychology, Marketing or related field. Master's Degree preferred (Business Administration, Finance, Statistics, or Economics) with a concentration in marketing/sales/quantitative analysis.
5 years forecasting/business analysis or relevant experience in increasingly responsible positions. Must have experience in quantitative analysis or statistics.Experienced in working with senior management. Branded consumer packaged goods (CPG) experience with manufacturer, research supplier, agency or retailer required. Food industry experience a plus.
Track record of effective communication, strong influencing skills in a team environment
Strong computer skills
Strong communication skills
Strong data analytical skills, independent reasoning with keen attention to detail
Proven experience with modeling techniques and has fundamental knowledge of the elements and quantitative approaches used in marketing mix, ROI optimization, forecasting, price/promotion modeling and controlled store testing/measurement Deep knowledge of syndicated marketplace retail measurement data and consumer panels. IRI/Nielsen experience preferred
Strong knowledge of marketing and sales practices, consumer and retail environment
Must demonstrate a high degree of initiative, resourcefulness, and accountability and be able to maintain organization in a fast-paced environment
Able to develop a strong, objective point- of-view, be viewed as a strategic thought leader on the team, and build constructive rapport with internal clients and outside research supplier
No direct reports
*LI-KV1

Travel is minimal.

title: Visitation Program Supervisor
desc:
Do you want to work with those recognized for their utmost excellence?  The best of the best?  Come join Maple Star’s team of innovative and dynamic trauma-effective services!
Maple Star’s team is known for its professionals who are committed to providing quality services, which empower individuals in decision making that will enable them to lead full satisfied lives within their community.
Maple Star Colorado is a multi-service agency providing Foster Care, Clinical and Community Services. Maple Star began providing foster care in Denver in 1994 and has since grown to provide in-home, community and office based services throughout the Front Range.  Our trauma informed approach to working with children and families is evidenced is all of our programs with a focus on healing, relationship and providing high quality client care
BENEFITS
• Medical, hospitalization, prescription, dental, and vision insurance• 401K with match• Flexible schedule• Mileage reimbursement• Surface Pro and phone stipend when working in the community• Reimbursement for training, clearances• Training and development opportunities• Competitive Salary• On-site paid training
SUMMARY
To assist in the process of providing quality programming to individual clients and families in accordance with rules and regulations that direct therapeutic and supervised visitation.  All job objectives should be completed according to agency standards and policies as outlined in the Maple Star Employee Handbook and state Rules and Regulations. 
QUALIFICATIONS•Master’s degree in social work or counseling required•Minimum 2 years of experience providing therapeutic services to families and children in residential or community-based settings, supervisory experience preferred
PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:
•Responsible for hiring, training, developing program protocols, scheduling, supervising parent coaching and visitation staff members, and maintain documentation necessary for monthly statistics and billing. Complete therapeutic facilitated visitation or parent coaching services as needed•Ensure completion of orientation for new workers•Develop and coordinate ongoing training agenda for visitation/ parent coaching staff •Provide individual and group supervisions for visitation/ parent coaching staff as defined by protocol•Review and assign visitation and parent coaching referrals from CORE contracts •Review visitation summaries and parent coaching reports for quality assurance•Continually assess and develop methods to improve performance of visitation/ parent coaching staff•Respond to conflicts or concerns pertaining to visitation/ parent coaching staff performance•Provide performance evaluations according to guidelines for newly hired visitation/ parent coaching staff and for quarterly KPI reviews•Ensure visitation/ parent coaching staff compliance with communication and record keeping standards for content, quality, and timely completion•Help visitation/ parent coaching staff develop observation methods that ensure safety and appropriate parenting strategies•Manage weekly scheduling process to meet contractual requirements for contact hours, communicate weekly schedules to visitation/ parent coaching staff •Coordinate schedules and staff to meet coverage needs when a visitation/ parent coaching staff is ill or on vacation, communicate schedule changes with the child(ren) and family’s case worker, other treatment team members and/or families and child(ren)’s care takers•Develop protocols on parent coaching and parent coaching center
ADMINISTRATIVE RESPONSIBILITIES:
•Ensure that visitation summaries are reported to assigned Case Worker or  recorded in TRAILS database when required.•Ensure parent coaching monthly progress reports are delivered to assigned Case Worker per contract  •Prepare monthly statistics reports regarding program utilization and cancellations for contract and billing purposes •Maintain items for visitation/ parent coaching staff personnel files and submit to office manager for filing, respond to audits of personnel files by office manager•Coordinate visitation/ parent coaching staff timely and accurate completion of all administrative paperwork, including timesheets and monthly statistics   •Review and approve visitation/ parent coaching timesheets, submit to Director of Community Programs on pre-designated dates•Recruit and hire new visitation/ parent coaching staff as needed•Ensure resources are available to visitation/ parent coaching staff to assist them in meeting their job expectations•Assist in the development, collection, and analysis of data that contribute to outcome studies•Monitor and audit weekly documentation, assimilate information into monthly reports

Maple Star is an equal opportunity employer with a commitment to diversity. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, veteran status or any other protected characteristic.
Preferred Skills:

title: Assistant Vice President, US Debit and Credit Fraud Leader

This is an AVP level role with a large bank located in Mount Laurel. There is a potential to convert to a full-time employee if things go well after about 6 months on the contract side. Must also have basic programming knowledge and knowledgeable of SQL queries and reporting. Please apply with your resume in a Microsoft Word document today to [Click Here to Email Your Resumé]. Explains variances and recommends remedial actions.  Identifies and escalates gaps in process or technology hindering efficiency and/or effectiveness of product strategies  Accountable for loss targets and the customer experience generated by fraud strategies.  Monitors and adjusts existing detection strategies to ensure continued effectiveness.  Maintains productive relationships with all internal stakeholders including Fraud Operations, Risk Management, Product, Retail, Finance as well as external vendors.  Becomes an SME on operational aspects of Fraud from point of compromise, exploitation, customer contact, claims processing, etc.  Oversees management reporting for fraud metrics, strategy performance and trends analysis.  Collaborates with team members to review data and reporting and informs business requirements on products/processes.  Maintains on-going processes and data updates.  Acts as a subject matter expert and represents the team at system/project meetings as well as industry forums.

Ability to communicate strategy analysis to both technical and non-technical team members, either verbally or via documentation  Ability to take initiative and work independently under tight timelines  A high level of integrity, earning the respect and trust of her/his peer group and employees.  Strong team collaboration skills  Ability to effectively manage multiple projects and priorities simultaneouslyOur industry-leading alliances and broad client network provide you greater access to a variety of unique interim and long-term project opportunities that can keep you continuously engaged.
