 2+ years of BI analytics experience, preferably with Microsoft BI tools (SSAS, SSRS, MS
SQL, Power BI)
 Advanced Excel skills, including complex formulas, Pivot Tables, VLookups, and macros
 Proven ability to develop effective, actionable reports and dashboards for business users
 Proficient in SQL Query development, including writing scripts for testing, reports, and data
connections

 Excellent organizational, documentation, and communication skills

users to understand complex requirements and offer creative innovative solutions
 Desire to work in a multi-disciplinary, fast-paced team environment
 Ability to work with minimal supervision and establish priorities

warehouses
 Working knowledge of Supply Chain, Category Management, and Retail Marketing and/or
CPG related businesses
 Microsoft certifications in database or BI disciplines
 Experience with EDI or ETL technologies
 Ability to “troubleshoot" difficult problems

 Build complex SQL queries, stored procedures, and views to implement business logic and

Query to analyze large amounts of data

 Develop training materials and specifications documentation for BI reports, dashboards, and
other outputs
 Provide technical support for existing reports, dashboards, and other tools

title: Cash Forecasting Analyst
desc: A division of WSFS Bank, Cash Connect is proud to be a leading national provider of ATM Cash Management and Deposit Safe Services. Cash Connect’s continual commitment to innovation has helped our clients remain at the forefront of change. Cash Connect continues to reinvent service vendor management, ATM Cash Forecasting, and Vault Cash resale.The Cash Forecasting Analyst will be responsible managing all aspects related to Cash Connect’s Forecasting service, which ensures that ATMs have optimal cash levels at all times. The incumbent will be responsible for forecasting cash amounts for ATMs and identifying potential cash outages. The incumbent will be responsible for operating a sophisticated software system used to accomplish objectives as well as managing all aspects of the software system and making system changes to improve accuracy and efficiency. Additionally, the incumbent will be responsible for accurately setting up new ATM details in the forecasting software, evaluating forecasts and making adjustments as needed, and addressing potential cash outages. The incumbent will be required to communicate with customers and vendors to ensure high service levels are met, as well as present reports to management that identify open issues. This is a full time position working 40 hours a week Monday through Friday, 7:00am-4:00pm in Newark, DE.Minimum Qualifications:  • Bachelor’s Degree in Mathematics, Accounting, or Statistics, or equivalent combination of education and experience is required.• Minimum of 2 years as a business systems analyst and/or other similar relevant experience is preferred.  Advanced knowledge of mathematics and/or statistics is highly desirable.• Must have working knowledge of software applications, including database utilities software and report writer software, database structures, internet, client service and mainframe technologies.• Must have the proven ability to analyze and streamline business processes. • Must have the ability to translate business needs into technical solutions and have the proven ability to analyze and streamline processes.• Must have to work independently and within a team environment.• Must have excellent oral and written communications skills as well as good visual presentation skills and must have excellent customer service skills.Physical Demands: The physical demands described below must be met by an Associate to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.• Incumbent will be required to stand for intermittent periods of time. • Incumbent may be required to sit for prolonged periods of time. • Dexterity is mandatory as this job requires frequent use of hands and fingers. • The incumbent will be required to walk, reach with hands and arms, push items overhead, occasionally climb or balance, stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl. • The incumbent will also be required to talk, hear, see, read and write. • This position requires regular lifting and moving of 10-25 lbs. • Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus.Cognitive Demands: The cognitive demands described below must be met by an Associate to successfully perform the essential functions of the job. • This position requires adaptability, assessing, analyzing, calculating, dependability, memorizing, good judgment, stress control, prioritization, social skills and speaking. • This position requires comprehension, organization, reasoning and decision-making, communication and mathematical ability. • Incumbent must possess the capability to understand, remember, and apply oral and/or written instructions or other information, organize thoughts and ideas into understandable terminology, prioritization of own work schedule, apply common sense in performing job duties and making decisions which have impact on immediate work unit. • Incumbent must be able to understand and follow basic instructions and guidelines, complete routine paperwork, use existing form letter and/or conduct routine oral communication, communicate with individuals using a telephone, hear and speak effectively on the telephone, express or exchange ideas by means of spoken word, communicate orally with others accurately and quickly, at an audible level that others can hear. • Incumbent must also have the ability to count accurately and the ability to add, subtract, multiply, divide and record, balance and check results for accuracy. EOE/Minorities/Females/Disability/Vet/Drug-Free Workplace

title: Web Data Analyst
desc:
Web Data Analyst
Uline – Shipping Supply Specialists
"The people I work with are as passionate as I am." 
"I came to Uline for a job. Instead, I found a career."

Uline is North America's leading distributor of shipping, packaging and industrial supplies. We're a family-owned company known for our incredible customer service and quality products. Our people make the difference. We're looking for the best and brightest to take our Internet department to the next level. If you have passion and expertise in web analytics, web content, web translation, or eCommerce analysis, Uline is the company for you.


Uline seeks a Web Data Analyst at its Corporate Headquarters in Pleasant Prairie, Wisconsin (south of Milwaukee). 



WEB DATA ANALYST RESPONSIBILITIES
Collect web data and statistics and make recommendations to improve website and reduce return rates.
Analyze data and provide weekly and monthly reports to management.
Administer and maintain web analytics tools, such as Google Analytics, SQL and Tableau.
Perform other duties as required or assigned.


WEB DATA ANALYST REQUIREMENTS 
Bachelor's degree.
2+ years experience in website analysis. 
Proficient in Microsoft Excel and Access. Knowledge of SQL preferred.

Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Well organized and detail oriented with an ability to multitask.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. 






WEB DATA ANALYST BENEFITS

Complete insurance coverage – medical, dental, vision, life.

401(k) with company match.


Generous paid time off.


Tuition reimbursement.


3 bonus programs. 


Please visit www.uline.com/jobs to learn more about our job openings and benefits package.
HOW TO APPLYPlease click the “APPLY" button to submit your resume for immediate consideration! 
EEO/AA Employer/Vet/Disabled
Uline is a drug-free workplaceSkills Requirements: 

WEB ANALYTICS, WEB ANALYTICS MANAGER, WEB ANALYSIS, WEB CONTENT, ECOMMERCE, WEB DATA ANALYST, WEB DATA, WEB STATISTICS, SQL, EXCEL, ACCESS, GOOGLE ANALYTICS, SQL, TABLEAU, CHICAGO, MILWAUKEE, RACINE, KENOSHA, WAUKEGAN, LAKE COUNTY

title: Senior Planner - Scheduler
desc:
Senior Planner - Scheduler – Chaska, MNKelly Services is currently seeking a Senior Planner - Scheduler for one of our top clients in Chaska, MNJOB TITLE:  Senior Planner - Scheduler INDUSTRY:  PharmaceuticalWORK LOCATION:  Chaska, MNDURATION:  14 Months (Temporary / Contract)JOB DESCRIPTION:Plans and buys one or more specific commodities consistent with total quality, cost and schedule requirements. The incumbent provides insightful information on industry trends for assigned commodities that may affect quality, cost, availability and/or risk; manages key and high risk suppliers to ensure continuous flow of materials and minimize company liability; may lead and/or participate on a team in contract negotiations with key suppliers; and may assist in high visibility projects. • Identifies, plans and executes projects that generate cost savings for the Procurement and Materials Planning group. • Supports corporate Strategic Sourcing projects. Works with Supplier Relationship Management (SRM) staff to support companywide projects. • Supports Value Engineering group from a procurement focus- assisting in identifying opportunities, negotiating pricing, RFQs, bid analyses, etc. • Negotiates pricing, price reductions, inventory stocking agreements, supply agreements, lead time reductions and process improvements. • Serves as escalation point for functional buyers and Analyst I Procurement staff (buyers) to resolve issues with suppliers. • Partners with buyers and supplier quality engineers to resolve delivery and quality issues, respectively. Issues and follows up on supplier corrective action reports (SCARS) as needed. The successful incumbent will meet the following requirements: • Bachelor of Business degree from accredited school, MBA preferred not but mandatory. Bachelor of Engineering acceptable with combination of business/ procurement experience. • APICS/ ISM certification preferred- CPIM, CSCP, CPM or equivalent designation. • Familiar with Lean Six Sigma philosophies/ practices- Black Belt/ Green Belt desired but not mandatory. • Intermediate-advanced Microsoft Office suite skills (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Visio). • Demonstrated ability to analyze large data sets, prepare formal reports of findings and provide decision support based on data. • Strong grasp of statistics and how to apply statistics to support decision making. • Comfortable in presenting information/ proposals to groups using Microsoft PowerPoint and ensuring message is understood by target audience. • Ability to negotiate with suppliers and align processes/ programs to support the BCI operating plan, enabling superior quality and internal/ external customer value. • Excellent project management skills- ability to complete projects expeditiously with minimal supervision. • Knowledge of FDA requirements. • Demonstrated ability to work cross-functionally with multiple departments/ sites in a team environment while also representing the best interests of BCI, Procurement department and SRM team. • 3- 10 years of fundamental procurement experience- supplier negotiations, RFQs, comprehension of cost drivers, ERP systems, payment terms, supplier performance management, etc. • Demonstrates sound decision making based in pragmatism and data but thinks outside of the box for creative ideas and how to achieve goals. • Ability to define high, medium and low impact activities and prioritize workload/ focus to produce high impact deliverables.This position will be supporting R&D with purchasing materials to support new product development. This position will also engage with suppliers to complete quotes and first articles and qualification of new suppliers.Why Kelly?Kelly® puts you in charge of your career, with access to cutting edge projects and technologies in industry leading organizations. Top companies throughout the world have trusted Kelly as a premier source of engineering talent and services since 1965. And engineering job seekers know Kelly® as a firm with an unmatched reputation for quality, integrity and professionalism. Whether you seek the variety and flexibility of working on short term project engagements, or prefer contract-to-hire or direct hire placement with our clients, apply with Kelly® to explore opportunities that suit your specific professional interests.As a Kelly Services employee, you will have access to numerous perks, including:Exposure to a variety of career opportunities as a result of our expansive network of client companies 
Career guides, information and tools to help you successfully position yourself throughout every stage of your career

title: Cognos Reporting Specialist

title: Analytics Technologist II - Winston Salem, NC
desc:
OverviewThis position serves as an analytic resource to the HBI organization by performing analytic modeling and simulation for key HBI initiatives. This position analyzes complex data streams using advanced analytic tools and techniques with objectives such as optimizing working capital investment, optimizing customer service and inventory investment, supply chain network optimization, effective demand management (demand sensing), process automation, and support of Merger & Acquisition activities. The scope of this position includes functions and processes that support nearly $5.0 billion in sales, involve more than 190,000 products, and span the globe with more than 150 manufacturing locations.Incumbent supports the Modeling & Simulation team by translating complex data into actionable information for data driven business decisions. Incumbent works both independently and collaboratively to prepare comprehensive analysis and business cases using both advanced software modeling tools and analytical techniques that may include: analytical model development, descriptive and predictive modeling, time series modeling, data mining, pattern identification, segmentation, regression analysis, simulation, and optimization. Incumbent will develop business cases that credibly communicate analytical results to many levels of the organization, across all functional areas and include interactions with Executive and Senior Management.Responsibilities1. Develop and validate advanced analytic models in support of key HBI initiatives for all business channels:Acquires, mines, and analyzes data using valid analytical methods
Proactively supports HBI functional personnel with specific recommendations that address real business problems that are often ambiguous in nature
Develops analytic models and simulations to predict, classify, quantify, describe, and/or forecast business metrics for the purpose of supporting data driven decision making
Collaborates with HBI functional personnel to understand key business dynamics and adjust strategies appropriately
Develops and utilizes key management reports to monitor and identify areas of concern and areas where strategies are working well
Investigates problems for root causes and provides recommended solutions
Ensures the availability of optimal decision making tools for management and the HbI end-user community
Under direction, identifies and shapes analytic modeling and simulation opportunities and then drives supporting actions to realize the determined opportunity
Following established best practices, delivers high quality, cost effective analytical solutions
2. Prepares results and recommendations of analytic efforts for presentation. The ability to credibly produce the following is a critical job function:Statistical data: tables, charts, and graphs
Evidence relevant to cause and effect
Evidence relevant to decision making
Fundamental strategy and analytical design of models
Insurance of data validity
3. Provides ad hoc analysis, reports, and special projects to management to support business decisions and to aid in the resolution of business issues as required.4. Engages with Production Planning, Material Planning, Sourcing, Marketing, CMG, Customer Ops, Logistics, Engineering, Forecasting, PMO, Finance, and Procurement departments to align on key strategies and to identify and resolve issues. 5. Interfaces with HbI functional areas (customers) on technical issues associated with analytic model credibility requirements. Work is checked through consultation and agreement with customers and in conjunction with formal review by Modeling & Simulation management.Minimum Education and Experience Required:Required QualificationsBachelor's degree from an accredited college or university in Analytics, Engineering, Operations Research, Statistics, Management Science, Computer Science, or related field
2-5 years of experience in relevant analytic or simulation modeling
Practical experience with some or all of the following tools: Base SAS, SAS Enterprise Guide, SAS Enterprise Miner, SAS Forecast Studio, SAS JMP, R, Oracle CrystalBall, IBM LogicNetPlus, IBM IPFA, and Arena
Demonstrated knowledge of some or all of the following: multivariate regression, logistic regression, decision tree, optimization, discrete event simulation, Monte Carlo simulation, predictive modeling, pattern identification, demand sensing, time series (forecasting), and segmentation
Expert skills in data analysis with preference given to candidates with work experience in SAS and JMP statistics packages
Practical knowledge of manipulating, cleansing, aggregating, and compiling analytic data
Practical knowledge of relational databases including ability to write SQL
Proven interpersonal skills and the ability to work well with others in a matrix organization are critical
Excellent verbal and written communication skills are essential
Mastery of MS Office tools is require
Desired QualificationsMaster's degree from an accredited college or university in the above fields is preferred
Experience in the consumer goods industry is preferred
Simulation experience is a significant plus
Lean/6 Sigma experience is a significant plus
Basic Foreign Language Skills
To qualify, applicants must be legally authorized to work in the United States and should not require now, or in the future, sponsorship for employment visa statusEOE/AA: Minorities/Females/Veterans/DisabledOnly applicants requiring reasonable accommodation for any part of the application and hiring process should contact us directly: Telephone: 877.999.5553Email: [Click Here to Email Your Resumé]

title: Contact Center Supervisor - Clinical Services
desc:
Contact Center Supervisor - Clinical Services
 
POSITION SUMMARY
The Supervisor will monitor operational performance to ensure quality care coordination services are provided.  The Supervisor will lead four Team Leads with approximately 40 Customer Service Representatives.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Manage two teams to monthly care coordination goals that includes:
Manage by walking around. 
Being visible to answer questions
Monitor CSR's performance metrics daily
Motivate and encourage through positive communication and feedback
Coach CSRs on performance, attendance and conduct 
Keep track of schedule, attendance, daily statistics, paid time off, sick time, etc.
Meet at least once each week with your Team Leads and at a minimum, review the following:
Team Lead's team past week's events, including productivity and statistics, results and company / enterprise updates.
Ensure Team Leads are actively managing teams within weekly/monthly metrics
Review goals that will be set for the coming weeks
Actively monitor team's performance and provide direction to Team Lead t
Write up and research incident reports related to attendance, productivity, and quality according to policy
Develop contests, awards and themes that increase CSR's loyalty and focus
Conduct interviewing, hiring and on-boarding new CSR's and Team Leads
KNOWLEDGE SKILLS AND ABILITIES REQUIRED
Ability to be crossed training in all divisions
Creates and maintains a high-quality work environment so staff is motivated to perform at highest level
Provide visible support to teams by walking around and be accessible
Experience working with spreadsheets, word processing, and system tools
Ability to exercise independent judgment within policy and procedure guidelines established by the company
Maintain integrity, honesty and accuracy in the representation of the company while adhering to all Federal, State and company guidelines
Experience in Google system tools or Microsoft programs such as Excel, Word, and other office products required

EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS
High School Degree or GED equivalent required
3+ years of proven leadership experience supervising teams of 15+ staff (preferably in a Contact Center environment)
Experience in a high-volume Contact Center or like environment
LPN, RN or other medical licenses preferred, but not required
In return for your contributions to our success, we offer a career experience that others can only envy. Become part of the CareSync team, and be rewarded with competitive salaries, and benefits for full-time employees including:  
Excellent health benefits one month after hire
Employer matched 401K
Paid holidays
Generous paid time off (PTO) after 90 days
Paid Life Insurance
Paid Short Term & Long Term Disability
Energetic & fast-paced work environment
Satisfaction that you're building a better experience for all the stakeholders in healthcare
Learn more about us at:   
www.caresync.com

title: Supply Chain Logistics Business Analyst
desc:
Business Analyst / Assistant Manager, Analytics               
Function: Manufacturing Vertical 
Level: Band 4A/ 4B
Reporting Relationship: Planner Deployment      
Travel: On Requirement Basis
Target Companies:  Manufacturing/Analytics/ Consulting companies
Focus of the Function:
This position will need to improve current business practices and develop strong working relationships with business partners in delivery of Forecast Accuracy and Bias KPIs. Ensure successful customer promotion execution by working with Supply Chain Managers, Integrated Planning, and Transportation and Warehousing to communicate event specifics and execution requirements. Also Identify ways to improve deployment planning processes and tools for assigned areas.Why does this job exist:
This position is responsible to Build, review, track, forecast and adjust intra-company shipments using SAP – develop and communicate deployment forecast to Transportation and Warehousing.How does the role add value:
•         The position is responsible for identifying Fulfillment best practices and supporting supply chain continuous improvement.
•         Developing  plans  that minimizes inventory at the forward DCs while maximizing customer service 
•         Ensure successful customer promotion execution by working with Supply Chain Managers, Integrated Planning, and Transportation and Warehousing to communicate event specifics and execution requirements.
•         Develop functional understanding of warehousing capacity, procedures and inbound/outbound planning processes to drive/enable warehouse capacity management and adherence to ship/arrival dates.How is this role unique from others:
•         The position serves as a liaison between cross functional business partners to ensure that all forecasts are accurate and production deadlines are met, also the Liaison with Transportation and Warehousing teams as well as personnel at 3PL to resolve issues with intra-company shipments (including resolution of near-term warehousing capacity issues)Who are the key relationships for this role:
•         This position will use information obtained from the Supply Chain Managers, Customer Service Managers & Integrated Planners.  What are the minimum prior qualifications to be an applicant for this role:
•         Graduate in Operations, Supply Chain Management / Engineering / Business or related field with understanding of applications such as SAP or other Planning Software. Candidate should possesses strong cross-functional leadership capability, demand planning business drivers, organization structures and key metrics.
•         Strong understanding of supply chain and demand planning business drivers, organization structures and key metrics. Well-developed interpersonal / communication skills.  
•         Demonstrates problem solving skills and working under tight timelines; multi-tasking abilities; exception based management capability
•         Ability to balance priorities across multiple internal and external stakeholders 
•         Ability to learn new systems quickly and leverage systems and information to influence others
•         Sound understanding of Supply and Distribution Planning.           Specific competences (Desirable)
•         Supply Chain related experience in Supply/Distribution Planning, preferably in CPG/Consumer electronics company
•         Working knowledge of SAP ECC.Key Roles and Responsibilities:
•         Build, review, track, forecast and adjust intra-company shipments using SAP – develop and communicate deployment forecast to Transportation and Warehousing
•         Analyze SAP DRP parameters to leverage auto load building capabilities 
•         Liaise with Transportation and Warehousing groups as well as personnel at 3PL to resolve issues with intra-company shipments (including resolution of near-term warehousing capacity issues) 
•         Liaise with Customer Supply Chain Managers, Customer Service, and Integrated Planning to communicate potential customer service issues/risks and provide projected availability and/or short term options to avoid service interruptions 
•         Develop functional understanding of warehousing capacity, procedures and inbound/outbound planning processes to drive/enable warehouse capacity management and adherence to ship/arrival dates 
•         Identify projects to improve deployment planning processes and tools for assigned areas.
•         Utilize optimal modes of transportation when feasible, to minimise freight expense.      
•         Strive to optimise between initiatives to minimise inventory at the forward DCs while maximizing customer service. Requirements:
•         Bachelor of Science or Statistics required - preferably in supply chain, operations or related discipline. / BE, MBA preferred.
•         SAP or other ERP/APS software experience and strong knowledge of Microsoft Office suite required.
•         Has strong understanding of supply chain and demand planning business drivers, organization structures and key metrics.
•         Possesses strong cross-functional leadership capability.
•         Succeeds at influencing a wide spectrum of stakeholders.
•         preferably in CPG/Consumer electronics company
•         Working knowledge of SAP ECC.Key Roles and Responsibilities:
•         Build, review, track, forecast and adjust intra-company shipments using SAP – develop and communicate deployment forecast to Transportation and Warehousing
•         Analyze SAP DRP parameters to leverage auto load building capabilities 
•         Liaise with Transportation and Warehousing groups as well as personnel at 3PL to resolve issues with intra-company shipments (including resolution of near-term warehousing capacity issues) 
•         Liaise with Customer Supply Chain Managers, Customer Service, and Integrated Planning to communicate potential customer service issues/risks and provide projected availability and/or short term options to avoid service interruptions 
•         Develop functional understanding of warehousing capacity, procedures and inbound/outbound planning processes to drive/enable warehouse capacity management and adherence to ship/arrival dates 
•         Identify projects to improve deployment planning processes and tools for assigned areas.
•         Utilize optimal modes of transportation when feasible, to minimise freight expense.      
•         Strive to optimise between initiatives to minimise inventory at the forward DCs while maximizing customer service. Requirements:
•         Bachelor of Science or Statistics required - preferably in supply chain, operations or related discipline. / BE, MBA preferred.
•         SAP or other ERP/APS software experience and strong knowledge of Microsoft Office suite required.
•         Has strong understanding of supply chain and demand planning business drivers, organization structures and key metrics.
•         Possesses strong cross-functional leadership capability.
•         Succeeds at influencing a wide spectrum of stakeholders.
•         The ability to lead and develop a team with a continuous improvement mindset.
•         Strong team skills - Collaborative management and working style
•         Effective Communication skills
•         Should possess high degree of versatility, good interpersonal skills, and excellent time management skills
•         Should be a team player.              Who they will be reporting to/communicating with:
•         Supply Chain Managers.
•         Customer Service Managers.
•         Integrated Planners.

title: Health Care Data Analyst with Tableau and Cognos BI - Richmond, VA
desc:
UnitedHealth Group is a company that's on the rise. We're expanding in multiple directions, across borders and, most of all, in the way we think. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about transforming the health care industry. Ready to make a difference? Make yourself at home with us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)


To learn more about Technology careers with UnitedHealth Group, please click here.


OptumInsight is looking for an experienced Health Care Data Analyst with Business Intelligence experience. This position includes working closely with the State Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) teams.

Primary Responsibilities:
Work closely with customers, database administrators, ETL teams, and project managers to create compelling business intelligence content using Tableau

Participate in SCRUM teams

Prototype reports for customers and respond gracefully to changes in requirements

Create schedules, resource plans, and implementation documentation for medium -to - large size projects

Ability to work closely with clients at various levels within the organization

Must be willing to work in Richmond, VA and travel up to 30% of the time
Required Qualifications:
2+ Years developing Tableau reports using Tableau desktop and Tableau server

1+ Years developing Cognos reports using Cognos Report Studio

3+ years of health care experience, especially focused on claims, eligibility and quality of care analysis

3+ Years of experience writing free - hand SQL queries. Excellent command of ANSI SQL.

Solid 5+ years of hands - on overall experience with Data Warehouse technologies within the domain of ETL / data integration, Business Intelligence, relational and multi - dimensional database systems

Strong organization skills and ability to set priorities and schedule work deadlines.

Very good verbal communication skills

Good written skills and proven ability to produce project deliverables in a clear and concise fashion

Experience with application development including full life cycle activities

Mentor and lead other staff that require training and guidance

Excellent understanding of SQL analytic functions.

Understanding of inferential statistics

Information Technology Architecture Analysis experience

Strong presentation skills

Careers with Optum. Here's the idea. We built an entire organization around one giant objective; make health care work better for everyone. So when it comes to how we use the world's large accumulation of health - related information, or guide health and lifestyle choices or manage pharmacy benefits for millions, our first goal is to leap beyond the status quo and uncover new ways to serve. Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, brings together some of the greatest minds and most advanced ideas on where health care has to go in order to reach its fullest potential. For you, that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges that matter. Optum, incredible ideas in one incredible company and a singular opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)

title: Team Manager - Call Center (Corporate)
desc:
Grade: Directly leads multiple reservation teams. Carries out leadership responsibilities in accordance with the organization's policies and applicable laws. Responsibilities include managing team training; planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance; rewarding and disciplining employees; addressing complaints and resolving problems.  Supports senior leaders in daily operating activities.  Must have an understanding and working knowledge of room, restaurant and show reservations.  Other duties as assigned.Maintain a highly motivated work environment through positive and constructive feedback combined with additional coaching and training.

Maintain an upbeat, positive and motivating demeanor.

Assist in creating and implementing programs to improve center operations.
Follow through on personal administrative responsibilities.
Listen attentively to employees; deliver on your promises.

Required:Bachelors degree or equivalent combination of education, training and experience.
5 years customer service experience.
Excellent customer service skills.
Able to lead and mentor a team.
Have interpersonal skills to deal effectively with all business contacts.
Professional appearance and demeanor.
Work varied shifts, including weekends and holidays.
High school diploma or equivalent.
Able to effectively communicate in English, in both written and oral forms. 
Preferred: Two years in a leadership role.
Previous experience working in a similar resort setting.

title: Senior Analyst Procurement
desc:
Our client, a leading fortune company is looking for Senior Analyst Procurement (SAP) for a 14 months contract position and is located in Chaska, MN.Job Details:
This position will be supporting R&D with purchasing materials to support new product development. 
This position will also engage with suppliers to complete quotes and first articles and qualification of new suppliers.
Description:
Plans and buys one or more specific commodities consistent with total quality, cost and schedule requirements. 
The incumbent provides insightful information on industry trends for assigned commodities that may affect quality, cost, availability and/or risk; manages key and high risk suppliers to ensure continuous flow of materials and minimize company liability; may lead and/or participate on a team in contract negotiations with key suppliers; and may assist in high visibility projects. 
Identifies, plans and executes projects that generate cost savings for the Procurement and Materials Planning group. 
Supports corporate Strategic Sourcing projects. Works with Supplier Relationship Management (SRM) staff to support companywide projects. 
Supports Value Engineering group from a procurement focus- assisting in identifying opportunities, negotiating pricing, RFQs, bid analyses, etc. 
Negotiates pricing, price reductions, inventory stocking agreements, supply agreements, lead time reductions and process improvements. 
Serves as escalation point for functional buyers and Analyst I Procurement staff (buyers) to resolve issues with suppliers. 
Partners with buyers and supplier quality engineers to resolve delivery and quality issues, respectively. Issues and follows up on supplier corrective action reports (SCARS) as needed. 


The successful incumbent will meet the following requirements:
Bachelor of Business degree from accredited school, MBA preferred not but mandatory.
Bachelor of Engineering acceptable with combination of business/ procurement experience.
APICS/ ISM certification preferred- CPIM, CSCP, CPM or equivalent designation.
Familiar with Lean Six Sigma philosophies/ practices- Black Belt/ Green Belt desired but not mandatory.
Intermediate-advanced Microsoft Office suite skills (Excel, Powerpoint, Word, Visio).
Demonstrated ability to analyze large data sets, prepare formal reports of findings and provide decision support based on data.
Strong grasp of statistics and how to apply statistics to support decision making.
Comfortable in presenting information/ proposals to groups using Microsoft PowerPoint and ensuring message is understood by target audience.
Ability to negotiate with suppliers and align processes/ programs to support the BCI operating plan, enabling superior quality and internal/ external customer value.
Excellent project management skills- ability to complete projects expeditiously with minimal supervision.
Knowledge of FDA requirements.
Demonstrated ability to work cross-functionally with multiple departments/ sites in a team environment while also representing the best interests of BCI, Procurement department and SRM team.
3- 10 years of fundamental procurement experience- supplier negotiations, RFQs, comprehension of cost drivers, ERP systems, payment terms, supplier performance management, etc.
Demonstrates sound decision making based in pragmatism and data but thinks outside of the box for creative ideas and how to achieve goals.
Ability to define high, medium and low impact activities and prioritize workload/ focus to produce high impact deliverables.
Qualified candidates please send your word format updated resume at the earliest to [Click Here to Email Your Resumé], Thank You!

title: Loss Prevention Analyst (Corporate Office-Memphis, TN)
desc:
Loss Prevention AnalystLoss Prevention analysts are internal consultants for the Loss Prevention department. They provide data using SAS software for minimizing Loss/ Shrink. They provide a statistical and financial foundation for Loss Prevention decisions. They are responsible for designing, building, scheduling and maintaining the APIS investigation case database. They must be able to troubleshoot issues with existing WebFocus reports. Loss Prevention AnalystA Bachelor's degree (BA, BS) or equivalent in Business Administration, Statistics, Engineering or comparable field.One to two years experience in an analytical role with sufficient experience in other areas to demonstrate a thorough understanding of retailing. Experience with SAS Macros and web based programming languages (like WebFocus, Java, DHTML, PHP, ASP) strongly preferred.Graduate degree/MBA preferred. APIS and/ or WebFocus experience

title: Senior Data Operations Analyst
desc:
MSX International is currently seeking a Data Operations Analyst.  The successful candidate’s must have the following skills and experience:
 
Will become the trusted data advisor supporting the dealer and service skill team, who will client and curate new and existing data sources for use in building incremental value and insight for the business
Will make recommendations for alternative ways to bring data to life to solve business problems
At times, the problem is identified by a business unit, frequently wishing to optimize cost, revenue, or improve quality, and at times problems are formulated by the Data Scientists

Creates data standards, assessing data quality and creating required transformations

Three to five years of relevant quantitative and qualitative experience in research and analytics

title: Administrative Assistant
desc:
SUMMARY The Business Development Assistant focuses on assisting the BDC Service Manager while maintaining the BDCs daily duties in an organized and efficient manner. The Business Development Assistant is responsible for ensuring all duties are performed with the highest level of professionalism and proficiency. The Business Development Assistant must be a dependable, detail oriented, self-motivated team player with a positive attitude while maintaining confidentialityESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIESRegular and Reliable attendance and punctuality

Prepare presentations, meeting agendas, letters and other written communications.

May book travel as needed.
Attend project meetings and prepare meeting minutes as needed.
Perform other related duties as assigned.
STANDARD DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIESDeveloping a thorough understanding of and demonstrating adherence to the BDC and Dealer policies and procedures
Assisting the BDC Manager with day to day duties
Assisting in monitoring the BDC activity and all BDC productivity while BD Manager is offsite
Developing proficiency with all features of the dealer and BDC CRM/DMS software
Administering the BDC CRM/DMS to assure efficiency and accuracy
Ensuring that all information inputted into the databases is consistent and accurate

Ability to prioritize all necessary duties while maintaining the highest level of professionalism and composure

Sufficient follow-up on all requests, ensuring that all duties are met in a timely manner
Ability to set and meet deadlines to ensure positive results in the BDC department
Organize and communicate schedules, training days and meetings to dealer personnel
Maintaining vendor and online back-end tools reporting and billing
Auditing and reporting production numbers such as (not limited to) shows, sales, unreported shows and statistics related to all aspects of the BDC

Demonstrating the ability to interact effectively with dealer personnel and management at all levels

The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE High school diploma or general education degree (GED); or one to three months related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience. Will be trained on computer systems. Ability to work well with customers. LANGUAGE SKILLS Ability to read and comprehend simple instructions, short correspondence, and memos. Ability to write simple correspondence. Ability to effectively present information in one-on-one and small group situations to customers, clients, and other employees of the organization. Ability to communicate customers' interests, needs, and request to management and sales personnel. REASONING ABILITY Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out detailed but uninvolved written or oral instructions. Ability to deal with problems involving a few concrete variables in standardized situations. Will perform most of shift at a desk in an office setting. Professional personal appearance.

title: Regression Modeler
desc:
Regression Modeler Summary:Signature Consultants has an opportunity for a Regression Modeler. In this role the candidate will be responsible for developing a repeatable and scalable model to measure return-on-investment (ROI) of customer experience technology solutions across multiple organizations. This modeling would include advanced correlations between performance with our technology solutions and performance on key business metrics. The long term goal is to develop a model which can be used across different organizations of different sizes and purposes, and to enable our standing team to utilize these models using given data with little assistance. Finally, a willingness to work with the project team to consider different ways of analyzing ROI, whether measurable or intangible, for each business helps support our overall aim of driving change and improving performance for each of the internal customers we serve.Responsibilities:Build Regression models from multiple data sources to analyze impacts and correlations among large data-sets
Consultation with project group on utilization of ROI and correlation models
Enable colleagues to use models with little oversight or assistance
Create transparency around modelling and process through status updates and project calls
Structure statistical models in such a way that data visualization becomes simple and user friendly
Leverage existing technologies such as Excel and Tableau to build and maintain the statistical models
Qualifications:Multivariate Regression Modeling experience required
Knowledge of a variety of statistical and probability approaches to measuring impacts and correlations among data within a business, including understand linear and multivariate regression analyses
Experience building ROI modeling
Experience working on Feasibility Analysis - Business Case creation, cost benefit analysis, calculate NPV and IRR to determine Return on Investment (ROI)
Moving from data to insights to action within multiple organizations
Preparing data visualization for an executive audience
Take the data and analysis and make them accessible to executive audiences
Background working in a project management environment and familiar with the various methodologies (SDLC/Waterfall, Agile and Iterative) and how ROI is calculated for them
Ability to work with project managers and SMEs to deploy models into live production environment
Exposure to working with iterative processes and measuring impacts for cyclical projects
Experience in financial industry preferred
Familiar with Project Portfolio Management (PPM) Concepts and Tools - Capacity Planning, Resource Management and Budgeting/Financials
Education/Experience:4+ years of research or analytics experience
Bachelor's degree with significant coursework in quantitative fields such as Statistics, Econometrics, Mathematics, Business (with quantitative emphasis)
Master's degree preferred
Key Skills/Competencies:"Hands-on" approach to data and modeling
Aptitude for learning the practical application of statistical analysis to address business issues
Strong analytical and problem solving skills, particularly with application of statistical and quantitative tools
Understanding of advanced statistics, especially in areas of linear regression
Ability to work in a virtual setting with remote team members
Detail-oriented and strong project management skills
Well-organized, capable of handling several tasks at a time while meeting deadlines
Strong oral and written communication skills, influencing skills and presentation skills
Skilled at Microsoft Office, particularly Excel and PowerPoint
Tableau experience preferred
Self-starter who can work independently with little oversight or guidance
Comfortable working with business, analytics and technical teams
About Signature Consultants, LLCHeadquartered in Fort Lauderdale, Florida, Signature Consultants was established in 1997 with a singular focus: to provide clients and consultants with superior staffing solutions. For the seventh consecutive year, Signature was voted as one of the "Best Staffing Firms to Work For" and is now the 14th largest IT staffing firm in the United States (source: Staffing Industry Analysts). With 26 locations throughout North America, Signature annually deploys thousands of consultants to support, run, and manage their clients' technology needs. Signature offers IT staffing, consulting, managed solutions, and direct placement services. For more information on the company, please visit www.sigconsult.com

title: Financial Analyst
desc:
***PLEASE NOTE:  This position is located at the following address in Orlando, Florida***800 N. Magnolia Ave. Ste 202Orlando, FL 32803Phone: 407-872-3677 Ext. 3002HCA has been recognized as a World’s Most Admired Company in the Health Care Medical Facilities Industry by Fortune Magazine. The Ambulatory Surgery Division of HCA operates and jointly owns with physicians 130 surgery centers across the United States. Our cases are performed Monday-Friday which means NO nights, NO weekends, or On-call will be required. The size of our surgery centers naturally creates a culture where everyone knows one another with a shared focus on providing the best possible experience for those that we serve. We are currently in search of additional members to join our team!     We value you and your future. We provide multiple health insurance plan options, tuition reimbursement, and many more programs to cover a wide variety of today’s life and family needs.  In addition to your salary and health insurance benefits, HCA provides a matching 401k as well as an Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP). Members of HCA receive consumer discounts on cell phones, hotels, rental cars, and many others. Interviews are being set immediately, you are encouraged to apply today! JOB SUMMARY: The Financial Analyst provides operational and financial analysis to the Ambulatory Surgery Division (ASD) operational unit leaders and senior leadership.  The Financial Analyst generates and delivers monthly financial reports, report key financial statistics and assists business unit leaders in managing information effectively to optimize departmental efficiency and performance. SUPERVISOR: Senior Financial Analyst DUTIES (included but not limited to):•         Works closely with operations departments to assess and report performance•         Coordinates scheduled and ad hoc data and analysis requests across ASD operational unit•         Assists in the development and delivery of adhoc reports•         Assists in the development of financial data collection and measurement tools within the ASD.•         Prepares and analyzes Monthly Operating Reports.•         Prepares weekly financial projections for 7 markets within the ASD•         Prepares quarterly partnership financial packets for 61 surgery centersWorks with the legal department to maintain and execute physician contracts Manages the contract management system for assigned divisions within the ASD   •         Other duties as assigned.

Financial analysis skills ‐ knowledge of research techniques sufficient to collect and interpret data. Knowledge of descriptive statistics to analyze statistical data and prepare projections.  Skilled in interpreting and analyzing data. Skilled in examining documents and quantitative metrics for correctness and accuracy.  Ability to apply business intelligence strategies to convert business cases into solutions.  Knowledge of legal and fiscal requirements and regulations.•         Accounting – knowledge of cash flows, balance sheets, income statements and the general ledger.•         Communication ‐ communicates clearly and concisely, verbally and in writing. This includes utilizing proper punctuation, correct spelling and the ability to transcribe accurately.•         Customer orientation ‐ establishes and maintains long‐term customer relationships, building trust and respect by consistently meeting and exceeding expectations.•         Interpersonal skills ‐ able to work effectively with others.•         PC skills ‐ demonstrates proficiency in Microsoft Excel & Power Point, Microsoft Office suite, and in other applications as required. Demonstrate knowledge of relational databases, including SQL queries.•         Policies & Procedures ‐ demonstrates knowledge and understanding of organizational policies, procedures and systems.•         Basic skills ‐ able to perform mathematical calculations and understands basic accounting functions.EDUCATION•         Bachelor’s degree with focus in Accounting or Finance required. EXPERIENCE•         1‐2 years progressive accounting/finance experience required.•         Basic SQL and/or Business Objects query writing experience preferred. PHYSICAL DEMANDS/WORKING CONDITIONS:Requires prolonged sitting, some bending, stooping and stretching. Requires eye‐hand coordination and manual dexterity sufficient to operate a keyboard, photocopier, telephone, calculator and other office equipment. Requires normal range of hearing and eyesight to record, prepare and communicate appropriate reports. Requires lifting papers or boxes up to 25 pounds occasionally. Work is an office environment. Work may be stressful at times. Contact may involve dealing with angry or upset people. Staff must remain flexible and available to provide staffing assistance for any/all disaster or emergency situations.

title: Medical Technologist
desc:
Position Summary: Responsible for independent performance of a variety of waived, moderate and high-complexity testing. Responsible for testing equipment maintenance, procedure quality control and reagent calibration. Supports department QA studies by
collecting statistics and troubleshooting for process improvement. Aids in new employee orientation. Performs other duties as assigned by Director.


Position Qualifications:
1. 4 year Bachelor’s degree
2. Minimum one year experience
3. ASCP or NCA certification or equivalent
3. 7 hours AIDS education or prior Washington state HCA license.
4. HCA License within 90 day
5. AHA Healthcare BLS
Essential Job Functions*:
1. Performs independent, complex diagnostic work on patient samples. Performs Laboratory routine and Stat procedures in a timely manner. Reports abnormal and critical results to physician and/or nursing staff per Hospital policy. Uses the occurrence reports
to document errors which may affect patient care. Is a source of information for physicians and nursing staff.
2. Demonstrates ability to work at a generalist level in Microbiology when needed, follows culture set-up guidelines and streaks plates properly.
3. Ensures quality control criteria are met before reports are issued and reviews test results for accuracy before releasing. Adheres to specimen collection and rejection criteria. Records unacceptable and rejected specimens on the appropriate log.
4. Ensures all routine/preventative maintenance is performed during shift and is recorded clearly and adequately. Trouble shoots equipment problem and alerts Director/Supervisor/Biomedical Service promptly when outside service is required.
5. Supports department QA studies by collecting statistics, troubleshooting for process improvement.
6. Performs venipunctures according to Laboratory policy. Recognizes the patient’s age/cultural needs as a relevant factor and applying appropriate critical thinking and decision-making skills.
7. Yearly competencies are completed and on file in the Laboratory. Meets in-service requirements including mandatory education. Participates in CAP testing in all areas worked in the Laboratory. Is responsible for information delivered at department staff
meetings.
8. Stays constructively busy and may be required to assist in the performance of other incidental duties as required and assigned.

 
Essential Physical, Mental and/or Environmental Working Conditions:
1. Must be able to meet the physical/mental demands of position with or without accommodation. See checklist (page 2) for specific physical, mental and environmental working conditions.
2. Must be able to utilize good judgment, demonstrate patience, and maintain a professional demeanor at all times.
3. Must be able to work in a busy and stressful environment.

title: Data Analyst (SQL, Python)
desc: Candidate ResponsibilitiesRequired Qualifications: Bachelor, Masters, or PhD degree in an accredited Engineering, Mathematics, Computer Science program, Strong technical and problem solving skills, Good written and verbal communication skills with US-based engineers (Peoria and Lafayette primarily), Interest in using data and analytics to solve problems. Preferred Qualifications: Knowledge of Caterpillar telematics hardware and processes, Strong statistics knowledge with applications in problem solving, Proficient in one or more programming languages (Preferred: Matlab, Python, SQL).This position is responsible for using product data to assist design engineers in improving product design and increasing value to the end customer. The work will involve problem solving for large engines used in a variety of applications.Typical DayPrimarily a desk job, the position would involve looking at time-series data returned from field hardware in order to develop models to further the understanding of our products. Responsibilities include: Analysis requests - typically one-time request for groups within LPSD involving many assets or many days of a single/few assets. Output could be a summary report, data output (spreadsheet) Creation of new algorithms - Develop and validate logical rules to monitor component life and predict failures ahead of end-of-life. Implement algorithms on a wide array of products, automating the monitoring when possible. Replication of existing algorithms - Taking established algorithms running on ECM or back-office and replicate them to a new engine application. This will require tuning the algorithm to a new data set, testing, and validation. Monitoring requests - Implement a system to monitor parameters or calculated channels on one or many assets. title: Continuous Improvement Specialist
desc:
Element Materials Technology is the 5th largest testing company in the world.


We recognize that our employees are the key to our current and future success and that they are therefore our most valued resource.

What makes working at Element so special, is a combination of the absolute focus that we have on what we do and who we do it for; the business challenge we have set out for ourselves – to be the absolute best at what we do - and finally teaming with our most valued asset, the exceptionally talented people who work tirelessly to solve the technical and commercial challenges of our clients face each and every day.

Purpose of this Position

As a Business Improvement Specialist, you are a part of the Element Business Improvement Team. The team is charged with the task to implement an improvement culture and structure in all Element locations and to execute improvement projects. The projects can be focused on process improvements in the machine shop, testing departments, logistics or the back office and include both physical and business processes. Additionally, improvement project can be focused on capacity expansion. Some of the tools and methods that you will be using are 5S, Kaizen events, Value Stream Mapping, Six Sigma projects, Lean methods and Change Management trainings.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Responsible for preparation, execution, and aftercare of Improvement Projects within the United States, and specifically the Huntington Beach, CA location. The position will be officed out of the Element Huntington Beach location. Will work closely with General Manager, Operations Managers, and Division Director.
Making a plan with the locations’ management for the Operational Excellence Roadmap.
The measurement of progress and targeting of results from improvement projects.
Coaching of change agents and management to ensure the maximum positive impact of the project on the Element stakeholders.
Proactive and effective communication related to improvement initiatives.
Mobilize commitment for change and enable the continuous sustainment of change initiatives.

Supervisory Responsibilities This position does not supervise staff.


Qualifications To perform this position successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Must be experienced in managing complex and sensitive issues.
Must be proficient in standard office software and computer systems. (MS Windows, Word, Power Point). Must be advanced Excel user.
Competent use of statistics related to Business Improvement metrics
Strong interpersonal skills to effectively deal with internal customers; foster open upward and downward communication within the organization built on mutual respect.
Well developed and effective verbal and written communication skills used in working with peers and employees at all levels of the organization.
Project management skills to manage the process of providing excellent customer service, exceptional quality of service and turnaround, and continuous improvement ;
Broad knowledge of operations, engineering, and financial management;

Education and/or Experience
Bachelor’s degree in engineering, operations management, or related field. Master’s degree considered a plus, but not required.
Minimum 3 to 5 years in business of which at least 2 years in operational excellence, lean six sigma or management.

Language Skills Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, education and instructional materials, and procedure manuals. Ability to create clear and concise presentation materials, emails and other forms of written communications. Ability to speak to individuals at all levels of the organization and in front of large groups. Fluent Spanish considered a plus.

Mathematical Skills Ability to calculate KPIs such as On Time Delivery, Lead Time, First Time Right, and Incident Rate. Strong knowledge of and experience in statistics (regression, range, mean, standard deviation) and ability to apply this knowledge appropriately given the situation.

Reasoning Ability Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of variables in situations where only limited standardization exists. Methodically address root cause of a problem or failure while documenting problem-solving process and root cause identification. Ability to interpret data and distinguish between correlation and causation.

Certificates, Licenses, Registrations
Must have valid driver’s license, or ability to obtain prior to beginning employment.
Six Sigma and/or lean certification from recognized governing body, institution, or business entity.
Physical Demands
Frequency of required physical force: occasional (moderate).
Lifting requirements: lifting <50 lbs. sporadically.
Ability to stand on feet for long periods of time.

Other Skills and Abilities
Investigative; Takes time to understand people and process
Analytical; Makes decisions based on facts and knows how to analyze data.
Open minded and eager to learn; Willing to attend classes and read books to develop her/his self and open minded toward new ways of working.
Willing to grow within the organization; The Business Improvement Manager position is a position for about 2 years and based on the performance the next step should be an operational management position within ELEMENT in the US.
Ability to remain calm when faced with mounting pressure related to deadlines and multiple priorities.
People development: Training, development, and coaching of Change Agents;
Tool/Methodology development: Maintaining of training and methodologies material and updating or developing when necessary;
Projects: Work on high-level projects, across departments; Coordination of improvement projects portfolio;
Coaching: Assisting Champions and Process Owners with project selection and project management;
Reporting: Provide management information and overview on progress, results, and issue

title: HVAC Technician Career Training
desc:
Interested in a career in the field of Heating, Cooling and Refrigeration? My HVAC Career can help! START TRAINING FOR YOUR NEW HVAC CAREER TODAY! Graduate employment services may be available once training is complete. This posting is for Career Training Services, provided by our network of schools located across the United States. Job placement is not guaranteed and programs require tuition. Financial assistance available to those who qualify!
My HVAC Career is the first step for individuals looking to get their HVAC certification in order to start a career in the growing industry of Heating and Cooling. According to the U.S. Department of Labor, the job market in HVAC is expected to grow much faster than the average for all occupations. In fact, Employment of heating, refrigeration and air conditioning mechanics is on track to grow 34% from 2010 to 2020. The outlook on job opportunities for HVAC/R techs are excellent for those who have completed training at an accredited or state licensed technical school.
My HVAC Career connects individuals interested in pursuing a career in HVAC with local training schools who can help you achieve your goals. Upon completion of your training program, many HVAC schools offer job placement assistance which can help you begin your career. 
Are you looking for a career with promising job prospects? If you’re in the market for a stable career in a growing industry, this is the certification to get you on your way. Upon completion of training there are a variety of opportunities you can pursue. Some HVAC careers include employment in wholesale, service, equipment, manufacturing, and more!If interested in training for a career in Heating, Ventilation, Air Conditioning and Refrigeration, Click Here To Apply!
 
Why an HVAC Career?
Heating, ventilation, and air conditioning systems are vital to homes and businesses across the United States. Homeowners and business owners alike need the services of skilled technicians with an HVAC license to perform reliable installation, repair, and service for their crucial systems. Companies are looking for qualified technicians who possess an HVAC certification to meet the needs of their growing businesses.
The Department of Labor expects HVAC careers to grow at a much faster rate than other occupations. Employers looking to fill these positions are on the hunt for certified technicians. There are a variety of opportunities available for those pursuing HVAC careers. Various options include employment in wholesale, service, equipment manufacturing, and more. HVAC technician salary levels vary by establishment. Join a career that can be rewarding for you and your family!
Industry Outlook:
According to the U.S. Department of Labor, Employment of heating, air conditioning, and refrigeration mechanics and installers is expected to grow 34% from 2010 to 2020. This growth rate is exponentially higher than most other occupations. Commercial and residential building construction will drive employment growth as the construction industry continues to recover from the 2007-09 recession. The growing number of sophisticated climate-control systems is also expected to increase demand for qualified HVAC/R technicians.
Climate-control systems generally need replacement after 10 to 15 years. A large number of recently constructed homes and commercial buildings will need replacement climate-control systems by 2020, spurring demand for technicians.
According to the Bureau of Labor Statistics, job opportunities for HVACR technicians are expected to be excellent, particularly for those who have completed training at an accredited technical school or through a formal apprenticeship. Candidates familiar with computers and electronics will have the best job opportunities as employers continue to have trouble finding qualified technicians to work on complex new systems.
*Bureau of Labor Statistics, U.S. Department of Labor, Occupational Outlook Handbook, 2012-13 Edition, Heating, Air Conditioning, and Refrigeration Mechanics and Installers


If interested in learning more about HVAC training - Request more info Today!Must be 18 years of age or older
Must have HS Diploma or GED Equivalent
Program requires tuition
Successful completion of program does not guarantee employment

title: Assistant Manager, Loan Servicing
desc: Assistant Manager, Service Center Summary PenFed is hiring an Assistant Manager, Service Center in Omaha, NE . The primary purpose of this job is to oversee the daily operations of the branch such as overseeing the day to day activities of branch team members.  Perform the duties of the Manager of the Service Center in the manager’s absence.  Essential Functions  Coordinate and implement branch operations as required, according to policies and procedures.  Assist branch team members in the resolution of complex member account problems and/or questions, making decisions as appropriate.  Maintain loan officer authority, ability to make loan determinations in accordance with Federal Credit Union Act, regulations, and PFCU policies and procedures  Provide lending guidance to Operations Officers as required.  Coordinate the development of each employee, ensuring performance goals are established for each and progress monitored regularly.  Plan and organize unit staff meetings.  Provide input to the Manager in areas of staffing, disciplinary action and training.  Maintain staffing schedule and serve as liaison between branch and payroll in regards to team members leave.  Review branch documents for accuracy, legibility and completeness.  Maintain current knowledge of PFCU products and procedures, and products offered by competitors.  Ensure that all procedural updates or changes are distributed to branch staff.  Prepare statistical reports relating to branch operations.  Act as Assistant Treasurer within delegated authority  Perform duties of a Mortgage Consultant as required  This is not intended to be an all-inclusive list of job duties.  Education and Experience  Equivalent combination of education and experience is considered. Bachelor’s Degree in related field, knowledge of statistics preferred.  Two years’ work experience in banking operations, or equivalent required. Experience with PenFed Credit Union products preferred.    Knowledge of statistics preferred.  Supervisory/team lead experience required.  Supervisory Responsibility This position will supervise employees.  Licenses and Certifications  There are no additional certifications required.  Work Environment While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly exposed to an indoor office setting with moderate noise. Travel Limited travel to various worksites is required.  About Us Founded in 1935, and still growing, we began as the War Department Federal Credit Union.  Today, PenFed is one of the country’s strongest and most stable financial institutions with over 1.5 million members and over $21 billion in assets.  We serve members in all 50 states and the District of Columbia, as well as on military bases in Guam, Puerto Rico and Okinawa.   Our mission isn’t simply to help our members get by. We exist to help them realize every ounce of their potential. We exist to educate, and to encourage. We exist to usher their dreams into the land of reality. We provide our employees with a lucrative benefits package including robust medical, dental and vision plan options, plenty of paid time off, 401k with employer match, on-site fitness facilities at our larger locations, and more.  PenFed is an Equal Opportunity Employer    PenFed will maintain and observe personnel policies which will prohibit discrimination or harassment against a person because of race, color, creed, age, sex, gender, religion, national origin, ancestry, genetic information, military or veteran status or obligation, the presence of a physical and/or mental disability and all other statuses protected by applicable state or local law in all recruiting, hiring, training, compensation, overtime, position classifications, work assignments, facilities, promotions, transfers, employee treatment, and in all other terms and conditions of employment.  PenFed will also prohibit retaliation against individuals for raising a complaint of discrimination or harassment or participating in an investigation of same.  PenFed will also reasonably accommodate qualified individuals with a disability so that they can apply for a job or perform the essential functions of a job unless doing so causes a direct threat to these individuals or others in the workplace and the threat cannot be eliminated by reasonable accommodation or if the accommodation creates an undue hardship to PenFed. Contact human resources (HR) with any questions or requests for accommodation at 703-838-1568.

title: Quantitative Analyst
desc:
Group: 
MCISClearance Level Needed: 
Top SecretShift: 
DayCategory: 
Scientific / AnalyticalCapable, qualified and versatile quantitative intelligence and threat research analysts to support and collaborate with a multi-disciplinary team of data scientists and analysts on a wide range of problems. The person in this position will bring analytical rigor and statistical methods to address the challenges of National and Homeland Security-related threats, and will help analyze large data sets, identify data sources useful in analyzing threats, and assist in the development and delivery of high-quality, data-driven, machine learning and predictive modelling solutions.Responsibilities:• Perform qualitative and quantitative analysis of large data sets, including classification, pattern, and entity extraction associated with various National and Homeland Security threats (e.g., cartels, illicit trafficking, terrorist travel, nuclear proliferation).• Research specific threat behaviors using reasonably available data and information to analyze and model that behavior (using all reasonably available tools and techniques) for the purpose of developing risk assessment techniques to target that behavior.• Support projects with hands-on analysis and modeling, leveraging data analysis and analytical techniques and methods to solve complex business problems.• Help develop a predictive analytics model that includes data collection, organization, advanced statistical analysis and predictive solutions, text and data mining.• Perform, and assist with developing and maintaining predictive modeling and running analytical models. Develop business requirements, design technical solutions, execute SQL queries, and test solutions.• Perform collection, organization, manipulation, and statistical analysis of structured and unstructured data in the development of predictive analytical solutions.• Extract patterns from a large datasets and transform data into an informational advantage for decision support.QualificationsKey Qualifications:• Experience with the application of mathematical and statistical methods, and numerical or quantitative techniques.• 2 years of experience in data analysis or related field.• Experience with statistical software (R, Weka, STATA, SPSS, SAS, or similar).• Experience with databases and scripting languages (such as Python).Education:• Bachelor's Degree in finance, statistics, economics, accounting, mathematics or a related quantitative field (e.g., Computer Science, Physics, Operations Research).• MBA/MS/MA is a plus.Desired Skills and Experience:• Experience working in a National or Homeland Security-related environment, working on issues such as transnational security, illicit trafficking, criminal networks, transportation sector, or border security.• Experience with statistical analysis, machine learning, data mining, or building statistical methods.• Experience working with large structured and unstructured data sets to identify and prepare data for statistical analysis and analytics.• Ability to design and execute data science analyses such as Monte Carlo simulation, Data Mining, Pattern Recognition, Agent Based Modeling, Bayesian Network analysis, genetic algorithms as well as advanced statistical analysis.• Public policy, political science, or legal background in a national security, homeland security, or law enforcement domain.• Existing, active CBP or DHS Public Trust clearance.


Requires Bachelor's degree (to include courses in statistics or research methods) or equivalent, and zero to two years of related experience.

title: Clinical Informaticist
desc:
Dynamic Clinical Informaticist needed to support the Air Force Medical Service (AFMS) enterprise mission. Candidate must have the proven ability to synthesize disparate facts from multiple sources and coalesce into an accurate and useful analytic product. Candidate shall develop and execute analyses alongside clinical and business teams to inform decision-making and program development within the AFMS.

Successful candidate will:

Demonstrate ability to provide accurate and timely analytical products containing well-reasoned and cogent discussion points providing Air Force leadership with substantiated options for courses of action.
Communicate analytical discoveries and appropriate recommendations / mitigations strategies to senior AFMS leadership.
Utilize data mining and probability to forecast outcomes.
Acquire expert knowledge of the AFMS and Medical Health System (MHS) as needed to support population health analytics and initiatives.
Function as a liaison between providers of information (Defense Health Agency, Air Force) and users of data such as AFMS Analytics, AFMS leadership, military treatment facility leadership and analytics assets.


Requirements include:

Minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree in a clinical discipline (e.g., health informatics, health information management or equivalent).
Minimum 3 years’ clinical experience in an acute care hospital setting with thorough knowledge of physician/provider, nursing and health workflows.
Minimum 5 years’ experience in health informatics with a focus on clinical systems (big data technologies and Machine-Learning, data mining and statistics).
Demonstrated knowledge and skill in the provision of evidence-based practice in a clinical setting.
Ability to work independently and problem solve in a proactive manner, demonstrating flexibility and adaptability in changing work environments.
Demonstrated ability to create and execute plans and ensure timelines are met while working with a variety of stakeholders.
Experience in clinical decision support, to include developing and executing reports from large clinical data sets.
Knowledge of relational database software; experience in applied statistics using SAS, SQL or other statistical programs.
Prior experience implementing or supporting clinical information Systems (CHCS, AHLTA, and/or Essentris experience preferred, but not required).
Ability to gain access to the following AFMS/MHS information systems: M2, CHCS, AHLTA, Essentris, PDTS, TMDS, MEPRS/DMHRSi, EAS IV, TPOCS/ABACUS, AFCHIPS, HSDW, and other applicable systems as developed.
Advanced proficiency in MS Office products.
Ability to work in AFMS space at Lackland Air Force Base in San Antonio, TX.
Ability to undergo a background investigation which requires U.S. Citizenship.
