desc:
Ref ID:04730-9500830100Classification:Account Executive/Staffing ManagerCompensation:$70.00 to $80.00 per hourRobert Half Strategic Accounts is currently staffing an Assistant Vice President, US Debit and Credit Fraud Analytics Leader for US Fraud Operations, is primarily responsible for the development and deployment of fraud strategies across the credit and debit channels within the organization (bank operations), working with cross-functional business partners to implement strategies, track strategy performance and continuously improve the process. Equally critical to the success of this role is the ability to balance impact to operational teams and the customer experience. This role requires strategic thinking, fraud strategies/detection experience, partnering with and leading team mates on data preparation and reporting, applying analytical and technical skills, leveraging sophisticated tools/detection systems as well as defining/deploying business requirements for products/processes. Requirements:  Expands detection capability for new and emerging Fraud trends, specifically for Credit and Debit products. Identifies and escalates gaps in process or technology hindering efficiency and/or effectiveness of the Analytics or Operations teams.  Converts analytical insights into recommendations for specific Fraud Operations initiatives, developing the business case and performing post-implementation tracking to ensure that targets are attained.  Mines and conducts analysis on customer, account and transactional data to create segmentation and develop fraud rules/strategies while balancing the impact to operational teams and the customer experience.  Designs champion/challenger strategies that lead to ongoing learning and improvement.  Utilizes diagnostics to identify system, strategy and operational issues. Explains variances and recommends remedial actions.  Identifies and escalates gaps in process or technology hindering efficiency and/or effectiveness of product strategies  Accountable for loss targets and the customer experience generated by fraud strategies.  Monitors and adjusts existing detection strategies to ensure continued effectiveness.  Maintains productive relationships with all internal stakeholders including Fraud Operations, Risk Management, Product, Retail, Finance as well as external vendors.  Becomes an SME on operational aspects of Fraud from point of compromise, exploitation, customer contact, claims processing, etc.  Oversees management reporting for fraud metrics, strategy performance and trends analysis.  Collaborates with team members to review data and reporting and informs business requirements on products/processes.  Maintains on-going processes and data updates.  Acts as a subject matter expert and represents the team at system/project meetings as well as industry forums.  Demonstrated analytical, financial modeling and problem solving skills.  Conceptual thinker; ability to wade through data and arrive at conclusions  Strong interpersonal and leadership skills; comfortable interacting with team members of all levels and providing guidance to team members  Ability to develop and implement fraud strategies, working across various businesses/product channels to achieve business objectives  Strong communication and presentation skills. Ability to communicate strategy analysis to both technical and non-technical team members, either verbally or via documentation  Ability to take initiative and work independently under tight timelines  A high level of integrity, earning the respect and trust of her/his peer group and employees.  Strong team collaboration skills  Ability to effectively manage multiple projects and priorities simultaneously


Qualifications and Experience:  Bachelor's degree in a numerate discipline (e.g. Statistics, Business) required  Master's degree in a numerate discipline (e.g. Statistics, Business) preferred required  7-10 years' experience in Fraud Strategies, Management and Detection  Credit and Debit Card  5+ managerial experience - leading groups/teams, specific to Fraud Strategies, Management and Detection  Basic programming knowledge  Strong leadership and general management skills in overseeing a team and working collaboratively across functions.  A high level of integrity, earning the respect and trust of her/his peer group and employees.  Ability to communicate strategy analysis to both technical and non-technical team members, either verbally or via documentation. For immediate consideration, please send resumes to [Click Here to Email Your Resumé].Accountemps matches highly skilled professionals with accounting finance jobs at the best companies on a temporary and temporary-to-hire basis. Our mission is to provide you with a rewarding finance or accounting job that is well matched to your professional skills  helping you to advance in your career. Our experience, combined with the resources of our worldwide network of offices, makes Accountemps a great resource for your career. We offer excellent opportunities to find temporary accounting and finance jobs for all experience levels. From accounting clerks and bookkeepers to accounts payable and staff accountants, we can provide you unparalleled access to exciting career opportunities. But don't take our word for it. Our company once again was named first in our industry on Fortune® magazine's list of "World's Most Admired Companies" (March 1, 2017), and 9 out of 10 of our customers would recommend our service to a colleague.Contact your local Accountemps office at 888.670.5403 or visit www.accountemps.com to apply for this job now or find out more about other job opportunities.All applicants applying for U.S. job openings must be authorized to work in the United States. All applicants applying for Canadian job openings must be authorized to work in Canada.© 2017 Accountemps. An Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/Disability/Veterans By clicking 'Apply Now' you are agreeing to Robert Half Terms of Use.

title: Registrar
desc:
Cortiva 
- Chicago Campus is in immediate
need of a Registrar. This position is an essential component of the Campus
Education Management Team. The Registrar shares responsibility for retention
and completion with the Education Manager and is accountable for maintaining
accurate student records and statistics. Because of these responsibilities, the
ideal candidate must possess excellent oral and written communication skills,
be able to monitor data and identify changes and trends, be able to set
priorities, multi-task, pay close attention to detail, function under pressure,
set goals, and meet deadlines.


Post and review daily
attendance
Advise students of school
academic policies
Maintain contact with
faculty regarding student issues
Ensure mandatory
attendance of students at tutoring sessions
Plan or assist planning
and attend orientations, graduations, open houses and other student
functions
Assist in planning and executing
a minimum of 1 student appreciation activity per quarter 
Assist in planning and
executing annual Constitution Day educational event each September
Maintain confidentiality
regarding student affairs and administrative responsibilities 
Maintain current knowledge
of all programs, curricula, policies and procedures
Promote student support
services throughout the school
Facilitate networking,
communication, and leadership among academic and administrative personnel
throughout the school
Assist in analyzing attrition
data and take action to improve retention
Assist in preparation of
annual retention statistics and annual Retention Plan
Attend regular academic
meetings and report on registrar related activities






 

Minimum of two years post-secondary education or two to three years related administrative experience. An equivalent combination of education and experience will be considered


Excellent oral and written communication skills


Able to monitor data and identify changes and trends


Able to set priorities, multi-task, pay attention to detail, function under pressure, set goals and meet deadlines. 


Computer literate with knowledge of Microsoft Office including Word and Excel programs. 

Excellent customer service and interpersonal skills.

title: Customer Service Group Lead
desc:
SUMMARY - Assist with directing the activities and training of the Customer Service Representatives in processing customer calls and completing accurate customer orders.ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES (Other duties may be assigned)Attends work on a regular and predictable basis
Works with manager and supervisors to collect, tally, and post daily statistics for Customer Service Representatives
Sets dialer jobs daily and ensures customer calls are up to date
Provides training and coaching sessions with Customer Service Representatives
Monitors Customer Service Representatives' daily statistics
Assist with various Customer Service Phone Queues
SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES Monitor Agent daily productivity stats, Monitor Dialer job/statsEDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE High school diploma.Continuing education and / or degree in business management preferred.
Healthcare/DME knowledge (required or preferred?).
Exhibit strong written/verbal communication and organizational skills
Ability to work in a fast paced environment while being able to multi-task
Ability to think critically and problem solve
PHYSICAL DEMANDS - While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel and taste or smell. The employee frequently is required to sit. The employee is occasionally required stand and walk. The employee is never required to lift more than 10 lbs. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision.WORK ENVIRONMENT - While performing the duties of this job, the employee is not exposed to moving mechanical parts; high, precarious places; fumes or airborne particles; and vibration. The noise level in the work environment is low to moderate. Lincare is an equal opportunity employer, access and affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of race, color, religion, creed, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. Lincare provides reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. Because Lincare believes in providing a safe work environment, we conduct drug and background checks in our recruiting/hiring processes. AA/EOE, M/F/Disabled/Veterans

title: Data Analyst 3
desc: Data Analyst 3Support Analyst (Data) Responsibilities: * Properly identify client issues, log tickets, and close tickets with known fixes. * Maintain and consistently demonstrate knowledge of company guidelines, standard operating procedures, and practices. * Resolves Level 1 & 2 issues, and escalate complex and/ or high priority issues to the appropriate support groups for resolution * Work closely with other Analysts to help diagnose and solve issues as they come up. * Identify problematic areas and conduct research to determine the best course of action to correct the data * Analyze and problem solve issues with current and planned systems as they relate to the integration and management of patient data (for example, review for accuracy in record merge, unmerge processes) * Analyze reports of data duplicates or other errors to provide ongoing appropriate inter-departmental communication and monthly or daily data reports (for example, related to the EMPI) * Monitor for timely and accurate completion of select data elements (for example, verbal physician orders) * Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets * In collaboration with others, develop and implement data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality * In collaboration with others, interpret data and develop recommendations based on findings * Create and present quality dashboards Knowledge/Skills * Technical expertise regarding data models and database design development. Ability to perform data profiling using SQL or similar tools/languages * Proficient in MS Word, Excel, Access, and PowerPoint, Sharepoint, JIRA. * Experience using SAS, SPSS, or other statistical packages is desirable for analyzing large datasets * Programming skills preferred. Adept at queries and report writing. * Knowledge of statistics, at least to the degree necessary in order to communicate easily with statisticians * Experience in data mining techniques and procedures and knowing when their use is appropriate * Ability to present complex information in an understandable and compelling manner Preferred Qualifications: * Bachelor's in Information Management, Healthcare Information, Computing, Mathematics, Statistics, or related fields * Healthcare background or experience * Previous data analyst experience To be considered for this position, you must have: BA/BS in Business, Economics, Math or related discipline 5-7 years professional experience. Strong technical skills with Microsoft Excel including Visual Basic; ability to manipulate, merge and report from large data sets and platforms.Interested candidates please send resume in Word format to [Click Here to Email Your Resumé] Please reference job code 46062 when responding to this ad.GDH Consulting, Inc. provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, veteran's status or any other category protected by law. In addition to federal law requirements, GDH Consulting, Inc. complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities and/or employees. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, benefits and training.

title: APPLIED STATISTICIAN
desc:
Role: Applied statistician 
Location: Creve Coeur, MO 63141 Duration : 12+Months  Job Description:  The contract statistician will provide statistical support to the Grower Insights team on the assessment of environments and agronomic practices (e.g., row spacing, density, planter types) critical to the assessment of our products’ success in the marketplace. The candidate will actively collaborate with clients to design field experiments to test various farming practices and communicate findings to broad audiences.  Required qualification/experience/skills:  1) Master’s or PhD degree required with emphasis in Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering or Computation Biology  2) Working knowledge of basic statistical modeling approaches (ANOVA, regression, classification, sample size calculations) and machine learning techniques(2-5 Years). 3) Strong programming experience in R or Pyton. 4) Experience presenting with PowerPoint  5) Good communication skills  Must Have:
Candidates need to have strong analytic background covering any one of the following areas: experimental design, machine learning, geospatial statistics [NOT simply a user of ArcGIS, a model developer]   Desired qualification/experience/skills:  1) Experience with SAS/SPSS/Matlab  2) Familiarity with farming equipment, e.g., planters and combines.

title: Data Analyst
desc:
Our client is currently seeking a Data Analyst No C2C or 1099
Support Analyst (Data)

Responsibilities:

•Properly identify client issues, log tickets, and close tickets with known fixes.
•Maintain and consistently demonstrate knowledge of company guidelines, standard operating procedures, and practices.
•Resolves Level 1 & 2 issues, and escalate complex and/ or high priority issues to the appropriate support groups for resolution
•Work closely with other Analysts to help diagnose and solve issues as they come up.
•Identify problematic areas and conduct research to determine the best course of action to correct the data
•Analyze and problem solve issues with current and planned systems as they relate to the integration and management of patient data (for example, review for accuracy in record merge, unmerge processes)
•Analyze reports of data duplicates or other errors to provide ongoing appropriate inter-departmental communication and monthly or daily data reports (for example, related to the EMPI)
•Monitor for timely and accurate completion of select data elements (for example, verbal physician orders)
•Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
•In collaboration with others, develop and implement data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality
•In collaboration with others, interpret data and develop recommendations based on findings
•Create and present quality dashboards


Knowledge/Skills
•Technical expertise regarding data models and database design development. 
Ability to perform data profiling using SQL or similar tools/languages
•Proficient in MS Word, Excel, Access, and PowerPoint, Sharepoint, JIRA.
•Experience using SAS, SPSS, or other statistical packages is desirable for analyzing large datasets
•Programming skills preferred. Adept at queries and report writing.
•Knowledge of statistics, at least to the degree necessary in order to communicate easily with statisticians
•Experience in data mining techniques and procedures and knowing when their use is appropriate
•Ability to present complex information in an understandable and compelling manner

Preferred Qualifications:
•Bachelor's in Information Management, Healthcare Information, Computing, Mathematics, Statistics, or related fields
•Healthcare background or experience
•Previous data analyst experience
To be considered for this position, you must have: BA/BS in Business, Economics, Math or related discipline 5-7 years professional experience. 
Strong technical skills with Microsoft Excel including Visual Basic; ability to manipulate, merge and report from large data sets and platforms.

title: Senior BI Developer/Analyst - SOA Product
desc:
*This is a remote position that requires working from a home office; candidates may be located anywhere in the US. The Senior BI Developer/Analyst - SOA Product is responsible for leading the successful delivery of business intelligence information to the entire organization. The Sr. BI Developer/Analyst - SOA Product is experienced in BI development and implementation, data architecture, ETL layers, performance tuning and data delivery and interpretation. Emphasizing effective collaboration with key stakeholders, the Sr. BI Developer/Analyst - SOA Product is responsible for the assessment of business requirements, collection and identification of technical specifications, and the subsequent development of technology solutions. The Sr. BI Developer/Analyst - SOA Product works to develop an integrated view of the BI team using a repeatable approach, cohesive framework, and industry standards with an emphasis on MicroStrategy and Pentaho Data Integration as core development tools. The Sr. BI Developer/Analyst - SOA Product has deep theoretical and practical knowledge of the Systems Development Life Cycle (SDLC) activities specific to data integration and analytics. The Sr. BI Developer/Analyst - SOA Product is expected to apply independent judgement and initiative in carrying out assigned tasks and will function as a lead and mentor to a team of developers. In addition, the Sr. BI Developer/Analyst - SOA Product works collaboratively with other analysis and development teams to create standards and best practices for BI solutions.Job Summary:Design architecture, and development, including: BI, database, ETL, application, and system
Gather and document business and system requirements
Analyze requirements to design and develop optimal BPM and BI solutions
Provide training and consulting for various technical and non-technical internal teams
Produce work breakdowns and task estimates (scoping and tracking activities)
Produce and document standard and best practices
Provide level 3 support for production systems
Oversee junior and mid-level staff
Perform other duties as assigned by management
Essential Job DutiesBachelor's degree from an accredited college or university required: Preferably in the fields of Computer Science, Engineering, Management Information Systems, Mathematics, Statistics, or another related field. Equivalent years of experience considered in lieu of degree
Master's degree preferred
8+ years of related technical experience required
5+ years of experience in database development and tools such as data mining, OLAP, ETL, data modeling, complex SQL queries, performance tuning, and Oracle 11g+ PL/SQL database development (DDL, DML, stored procedures, etc.) required
3+ years experience in designing BI solutions, preferably in the healthcare industry
2+ years experience in reporting or MicroStrategy, and application presentation layer experience
Expert database skills including complex SQL queries, performance tuning, and Oracle 11g+ PL/SQL database development (DDL, DML, stored procedures, etc.)
Proven track record of successfully delivering BI and/or data warehousing projects
Strong relationship management skills with the ability to interface effective with all organizational levels: users, team members, and management
Flexible and willing to undertake a wide variety of challenging tasks
Ability to apply architectural principles to business solutions
Extensive experience using planning and deploying either Business or IT initiatives (preference for both)
Experience using high level language/framework (e.g. J2EE, .NET, etc.) to develop solutions
Strong skills in design and implementation of logical and physical data models (including OLTP, Star, and Snowflake schema's), with knowledge of best practices
Excellent development and testing skills (including test planning and execution)
Ability to produce high quality documentation of business and system requirements, system design, data architecture, and training materials

title: JANSSEN PMO CO-OP - NJ
desc:
Please Note: When submitting your application, please indicate which of the 3 positions you are applying for at the top of your Resume. Janssen Research & Development, L.L.C., a member of the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies, is recruiting for total 3 Co-op full-time (40 hours / week) positions in Project Management Organization for the duration of approximately 6 months. Janssen Research & Development, L.L.C. develops treatments that improve the health and lifestyles of people worldwide. Research and development areas encompass novel targets in immunologic and pulmonary disorders, neurologic disorders, gastroenterology, oncology, hematology, infectious diseases, and metabolic disorders. Co-op, PMO: Integrated Solutions (1 position) The position will be based in Titusville, NJ with up to 20% travel to Raritan, NJ. As part of the Neuroscience group, the Integrated Solutions and Informatics Team (NS IS/IX) collaborates with internal and external experts to identify and develop solutions that go beyond the "pill" to improve patient outcomes, shifting from a "diagnose and treat" to a predict-and-pre-empt approach by identifying data-driven, science-based solutions that augment therapies. Those "solutions" include potential tools, technologies, services, data, devices, and diagnostics that could help solve unmet needs in various neurological diseases and disorders. Assist the Project/Portfolio Management Leader to provide support for NS IS/IX objectives; for example, generate and manage project/portfolio documents, develop/enhance/manage communications tools such as OneNote and SharePoint, drive periodic updates, organize meetings, participate in portfolio finance reviews and follow-ups, participate in team discussions on strategy, planning, execution and tracking, partner with team members and stakeholders to achieve defined imperatives Provide "just-in-time" support for specific deliverables in need within NS IS/IX under the supervision of the Team Leader and Project/Portfolio Management Leader 
Contribute to the success of the PMO in achieving its goals & objectives and help to drive process improvements across the programs throughinnovative ideas and state-of-the-art technologies
 Candidate should have excellentorganizational skills, be able to take limited direction and work independently, have good communication skills, and have a good working knowledge of the IT environment. Candidate should also possess proficient skills in PowerPoint, Excel, Microsoft Project and Word. Co-op, PMO: Capacity Management (1 positions) The position will be based in Raritan, NJ with occasional travel to the Titusville, NJ site. It is preferable that the candidate live within 20 miles of either site. The Capacity Management team, part of the Project Management Office (PMO) is responsible for planning and managing at a portfolio, therapeutic area and project level, the resources required for Research and Development projects. Capacity Management is a key component of the Continuous Forecast, Business Planning and Long Range Financial Planning process. Capacity Management works with the Functional Areas and Therapeutic Area, to forecast, plan and manage resource demand and supply, across the whole Janssen Pharmaceutical R&D organization. Providing support to the entire Capacity Management organization for data mining, data analytics and summarization Providing support to the Capacity Management and Portfolio Analytics lead in support of Portfolio Level monthly continuous forecast process, data visualization and operational metrics With provided guidance, analysis of historical data for benchmarking and operational performance With provided guidance, analysis of R&D milestone and impact on demand/supply Providing support to the Capacity Management organization in support of the business processes (Long Range Financial Plan, Final Business Plan, etc.) Co-op, PMO: Portfolio Management (1 positions) Will be based in Raritan, NJ with occasional travel to the Titusville, NJ site. It is preferable that the candidate live within 20 miles of either siteThe PortfolioManagement team is responsible for highly visible internal and external reporting, analysis and decision making. The key stakeholders of the team are R&D Senior Leadership, Operations Management Committee, Global Development Organization, Strategy & Portfolio Management (SPM) and Therapeutic Area Senior Leadership Teams. The Portfolio Group integrates information and insights across R&D functions and therapeutic areas to assist leadership in key business processes such as strategic and business planning and portfolio prioritization. The team works with key partners in Finance and Strategy and Portfolio Analysis (SPA) to drive and provide crucial alignment in a heavily matrixed organization. PrimaryDuties of the PMO Co-op in Portfolio Management Team include supporting business critical activities such as: R&D Tracker, Strategic Imperatives and R&D Benchmarking. The co-op will be accountable to learn the R&D processes necessary to understand the business and provide support as well as be proactive in developing new/enhanced ideas/methodology/analyses for crucial business insights. This is a full time position, and the student may not be enrolled in more than one class while employed as an active, full time J&J Co-Op. Pay: Hourly Housing/relocation: No relocation, housing available for rentSpecial Application Instructions:Applicants must have work authorization or be US citizen QualificationsCo-op, PMO: Integrated Solutions (1 position) By June/July 2017, the candidate must have completed a minimum of 2 years of undergraduate education at an accredited university working towards a BS, or enrolled in graduate program in life sciences, computer science, engineering, business/economics, or mathematics. Excellent interpersonal skills, ability to work independently and technical competency are required. This position requires someone who is creative and can manage organizing data in a way to communicate insights to leaders. Previous work experience highly desired. Co-op, PMO: Capacity Management (1 positions) A minimum of 3 or 4 year undergrad (Junior/Senior) is required. Preferred areas of study: computer science/IT, business, accounting, finance, process/math related, statistics, biology, chemistry, pharmacy or engineering. Excellent analytical, presentation and data mining and visualization skills required. Must have the ability to be an independent thinker and self-starter. Previous Co-op experience working within a global project management or portfolio management organization is preferred, but not required. Co-op, PMO: Portfolio Management (1 positions) A minimum of 3 or 4 year undergrad (Junior/Senior) is required. Preferred areas of study: computer science/IT, business, accounting, finance, process/math related, statistics, biology, chemistry, pharmacy or engineering. Excellent interpersonal skills, mastery of MS Excel and PowerPoint applications and the ability to work independently are required. This position requires someone who is innovative and has past experience in creating processes, data management/organizing data in a way to communicate results to senior leaders. Previous Co-op experience working within a global project management or portfolio management organization is preferred, but not required. SharePoint knowledge is a plus. Primary LocationUnited States-New Jersey-Raritan Other LocationsNorth America-United States-New Jersey-Titusville OrganizationJanssen Research & Development, LLC. title: Biostatistician III
desc:
Biostatistician IIIDenver, CO Direct Hire    To apply for this position send resumes to: [Click Here to Email Your Resumé]    Company Profile: Serves the hospital/clinical, state agencies and pharmaceutical companies  
Established for over 50 years 
Serves over 11M customers in industries such as: hospital/clinical, state agencies and pharmaceutical 
One of the largest regional poison centers in the U.S. 
What This Company Offers You: One of the most competitive benefit packages in Denver, CO  
Medical/Dental Programs  
Health Insurance, long-term and short-term disability 
Vacation and paid holidays  
401k  
The Role You Will Play: Biostatistician III Provides information to principal investigator(s) and management. This position does not perform any direct bench or clinical (patient) research 
Develops error checking programs to ensure data and data analysis is reproducible, reliable, and valid 
Compiles analysis ready datasets from multiple sources of raw data 
Creates basic and intermediate tables, figures, and listings reports summarizing data and analysis 
Performs quantitative data analysis according to statistical analysis plans/protocols using SAS and R statistical packages 
Contributes to abstracts, posters, and presentations for scientific meetings 
Performs advanced statistical analysis 
Promotes positive interpersonal (customer) relationships with fellow employees, physicians, patients and visitors 
Treats these individuals with courtesy, dignity, empathy and respect; consistently displays courteous and respectful verbal and non-verbal communications 
Adheres to, complies with and demonstrates support for the mission and values of Denver Health. Supports and adheres to the Denver Health Values of Trust, Respect, & Excellence and the Standards of Behavior 
Ensures confidentiality of patient information by creating and maintaining a secure and trusting environment 
Adheres to Denver Health and departmental attendance guidelines 
Performs others duties as assigned 
  Community: Denver, CO.   Denver is the commercial, financial, industrial, and government center for Colorado 
The unemployment rate in Denver is  3.80 percent 
Recent job growth is positive. Denver jobs have increased by 1.84 percent
  Background Profile: Biostatistician III PhD in Biostatistics/Statistics OR 2+ years’  experience with a Master’s Degree in Biostatistics/Statistics 
Pharmaceutical experience preferred not required  
Proficient in Microsoft Word and Excel. 
SAS Certification a plus. All Certifications and Licenses required for this job must be kept current as a condition of continued employment 
Proficiency in SAS and R 
Ability to programmatically restructure databases to facilitate analysis

title: Customer & Digital Analytics
desc:
SUMMARYThe Customer & Digital Analytics Analyst is responsible for analyzing and interpreting digital data from different sources, identifying opportunities and key customer trends to ensure digital campaigns and website success by utilizing Google Analytics and other analytics tools. The incumbent will have a strong understanding of research methodologies and be able to transfer data into actionable, well-written documents and presentations. He/she will use website traffic, registration and other data to provide insight and answer key business questions. The data and insights created in this role help to develop products and campaigns, optimize site usage and navigation, and increase knowledge audiences.ESSENTIAL DUTIES: 20%Analyze Web KPMs including visitors, pages, time, bounce rates, spread and sourcesIdentify areas of improvement within the digital campaigns and marketing delivery methods while automating KPM data extraction and joining20%Derive key actionable insights and be able to deliver reports to senior management20%Partner with data scientists to use key metrics as inputs to advanced analytical models 20%Assist in the development of single view of the customer profiles and contribute to creating a holistic understanding of the business environmentBased Competencies are to be designated based on job level and content.  Adaptability
Building Strategic Working Relationships
Technical/Professional Knowledge & Skills
Stress Tolerance
Decision Making
Communication
Technical knowledge/skills (entry, intermediate, advanced)Database skills (SQL) a very big plus
Data visualization skills using Tableau also a very big plus
Education/Experience:A Bachelor’s Degree in a quantitative field of Business (i.e., economics, marketing), Computer Sciences or an applied quantitative field (i.e., math, statistics).
Four or more years prior work experience in Digital Media Analytics.
Experience designing and implementing A/B or MVT tests (platform agnostic).
Strong understanding of fundamental concepts in probability and statistics, such as confidence intervals, hypothesis testing, etc.
Experience with web analytics tools (i.e., Site Catalyst, Google Analytics, Core Metrics, etc.).
Experience applying analytics tagging (i.e.: Omniture, Campaign tags/IDs, etc.) and validating accuracy.

title: Compensation Analyst
desc:
New Jersey Resources is seeking a Compensation Analyst responsible for providing analytical and administrative support to the compensation area.  
 
Major Responsibilities 
 • Assist with year-end salary administration process, including compensation calendar, communications, spreadsheet updates and strategy report processing and verification. 
 • Support Leadership Development and Compensation Committee book preparation. 
 • Responsible for preparation of annual personnel information; taxable vehicles, salary and incentive budgets, spreadsheet and reports.  
 • Maintain monthly reconciliation and distribution of the Employee Statistics Report.  
 • Process annual complement adjustments and balance budgeted positions against financial records. 
 • Responsible for the communication and administration of the Employee-Owned Taxable Vehicle Program; including annual renewal analysis.  
 • Assist with year-end Success Factors compensation module and provide backup to the Manager of Compensation for system inquiries and assistance. 
 • Monitor and maintain position descriptions and track associated updates for S&P and GO employees; communicate with business units for current position descriptions and coordinate with PayFactors for necessary updates to job description module.  
 • Prepare benchmarking analysis of job descriptions against external market and internal data for review by the Manager of Compensation.  
 • Review job requisitions in Dayforce against employee statistics for complement and budget approval.  
 • Gather data and complete annual compensation and quarterly Department of Labor surveys.  
 • Generate reports or spreadsheets for completion of annual surveys and analysis of results.  
 • Coordinate, process and maintain recommendations and records for the Recognition Champion Award Program.  
 • Develop and conduct compensation-related training as needed. 
 • Provide administrative backup to the Manager of Compensation and handle special projects as needed. 
  
New Jersey Resources is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, gender identity and/or expression, national origin, disability, veteran, or other protected status.


Education and Experience 
 
Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources (HR) Management or a related field preferred. Professional in HR or Senior Professional in HR certification a plus. At least two years of HR experience preferred. Must have good time management skills and the ability to work independently, as well as with a team. Strong work ethic, attention to detail and confidentiality are critical. Good analytical, financial, communication, organizational and interpersonal skills required. Proven ability to handle multiple assignments and understanding of HR processes and data is essential. Excellent computer skills and proficiency with Excel, PowerPoint, Strategy and other Microsoft and desktop applications required. Experience with Ceridian Dayforce and Success Factors a plus.

title: Director, Market Research
desc: Reporting to the Senior Director of Research and Strategy, the Director of Market Research will be a knowledgeable, savvy and influential marking insights professional who can help drive Temple University's research strategy. The Director will be responsible for managing the planning, design and execution of market research projects (quantitative and qualitative) from development of research objectives to methodology and presentation of final recommendations in support of the key university marketing strategies and programs. The Director will manage and provide research and support to various teams within Strategic Marketing and Communications, as well as selected colleges and departments- overseeing the collection and analysis of relevant market data and presenting solution-oriented recommendations that will enhances the marketing decisions of the organization. The Director will provide leadership and expertise in higher education marketing as well as monitor trends, competitive practices, and newly developing processes within research industry to develop a leading-edge higher education marketing research organization. Performs other duties as assigned. Required Education & Experience:Bachelor's degree in market research, marketing, communications, statistics, business administration, or a related field. At least five (5) years of directly related experience leading marketing research initiatives and conducting statistical research and analysis (both quantitative and qualitative). Experience in higher education. An equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered. Required Skills & Abilities:* Demonstrated ability to lead the building & development of a best in class centralized market insights that drive business results. * Knowledge of scoping targeted market research initiatives that forecast market trends and inform/influence regional strategic plans.* Demonstrated ability to manage and supervise a team, and proven skills of leadership and the ability to coach and mentor motivate subordinates.* Ability to develop strategic partnerships with key internal stakeholders.* Demonstrated knowledge of benchmarking of market insights programs and processes.* Exceptional verbal and written communication skills.* Knowledge of MS Office products.Preferred:* Experience managing teams with proven skills of leadership and the ability to mentor motivate subordinates. *** Incumbent may need to obtain IRB approval ***Compliance Statement: In the performance of their functions as detailed in the position description employees have an obligation to avoid ethical, legal, financial and other conflicts of interest to ensure that their actions and outside activities do not conflict with their primary employment responsibilities at the institution. Employees are also expected to understand and be in compliance with applicable laws, University and. employment policies and regulations, including NCAA regulations for areas and departments which their essential functions cause them to interact. To obtain additional information about Temple University please visit our website at www.temple.edu.  Temple University's Annual Security and Fire Safety Report contains statistics, policies, and procedures related to campus safety and can be found at: www.temple.edu/safety/asfr/  You may request a copy of the report by calling Temple University's Campus Safety Services at 215-204-7900.

title: Computational Scientist
desc: Janssen Research & Development, L.L.C., a division of Johnson & Johnson's Family of Companies is recruiting for an Scientist, located in Spring House, PA. At the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, what matters most is helping people live full and healthy lives. We focus on treating, curing and preventing some of the most devastating and complex diseases of our time. And we pursue the most promising science, wherever it might be found. Janssen Research & Development, LLC discovers and develops innovative medical solutions to address important unmet medical needs in oncology, immunology, neuroscience, infectious diseases and vaccines, and cardiovascular and metabolic diseases. Please visit www.janssenrnd.com/ for more information. We are Janssen. Our mission drives us. Our patients inspire us. We collaborate with the world for the health of everyone in it. Thriving on a diverse company culture, celebrating the uniqueness of our employees and committed to inclusion. Proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are seeking a highly motivated and innovative computational scientist to join the inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) team within Immunology Biomarkers. Our team focuses on biomarker identification, development, and application. We use proteomic, genomic, microbiome, and transcriptomic approaches on clinical trial samples to support current and future clinical trial patient stratification. As a Scientist, you will have the opportunity to develop novel computational tools and communicate findings to the broader team. You will also manage and establish collaborations with key external partners such as research groups in academia, biotech, or contracted research organizations. The successful candidate will be able to work effectively in a highly dynamic environment and interact comfortably with scientists from Immunology Biomarkers, Immunology Discovery, Clinical Development, Janssen Human Microbiome Institute, Medical Affairs, and Commercial teams. Responsibilities include but are not limited to the following: Develop/Evaluate and implement bioinformatics tools Analyze internal and external -omic data sets to develop and discover novel biomarkers Collaborate across the Janssen therapeutic areas when appropriate Maintain scientific advancement, emerging approaches and innovations in the NGS analysis fields QualificationsPhD in Bioinformatics or similar discipline with expertise in Computational Biology, Immunology, Statistics, and Network Pharmacology / Systems Biology OR a MS in Bioinformatics or similar discipline with expertise in Computational Biology, Immunology, Statistics, and Network Pharmacology / Systems Biology and at least 3 years of experience in academic or industry setting is required Previous experience with microbiome data and microbiome-related software (e.g. QIIME, Biobakery) is preferred Experience with high content data analysis, such RNAseq, and proteomic data is required Proficiency in standard analytical platforms (e.g. R, Bioconductor, Matlab) and programming (e.g. Python, C++) are required Expertise in data QC is required as the individual will closely interface with lab personnel to ensure efficient flow of data and understanding of experiments to maximize efficiency Experience with Gene Set Enrichment and pathway analysis software tools (e.g. GSEA/GSVA, Thomson-Reuters GeneGo, Ingenuity, Cytoscape) is preferred Experience in the integration of omics datasets and expertise in predictive algorithms, biomarker discovery and/or diagnostic development is preferred Primary Location United States-Pennsylvania-Spring House Organization Janssen Research & Development, LLC. (6084) Job Function Clinical Research non-MD Requisition ID1819171003

title: Process Specialist
desc:
SUMMARYThe Process Specialist will manage many of the plant systems responsible for plant Quality activities to assure that roofing products meet or exceed customer requirements and specifications and maintain the GAF Quality Program.  Additionally, this role is critical in driving product and process improvement initiatives and customer satisfaction.  This individual must be a self-starter and capable of working without direct (day to day) supervision. Specific responsibilities include, but are not limited to:Supports behavioral-based safety activities and maintains a safe, neat work area at all times.
Managing and sustaining local plant quality systems in a compliant manner with GAF’s policies and practices and maintaining/continuous development of a Quality System.
Analyzing data to determine root cause variables and drive the appropriate control methodology into operations.
Knowledge and use of process capability measures, trend charting, histograms, parato charts, defect statistics, recommending and supporting overall process improvement initiatives.
Develop skills and knowledge to conduct effective quality audits and report, track and implement necessary corrective actions and recommendations as identified during the audit. 
Coordinates activities and projects primarily associated with Quality & Process Improvement initiatives.
Coordinates targeted activities and objectives relating to the continued development of company quality systems and best practices to include plant audits.
Develops new and / or revised test methods and conducts measurement capability studies.
Supports lab evaluations of product modifications / improvements.
Assembles, operates, maintains and calibrates test equipment in accordance with written procedures.
Capable of analyzing data to determine root cause variables and drive the appropriate control methodology.
Ability to report results, both compliant and non-compliant, to plant personnel, management, and customers.
Have a good working knowledge of basic bench top laboratory equipment and functionality.
Ability to influence others, especially those operations personnel who operate under the domain of quality control.
Coordinate the activities of those involved in inspecting materials and ensuring they meet the quality standards specified by the company.
ESSENTIAL DUTIESFacilitate compliance, and train as needed, all aspects of manufactured product quality testing and process control as defined by the Quality Manuals for existing and new employees. (10%) 
Review, develop and implement both local and corporate quality procedures and policies in support of the Quality System (15%)
Maintain databases for laboratory test results and manufacturing processing parameters. Review and recording of daily test results to ensure product meets required manufacturing specifications.  (5%)
Prepare and submit quality reports and statistical process charts to management on a weekly, and monthly and quarterly basis providing any needed process changes or recommendations based on a statistical analysis the data or processes. (10%)
Calibrate testing tools and instruments used in manufacture of shingles including sieves, scales, viscometers, mettlers and other on a regular basis.  Maintain and use calibrated standards to measure the accuracy of test equipment. (3%)
Assist with quantitative reviews, reporting and recommendations for new product development, processing equipment, raw materials analysis, and testing equipment. Working with cross functional teams to meet objectives (15%) 
Lead and develop Process Improvement Teams to drive TQM practices into the operations for continuous process/product improvements which enhance product performance while reducing costs. (7%)
Conduct internal quality audits and procedure reviews. Prepare reports, review and recommend correction and preventative action plans.  Issue recommendations and implement/complete action plans to address opportunities. (7%)
Coordinate day to day activities of technical staff to ensure all required codes and GAF specifications are evaluated and met. (12%)
Monitor the red tag and RMA process confirming that all rework is completed in a timely and accurate manner.  (5%)
Routine preparation of customer standards for Central Quality Control.  (1%)

Travel will be required for continuous educational training, management and departmental meetings, and cross functional auditing.  (7.5%)

Building Strategic Working Relationships
Technical/Professional Knowledge & Skills
Stress Tolerance
Decision Making
Communication
Planning & Organizing
Technical knowledge/skills (entry, intermediate, advanced)Intermediate Microsoft Office skills
Entry to intermediate Statistical skills
Familiarity with standard Quality tools and practices
Entry to Intermediate laboratory and analytical skills
Preferred basic knowledge of Process / Continuous Improvement techniques including: auditing, Statistical Process Control, variation reduction, and Root Cause Analysis

Strong attention to detail

title: Data Scientist
desc:
Job description
                    
BuzzFeed is looking for extraordinary data scientists to join its New York and Los Angeles offices. We’re seeking passionate professionals who have a proven track record using data in a meaningful way - whether building product or supporting decisions. The right candidate balances technical expertise, domain knowledge and a capacity to be deeply inquisitive.
BuzzFeed’s data science team is diverse, coming from varying backgrounds, experiences, and skill sets. The team uses data-driven methods to power decisions, inform strategy, build robust data products, and identify opportunities for innovation across the company. We are true hybrids - software engineers, statisticians, mathematicians, domain experts and analysts - who specialize in translating questions into methodical approaches, experiments, and products. We think deeply about the limitations of data, and communicate our output coherently.
Responsibilities
Collect, interpret, and disseminate data to allow for rapid product and content experimentation.
Build learning loops in which user experiences generate insights used to drive growth and engagement across different platforms.
Develop and foster services that will use data to create personalized and optimized experiences.
Develop KPIs and measures of success in a cross-platform world.
Support development of data tools, such as dashboards and A/B testing platforms.
Communicate complex ideas in a clear, precise, yet accessible way to product, engineering, and editorial teams.
Requirements
5+ years of industry experience, working on data-related initiatives.
Experience in applying Machine Learning, Predictive Analytics, and Classification techniques towards real product and business problems.
Proficiency with the Python programming language.
Experience with social data or media is a plus.
About BuzzFeed
BuzzFeed is the leading independent digital media and tech company delivering news and entertainment content to a global audience. We have offices in 19 cities around the world and more than 1500 employees including reporters, video producers, data scientists, engineers, brand strategists, and more. We infuse hard work and fun though a culture of experimentation, collaboration, equality and humble confidence. As an employee, you’ll enjoy perks like office events, snacks, career development courses, and no work on your birthday! But most importantly, you’ll work with inspiring colleagues to build tools and create content that helps connect people all over the world.

title: Senior Principal Data Scientist
desc:
Job description
                    
Key Responsibilities / Duties: 
You like Big Data, and you cannot lie. This is essential because you will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing Big Data platforms using Cloud architecture with structured and unstructured data sources. You will be our proverbial data Zen garden — you’ll be responsible for bringing clarity to the chaos.
You can bring the complex algorithms your dreams are made of and make them a reality, and you can easily analyze and translate the complex models and algorithms of others’ dreams.
Perform machine learning and statistical analysis methods, such as classification, collaborative filtering, association rules, sentiment analysis, topic modeling, time-series analysis, regression, statistical inference, and validation methods
Analyze and model structured data using advanced statistical methods and implement algorithms and software needed to perform analyses
Build recommendation engines, sentiment analyzers and classifiers for unstructured and semi-structured data
Perform explanatory data analysis, generate and test working hypotheses, prepare and analyze historical data to identify patterns
Design rich data visualizations to communicate complex ideas to customers or company leaders
Utilize state-of-the-art methods for data mining
Extend IVZ data with third party sources of information, as required
Process, cleanse, and verify the integrity of data used for analysis
Perform ad-hoc analysis and present results in a clear manner
Qualifications

WORK EXPERIENCE / KNOWLEDGE: 
10 to 15 years professional experience
7+ years of experience with top-tier firms in big data analytics, management consulting, or comparable role in corporate setting
4+ years of experience with machine learning
5+ years of experience with SQL
4+ years in financial services preferred
Excellent understanding of machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, etc.
Good applied statistics skills, such as distributions, statistical testing, regression, etc.
Extensive predictive analytics experience with Python
In-depth knowledge of statistical software packages (e.g. SAS and R)
Experience with data visualization tools
Experience with big data technologies such as Hadoop, R, and Java / MapReduce
Experience with NoSQL databases, such as MongoDB, Cassandra, HBase, DynamoDB 
Experience with data and machine learning services using Azure, Amazon Web Services (AWS), and / or Google Cloud
Familiar with Agile software development (Scrum is a plus)
DevOps knowledge is a plus

title: Data Science Engineer
desc:
Job description
                    
Jobvite - Requisitions - Details           
        
        
     






Managing the internet service for customers flying on thousands of flights around the globe every day requires a lot of moving pieces, and the way we manage data in this environment is a hugely critical piece of the puzzle.  
Gogo has spent the last several years modernizing its software development and is in the final stages of moving its stack to the cloud. We have embraced DevOps and developer empowerment with single click deployments to production. We’re now embarking on our new phase of development with our move to more event driven designs and systems enabling us to have a data driven mindset. 
To help with this transition. We're looking for skilled data engineers who have broad experience and a passion for modern data systems. We are moving away from simply knowing what happened, to being able to predict what is going to happen next. This role will play a critical role in defining anomaly detection algorithms across our organization.
This role will join in our ever-growing data team and help drive and build these data initiatives within Gogo. The engineer will help us set and execute our data engineering strategy and development. 
Basic Qualifications  
Bachelor's degree in Information Science / Information Technology, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, or a related field
Strong developer background with passion for data systems
Experience in one or more languages such as Java, Python, R, and Scala
2+ years with one or more big data streaming technologies such as Spark Streaming or Kinesis
Understanding of statistical analysis on streaming systems
Spark ML is a big plus
Understanding of telecom systems and networks and their events is a plus
Preferred Qualifications 
2 or more years of experience developing data based software solutions.
Gogo’s worldwide inflight Wi-Fi services have made internet and video entertainment a regular part of flying. We are a diverse group of technologists, marketers, strategists, and any other function you can think of- all working together in extraordinary harmony. And that’s just the beginning.
We connect the aviation industry and its travelers with innovative technology and applications, and we do it all in a high-energy environment that welcomes the next challenge. Be prepared for a dynamic ride with people who are passionate about what they’re building. Gogo is an equal opportunity employer and works in compliance with both federal and state laws. We are committed to the concept regarding Equal Employment opportunity. Qualified candidates will be considered for employment regardless of race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, marital status, medical condition or disability.  The EEO is the law and is available here.Gogo participates in E-Verify. Details in English and Spanish. Right to Work Statement in English and Spanish.

title: Data Scientist
desc:
Job description
                    
Summary
The Data Scientist is a critical thinker who will engage with senior leaders to design well-constructed analyses derived from large datasets. The Data Scientist will work cross-functionally with product managers and engineers to deliver actionable results and should be comfortable working with Agile, cross-functional teams and eager to be a strategic partner in analytics assignments.
Responsibilities
Work with our Product, Engineering, Marketing, and Finance teams to answer complex questions about users, advertisers, and revenue
Test hypotheses, create reports, handle open tickets and contribute to shared backlog using Jira
Collaborate with developers, program managers, and product managers in an open, Agile environment
Geek out on large datasets and generate insights from which business value can be ascertained
Write queries in ANSI and Postgres SQL
Requirements
A passion for problem-solving and comfort with ambiguity
3+ years of experience using quantitative data analysis to solve business problems
Strong understanding of the principles and tools of statistics and machine learning
Strong experience with statistical programming languages (R, Python)
Strong experience building data visualizations, dashboards, and data representations
Experience building real-time data pipelines within high volume data environments

Strong communication skills with the ability to communicate effectively across all levels of the organization

Experience with data product deployment and A/B testing
Experience with modern Apache data stack such as Kafka, Spark, Flink and Beam

401(k)
Catered daily lunch
