title: Portfolio Performance and Data Strategist
desc:
Job description
                    
We are looking for Portfolio Performance and Data Strategist to be a key member of the Global Portfolio Services team.   This person will manage and provide insights into all data related projects including data migrations and integrations.  Additionally, will review portfolio performance data and provide opportunities for service improvements and insights that will help both our clients and executive stakeholders.  



Responsibilities



Account Management
Provide Tier2 support for client inquiries related to systems and data integration issues
Manage data assets and relationships ensuring we have 100% financial data coverage for our clients
Provide solutions for new data opportunities including new efficiencies
Work with key individuals to gain a deep understanding of their respective businesses, including their successes, struggles and goals
Compile information and collaborate with Product Director to provide analytics insights
Know each person’s role within the affiliate and proactively anticipate their questions and concerns
Clearly identify and address gaps and needs when it comes to how information is being consumed 
Analytics
Evaluate, ongoing, current solutions to ensure we are always improving
Work collaboratively with our Project Manager to gather requirements from users, ensuring the business need and goals for the information requested is always clear
Present proposals, mock-ups and findings for ad hoc analyses and data modeling projects
Develop tools like “what if” calculators to help users back test recommendations with different strategies along with other financial performance analytics
Ensure data integrity and compliance
Report Training
Develop and execute customized new user trainings, including materials, resources and documentation
Become an expert user of all Portfolio Performance analytics, as well as, the applications used for sourcing all data
Work side by side with mid-to-high level report users on how to read and apply the information in reporting
Project Support / Guidance
Gather requirements for new data (including migrations and integration) and reporting requests and have a deep understanding of how the client will use the information for marketing and internal performance ratings
Create report mock-ups based on the client’s request and requirements that can be translated into technical terms by a business analyst and developer
Act as the voice of our affiliates in regards to report and dashboard development so that the tools created meet the needs of our end users
Conduct user acceptance testing and input for new dashboards and development efforts
Lead demos of new features and tools and maintain a feedback loop for continuous improvement
Evaluate reporting UIs to improve user experience
Qualifications



Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
Passion for product quality, excellent user experience, and sales/adoption
Functional understanding of investment portfolio concepts preferred
Strong aptitude for being able to think strategically at both business and software level
Experience implementing UI/UX principles to improve system processes and interface
Driven
Communication skills including influencing and leading
Decision making
Critical thinking and problem solving
Negotiation and conflict management
Adaptable and nimble
Simple, direct, and effective
Always moving forward
Highly organized: ability to multi-task, prioritize and meet tight deadlines
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Excellent teamwork skills
Strong presentation skills
Requirements    
5+ years of experience in data integration and analytics
Experience and working knowledge in Global Financial and Investment Markets
Must have worked on a daily basis with a suite of reporting tools and data to solve business problems and support decisions
Marketing experience a plus
Proven ability to apply information strategically, spot larger trends and risks
Strong presentation and communication skills with the ability to summarize findings clearly and concisely
Expert user of MS Excel – logical functions, lookups, pivot tables, external source data, dynamic charts and tables
Excellent interpersonal skills, able to deal effectively with diverse skill sets and personalities and also work effectively as a team player
Self-motivated, proactive, disciplined, fast learner and organized with impeccable attention to detail
Experience working in a variety and range of BI solutions and tools
Experience working in a consultative user/client facing role
Experience with a range of statistical and data mining tools and techniques, market research, predictive modeling and customer segmentation
Exposure to data related to Google Analytics, ad networks and other industry related API feeds of data
Highly flexible and adaptive to a rapidly changing environment and juggling of competing priorities
U.S. citizenship or authorization to work legally in the U.S.
About Publishing Services
Publishing Services not only provides the platforms and systems that support more than 20 of the world’s leading privately owned media companies, but our passion and progressive ingenuity has helped shape and strengthen the industry at large. We build and support the enterprise applications used by entrepreneurial businesses to help them become highly profitable, and ultimately position them as frontrunners. From Analysis & Discovery to Prototype, Design & Development, from Information & Payment Processing to Order Fulfillment & Subscription Renewals, our expert teams strive to provide a fast-paced, flexible, and functional foundation for growth.
If you think you may belong at Publishing Services and could benefit from a deeper look inside of their office, be sure to check out their Workplace Highlight on WestWord. Read it here.

title: Systems Administrator Intermediate/Senior
company: University of Michigan, Office of University Development
desc:
Job description
                    
Starting salary may vary depending on qualifications and experience of the selected candidate.
This position may be filled at the Senior level ($66,923 to $95,700) or the Intermediate level ($55,385 to $79,200). Starting salary and position are dependent on qualifications and experience. The requirements listed below reflect the Senior level but those with lesser experience are also encouraged to apply.
The Systems Administrator Senior will support a highly-interactive research team in the Center for Statistical Genetics (CSG) at the University of Michigan School of Public Health. The group is involved in cutting edge genetics research, studying genetic variation in humans, with a focus on understanding how genetic variation contributes to the risk of complex disorders such as diabetes, heart disease, late-onset blindness and psychiatric illness.  The group participates in all aspects of the design and analysis of genetic studies, ranging from the development of interactive applications for enrolling and engaging study participants to the development, distribution, and maintenance of free software for the analysis of genetic data.
CSG builds and operates one of the largest dedicated, high-performance computing and storage environments at the University of Michigan in support of a worldwide network of researchers advancing the state of the art in genomics.
A cover letter is required for consideration for this position and should be attached as the first page of your resume. The cover letter should address your specific interest in the position and outline skills and experience that directly relate to this position.
Responsibilities:
Develop and implement security and use policies for Linux systems and cloud environments that include >10 PB of data and >4,000 compute cores.
Provide end-to-end administration and support for priority functions and services in a High Performance Computing / Big Data environment including storage, data transfer, batch queuing, deployment automation, networking, infrastructure and security.
Work to iteratively automate and refine processes for system administration and security monitoring.
Work to port key processes and infrastructure to commercial cloud environments.
Work as a team player in collaboration with systems experts in the group and across the University.
Work with scientists and developers to deploy and support widely used applications and analysis environments.
Create and maintain technical documentation pertaining to hardware, software and operational workflows in the IT environment.
Stay current with IT industry trends, new technologies and best practices.
Obtain and carry a public trust security clearance.
Assist with scheduled maintenance windows and participate in on-call rotation.
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, engineering or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
Minimum of five years of relevant experience in a related role displaying strong personal initiative, a drive for continuous improvement, demonstrated end-to-end responsibility for mission-critical services and excellent problem-solving skills.
Extensive proficiency in all domains of Linux systems administration.
Prior experience architecting and deploying production scale cloud applications and workflows on providers such as Google Compute Engine, Amazon Web Services, and Microsoft Azure.
Strong communications skills with the ability to convey technical concepts effectively such that various audiences receiving the communication can understand.
Experience managing a batch scheduled environment (e.g. Slurm, PBS, Torque, SGE).
Experience in the architecture, implementation and management of large-scale, high-performance storage and computing systems.
Proficient with revision control, scripting, configuration management and automated provisioning systems.
Desired Qualifications:
Existing U.S. government security clearance at public trust level or higher.
Prior experience in a FISMA-regulated environment.
Experience administering Web service and application components including HTTP servers, proxies and SQL/NoSQL database servers.
Proficiency in the principles of computer programming and at least one high-level language such as C/C++, Perl, Python, Go or Ruby.
Additional Information:
This position will require handling sensitive institutional data. Successful candidates must comply with federal, state, and local law, and/or university policies or agreements that require the university to implement specific privacy and security safeguards, including but not limited to HIPAA and FISMA.

title: Customer Data Platform Product Manager
desc:
Job description
                    
Are you a seasoned marketer with a demonstrated track record of powerfully leveraging data to acquire, retain and monetize customers? Do you love patterns and identifying what data-driven actions led up to a prospect taking that critical desired action?
In this key role as the Customer Data Platform Product Owner, you will be the lynch pin for guiding and supporting our 25+ publishing affiliates worldwide in the successfully implementing and using Lytics.
This is not a technical position. The ideal candidate must be able to work independently and have a strong presence with clients to use their skills and experience to maximize use of the tool. This senior level position reports to the VP of Marketing Intelligence with a dotted line to the COO of Agora.



Responsibilities



Lytics is a third party personalized marketing and customer data platform that we have recently brought on as an enterprise tool, and we are looking for a quarterback/champion who can:
Work with marketers within our publishing affiliates to onboard and acclimate to the tool.
Brainstorm and develop use cases for the strongest segments and promote and expose these across the entire user community.
Be the liaison with our dedicated Lytics Customer Success Team to ensure cohesive and productive workflow.
Captain projects and work with resources across centralized teams like Marketing Intelligence, Publishing Services, AIM, Threefold to prioritize and push forward the most worthwhile initiatives and efforts.
Qualifications



5+ years of experience as a hands-on direct marketer, business analyst or comparable role.
Must have worked on a daily basis in a data-driven analytical role to solve business problems and support decisions.
Deep, hands-on understanding of direct marketing analysis, campaign management, program optimization, customer segmentation and targeting and retention/attrition analysis.
Proven ability to apply information strategically, spot larger trends and risks and also break it down for marketers needing to make tactical decisions.
Strong presentation and communication skills with the ability to summarize findings clearly and concisely.
Strong sense of urgency, follow-up and follow-through – must be able to adhere to process.
Excellent interpersonal skills, able to deal effectively with diverse skill sets and personalities and also work effectively as a team player.
Self-motivated, proactive, disciplined, fast learner and organized with impeccable attention to detail.
Highly flexible and adaptive to a rapidly changing environment and juggling of competing priorities.
U.S. citizenship or authorization to work legally in the U.S.
Preferred Requirements:
Experience with a range of statistical and data mining tools and techniques, market research, predictive modeling and customer segmentation.
Previous work experience in consumer services/products and or subscription-based businesses.
Experience with direct-to-consumer transactional databases generated through a wide range of publishing and direct marketing activities.
Experience working in a consultative user/client facing role.
Exposure to data related to Google Analytics, ad networks and other industry related API feeds of data.
For internal candidates, a strong understanding as a frontend user of our current applications and systems (InfoBase, Qlikview, IRIS, Advantage, Message Central, OPIUM, Sign-Up App, etc.)

title: Cryptographic Vulnerability Analyst
desc:
Job description
                    
Responsibilities





The professionals at the National Security Agency (NSA) have one common goal: to protect our nation.  The mission requires a strong offense and a steadfast defense.  The offense collects, processes and disseminates intelligence information derived from foreign signals for intelligence and counterintelligence purposes.  The defense prevents adversaries from gaining access to sensitive classified national security information. Do you want to build Cyber capabilities and capacity to enable national security operations? Do you want to be at the forefront of Cyber defense, tackling a complex mission to protect against the threats of today and tomorrow? If so, NSA is the place for you!Cryptographic Vulnerability Analysts play a critical role in enabling security solutions by:- identifying vulnerabilities of and attacks to cryptographic systems - comparing and contrasting various cryptographic attack techniques - producing formal and informal reports, briefings and perspectives - analyzing data using mathematical/statistical methods- conducting security evaluations- developing countermeasures to address cryptographic vulnerabilities- designing, evaluating or modifying encryption schemes or algorithmThe ideal candidate is someone with strong problem-solving, analytic, communication and interpersonal skills who is/can:- motivated - flexible- innovative- work effectively across in diverse environments- well-organized- handle multiple assignments





Qualifications





Salary Range: $68,586 - $85,464 (Entry Level/Developmental)*The qualifications listed are the minimum acceptable to be considered for the position. Salary offers are based on candidates' education level and years of experience relevant to the position and also take into account information provided by the hiring manager/organization regarding the work level for the position. Entry is with a Bachelor's degree and no experience. An Associate's degree plus 2 years of relevant experience may be considered for individuals with in-depth experience that is clearly related to the position.Degree must be in Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science or include 2 years (i.e., 24 credit hours) of advanced mathematics.Relevant experience must be in the design, development, use and evaluation of mathematics models, methods, or techniques (e.g., cryptographic algorithms) to study issues and solve problems; information/cyber/network security; vulnerability analysis; penetration testing; computer forensics; and/or information assurance. Completion of military training in a relevant area such as JCAC (Joint Cyber Analysis course), Undergraduate Cyber Training (UCT), Network Warfare Bridge Course (NWBC)/Intermediate Network Warfare Training (INWT), Cyber Defense Operations will be considered towards the relevant experience requirement (i.e., 20-24 weeks course will count as 6 months of experience, 10-14 weeks will count as 3 months of experience).Salary Range:  $79,334 - $105,663 (Full Performance)*The qualifications listed are the minimum acceptable to be considered for the position. Salary offers are based on candidates' education level and years of experience relevant to the position and also take into account information provided by the hiring manager/organization regarding the work level for the position. Entry is with a Bachelor's degree plus 3 years of relevant experience, or a Master's degree plus 1 year of relevant experience, or a Doctoral degree and no experience. An Associate's degree plus 5 years of relevant experience may be considered for individuals with in-depth experience that is clearly related to the position.Degree must be in Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science or include 2 years (i.e., 24 credit hours) of advanced mathematics.Relevant experience must be in the design, development, use and evaluation of mathematics models, methods, or techniques (e.g., cryptographic algorithms) to study issues and solve problems; and in vulnerability analysis, penetration testing, or computer forensics. In addition, may include information/cyber/network security and/or information assurance. Completion of military training in a relevant area such as JCAC (Joint Cyber Analysis course), Undergraduate Cyber Training (UCT), Network Warfare Bridge Course (NWBC)/Intermediate Network Warfare Training (INWT), Cyber Defense Operations will be considered towards the relevant experience requirement (i.e., 20-24 weeks course will count as 6 months of experience, 10-14 weeks will count as 3 months of experience).
